event.name: TEST_BATTLE
event.text: Oh no, the ship!

event.name: START_BEACON
event.text: This text is ignored unless you call this event somewhere other than when starting a game.

event.name: TEST_ENGI_SHIP_FIGHT
event.text: One Engi ship, coming right up!
Should be a random Engi ship here... attacking you!

event.name: REMOVAL_TEST
event.text: Oh no! Not the combat drone!

event.name: REMOVAL_TEST_TULLY_BOX
event.text: This is a test event for removing the Storage Box 'Tully' augment.

choice.text: (Tully Box) Remove and get an augment at the same time.

event.text: Removed Tully Box and random augment given at the same time.

choice.text: (Tully Box) Remove, then get an augment later.

event.text: Removed, random augment will be given soon.
Here is your random augment! Thanks for waiting!

event.name: CHARACTER_TEST
event.text:
АБВГДЕЁЖЗИЙКЛМНОПРСТУФХЦЧШЩЪЫЬЭЮЯ абвгдеёжзийклмнопрстуфхцчшщъыьэюя ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz 1234567890+-—""«» { fuel | drones } missiles ~ scrap $ repair

event.name: BOARDER_TEST
event.text: Oh no, the opponents!

event.name: TEST_EVENT
event.text: This looks good...
Kaboom ship damage!!

event.name: TEST_EVENT2
event.text: Limited Systems!

event.name: TEST_EVENT3
event.text: Quest.

event.name: TEST_EVENT4
event.text: Test death.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: You take a hopeful trip to the Clone Bay, and to your relief a clone is already prepared for the lost crew member.

event.text: As your ship is under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

event.name: TEST_EVENT5
event.text: Test traitor.

event.name: TEST_EVENT6
event.text: Looks good...
KABOOM! Damage ship!
Freebie!
Freebie!

event.name: FREE_NANO
event.text: FREE NANO!

event.name: FREE_AUG
event.text: FREE AUG!

event.name: CRYSTAL_TEST
event.text: Testing Crystal Teleport.

event.name: STALEMATE_SURRENDER
event.text: The ship suddenly disables their weapons. There's no explanation and they don't respond to hails. It seems during the battle they lost some fuel cells from their storage. Continue the fight?

choice.text: Pick up the fuel and fly away.

event.text: You quickly pick up the fuel and fly away from the battlefield.

event.name: TUTORIAL_START
event.text: Welcome to FTL! You are the captain of a Federation starship on a very important mission.
The Federation is currently being torn apart by vicious Rebels. Your ship is carrying data vital to the defense of the Federation.
You will be traveling through dangerous sectors of the galaxy with the Rebel fleet in hot pursuit. Make it to the exit beacon of each sector before the Rebels can catch you.

event.name: TUTORIAL_MISSILE
event.text: Looks like you need some more help to get through his shields! Some events can provide items. This one is providing you with an Artemis Missile Launcher.

event.name: TUTORIAL_ENEMY
event.text: Every new location will have an event like this. You might have multiple choices available to you at an event. In this example, a weak pirate ship is trying to destroy you.

choice.text: Special BLUE choices like these are unlocked by having certain upgrades or equipment. They are nearly always a good choice.

destroyed.text: You destroyed the pirate ship. As salvage, you gain (from left to right) some Fuel, Missiles, Scrap and another weapon! Note the reward resource icons correspond to your reserves along the top of the screen.

deadCrew.text: You killed all of the pirates! As salvage, you gain (from left to right) some Fuel, Missiles, Scrap and another weapon! Note the reward resource icons correspond to your reserves along the top of the screen.

event.name: TOO_MANY_CREW
event.text: Your ship cannot support any more active crew-members. You apologize and leave the extra crew at the nearest friendly outpost. They pay you for your troubles.

textList.name: START_BEACON
textList.text: Welcome to a new sector! Get to the exit beacon and jump to the next sector before the pursuing Rebels catch you!
You have come to a civilian sector. The Rebels have not yet had time to get to these places, and you can catch your breath. Try to make your stay here as useful as possible.
There has never been a war in this sector. It is very well possible that your arrival here will bring a variety of local destruction to its planets. Do you really expect to get a friendly welcome?

The civilian sector has remained relatively peaceful so far, but with the arrival of the Rebels that will change. All that you can do now is to keep moving and do everything possible to save the Federation.
Scattered Federation forces still remain, supporting relative safety in this sector. Perhaps one of them will help you.
The war has avoided this place for now, and the local people would certainly like for it to continue that way...
You've arrived in civilian space. The Rebels have not yet reached these places, so it's relatively quiet and peaceful, but that's not a reason to relax.

event.name: START_BEACON_TRADE_ITEMS
event.text: The automated trader at this beacon is willing to sell you supplies at reduced prices.

event.name: TRADE_ITEMS_START
event.text: Choose how many supplies you want.
You make the trade deal and prepare to jump.
You make the trade deal and prepare to jump.
You make the trade deal and prepare to jump.

textList.name: START_BEACON_TRADE
textList.text: Welcome to the commercial sector! The level of danger is minimal, but that doesn't mean you should relax.
You arrive in the commercial sector. Local shops beckon with their advertisements, urging you to spend your accumulated scrap.
You arrive in the commercial sector. Although the Rebels will continue to pursue you, you can breathe a little more freely here.

event.name: FINISH_BEACON
event.text: You fly to the long-range beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged, you can jump to the next sector.

event.name: FINISH_BEACON_NEBULA
event.text: This Long-Range Beacon is almost hidden within a nebula. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.

textList.name: FINISH_BEACON_NEBULA_ORIGINAL
textList.text: Nebulas are known for their mysterious swirls of gas. Maybe you'll find something in this one...
Ripples in the gas clouds ahead look quite beautiful. Scans might reveal even better views...
Filled with all sorts of gases, nebulas often find themselves the subject of science vessels. Perhaps a scan of this particular one might reveal something of interest?
This particular nebula is making you uneasy. A closer look ought to allay your worries...
Nebula clouds never cease their constant swirling patterns, but you think you just saw something else moving out there...
Pirates have been known to ambush travelers, especially in nebulas. Doing a cautionary scan couldn't possibly hurt...
Often times you'll find the wrecks of ships hidden among nebula clouds, drifting along their currents. It'd never hurt to scan and see if there are any here...

choice.text: Reroute power to the short-range scanners.
Reroute power to your basic sensor array.
Reroute power to your improved sensor grid.
Reroute power to your highly advanced sensors.

event.text: No one else seems to be lurking in this nebula. Relieved, you calmly prepare to jump away.
In the nebula all is still, quiet, and peaceful. You prepare to make a leap into the next sector.
This nebula is too dense for your scanners, rendering them completely useless. Despite being unable to see anything around, nothing happens. You give the order to jump.

The scanners don't work here, so you don't see anything around. Suddenly a blow is dealt to the ship! You get ready for an attack, only to find some drifting wreckage. You manage to salvage a few supplies.
You turn scanners on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a few fuel tanks aboard.
You turn scanners on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a few serviceable missiles aboard.
You turn scanners on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a few drone parts aboard.
You turn scanners on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a few supplies aboard.
Suddenly, you see a pirate ship zipping towards you... looks like they're coming in for a collision course! At the last second, they make a turn to move out of the way, and prepare to attack you.
No one else seems to be lurking in this nebula. Relieved, you calmly prepare to jump away.
In the nebula all is still, quiet, and peaceful. You prepare to make a leap into the next sector.

The sensors don't work here, so you don't see anything around. Suddenly a blow is dealt to the ship! You get ready for an attack, only to find some drifting wreckage. You manage to salvage a few supplies.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a few fuel tanks aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a few serviceable missiles aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a few drone parts aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a few supplies aboard.
Suddenly, you see a pirate ship zipping towards you... looks like they're coming in for a collision course! At the last second, they make a turn to move out of the way, and prepare to attack you.
No one else seems to be lurking in this nebula. Relieved, you calmly prepare to jump away.

The sensors don't work here, so you don't see anything around. Suddenly a blow is dealt to the ship! You get ready for an attack, only to find some drifting wreckage. You manage to salvage some supplies.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find some fuel tanks aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find some serviceable missiles aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find some drone parts aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find some supplies aboard.
Suddenly, you see a pirate ship zipping towards you... looks like they're coming in for a collision course! At the last second, they make a turn to move out of the way, and prepare to attack you.

The sensors don't work here, so you don't see anything around. Suddenly a blow is dealt to the ship! You get ready for an attack, only to find some drifting wreckage. You manage to salvage a decent amount of supplies.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a stash of fuel tanks aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a stash of serviceable missiles aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a stash of drone parts aboard.
You turn sensors on full power while your FTL Drive charges. By some miracle, they spot the remains of a ship floating by. You find a stash of supplies aboard.
Suddenly, you see a pirate ship zipping towards you... looks like they're coming in for a collision course! At the last second, they make a turn to move out of the way, and prepare to attack you.

event.name: FLEET_EASY_OLD
event.text: The Rebel fleet has found you, and a nearby scout turns to engage. The cruisers in the distance are firing on you!

event.name: FLEET_EASY_DLC_OLD
event.text: The Rebel fleet has found you, and a nearby scout turns to engage. The cruisers in the distance are firing on you!

event.name: ELITE_DANGEROUS
event.text: A strangely colored Rebel ship overtakes you. You notice how well it is armed... It seems that their weapons array has an enhanced titanium coating!

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you quickly grab what equipment survived the battle.

deadCrew.text: With the ship lifeless, you quickly grab what equipment survived the battle.

event.name: FLEET_EASY_BEACON_OLD
event.text: You've found the exit beacon but the Rebels got here first! You must survive long enough to be able to charge up the FTL Drive and escape to the next sector.

event.name: ELITE_DANGEROUS_BEACON
event.text: You've found the exit beacon but a strangely colored Rebel ship overtakes you. It seems that their weapons system has an enhanced titanium coating! You must survive long enough to be able to charge up the FTL Drive and escape to the next sector.

event.name: FLEET_EASY_BEACON_DLC_OLD
event.text: You've found the exit beacon but the Rebels got here first! You must survive long enough to be able to charge up the FTL Drive and escape to the next sector.

event.name: ELITE_DANGEROUS_BEACON_DLC
event.text: You've found the exit beacon but a strangely colored Rebel ship overtakes you. It seems that their weapons system has an enhanced titanium coating! You must survive long enough to be able to charge up the FTL Drive and escape to the next sector.

event.name: FLEET_HARD_OLD
event.text: The Rebel fleet has found you, and a nearby scout turns to engage. You must flee before their cruisers open fire!

event.name: ELITE_DANGEROUS_HARD
event.text: The Rebel fleet has caught up with you! A strangely colored Rebel ship moves in to intercept. It seems that their weapons system has an enhanced titanium coating! You must flee the system before the Rebel cruisers open fire!

textList.name: NOTHING
textList.text: Your jump leads you to nothing but empty space. This Jump Beacon serves no purpose other than as a connection.
You jump into an unremarkable system. No life signs detected within scanning range.
Your scans reveal a mining base on a nearby planet long since abandoned. No life signs detected.
Your scans reveal an ore refinery and several factories, all standing still and empty. No life signs detected.
You discover a nearby planet speckled with settlements, although none respond to your hails.
This beacon has been built for a nearby civilian space-station. No one hails your ship.

The nearby planet shows sign of habitation and great beauty. A rudimentary automated planetary defense system is looping its message into space: "Warning! Quarantine Level 5 in effect under FHA Act 22, article 11.2. Warning! Quarantine Level 5..."
Your jump leads to a completely unremarkable binary star system. There is nothing else around.
Your jump leads to a remarkable binary star system. The view is beautiful, but there is nothing else around.

event.name: TALK_WITH_CREW_AI_SHIP
event.text: There isn't anyone to talk to. However, the ship's AI can be transferred into a holographic avatar, who will serve aboard your ship. However, this will require some resources.

choice.text: Create a hologram emitter out of various resources.

event.text: A short time later, the embodiment of your ship's AI materializes from the newly made holo-emitter, in the form of an Avatar crew member.

event.name: TALK_WITH_CREW
event.text: You decide to speak with a member of your crew while the FTL Drive charges to jump to the next beacon.

choice.text: (Morph Analyzer) Instruct the crew to scan the surrounding area.

event.name: TALK_WITH_CREW_HUMAN
event.text: You decide to speak with a member of your crew while you wait for the FTL Drive to charge in order to jump to the next beacon.

choice.text: (Morph Analyzer) Instruct the crew to scan the surrounding area.

event.text: You decide to speak with a member of your crew while you wait for the FTL Drive to charge in order to jump to the next beacon.

event.text: You decide to speak with a member of your crew while you wait for the FTL Drive to charge in order to jump to the next beacon.

choice.text: (человек Ордена Crew Member) Talk to your человеком.
(Morph Analyzer) Instruct the crew to scan the surrounding area.

event.name: TALK_WITH_CREW_CRYSTAL
event.text: You decide to speak with a member of your crew while you wait for the FTL Drive to charge in order to jump to the next beacon.

choice.text: (Order Human Crew Member) Talk to your человеком.
(Morph Analyzer) Instruct the crew to scan the surrounding area.

event.name: TALK_WITH_CREW_GHOST
event.text: You decide to speak with a member of your crew while you wait for the FTL Drive to charge in order to jump to the next beacon.

choice.text: (Order Human Crew Member) Talk to your человеком.
(Morph Analyzer) Instruct the crew to scan the surrounding area.

event.text: The analyzer reports that there is a warehouse with equipment at the nearby beacon. Threat level: 00. Mark this place on the map?
You mark the location and turn the analyzer off.
The analyzer reports that there is a warehouse with equipment at the nearby beacon. Threat level: 01. Mark this place on the map?
You mark the location and turn the analyzer off.
The analyzer reports that there is a warehouse with equipment at the nearby beacon. Threat level: 10. Mark this place on the map?
You mark the location and turn the analyzer off.
The analyzer reports that there is a warehouse with equipment at the nearby beacon. Threat level: 11. Mark this place on the map?
You mark the location and turn the analyzer off.
The analyzer doesn't find anything useful nearby. However, it was able to reveal information about this sector's beacons.

textList.name: NOTHING_SHIPRADAR2_TEXT
textList.text: The analyzer doesn't find anything useful nearby. However, it sounds pretty funny when it buzzes!
The analyzer doesn't find anything useful nearby. However, it shines beautifully in the rays of the stars!
The analyzer doesn't find anything useful nearby.

event.name: SHIPRADAR2_RAND_00
event.text: You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. No one's around, so you rob a warehouse of equipment.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. Despite the dangerous environment, you rob the nearby warehouse of equipment.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. Despite the dangerous environment, you rob the nearby warehouse of equipment.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. Despite the dangerous environment, you rob the nearby warehouse of equipment.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. A hostile ship rushes towards you! Looks like it's the warehouse's security detail.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. A hostile ship rushes towards you! Looks like it's the warehouse's security detail.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. A hostile ship rushes towards you! Looks like it's the warehouse's security detail.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. A hostile ship rushes towards you! Looks like it's the warehouse's security detail.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. A hostile ship rushes towards you! Looks like it's the warehouse's security detail.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. A hostile ship rushes towards you! Looks like it's the warehouse's security detail.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. A hostile ship rushes towards you! Looks like it's the warehouse's security detail.
You arrive at the place specified by the analyzer. A hostile ship rushes towards you! Looks like it's the warehouse's security detail.

event.name: DESTROYED_SECURITY
event.text: With the ship destroyed, you gather its wreckage...
...having done this, you rob the nearby warehouse of equipment.

event.name: DEADCREW_SECURITY
event.text: With the ship's crew dead, you clear out its holds...
...having done this, you rob the nearby warehouse of equipment.

textList.name: NOTHING2_HUMAN_TEXT
textList.text: You go to talk with your human crew member, but they decided to take a nap while the FTL Drive charges. You don't want to wake them up.
You ask your human crew member if they have any wishes for improving life on board the ship. They find that everything suits them well enough.
You try to find your human crew member, but they decided to take a bathroom break while the FTL Drive charges. Seeing as they are 'occupied', you decide against disturbing them.
You go to talk with your human crew member, but they diligently avoid meeting you. It seems they're ashamed of something...
You go to talk with your human crew member, but they refuse to talk, as they are on their lunch break.
You enthusiastically discuss recent events with your human crew member until the ping of the ship's computer echoes, indicating that the FTL Drive is done charging.
You go to talk with your human crew member, but they are smoking some incredibly smelly mixture. Better some other time...

You go to talk with your human crew member. Throughout the entire conversation, they complain about their injuries, their bruises and pain in their stomach. Perhaps it would be worth improving the living conditions on the ship.
You find your human crew member playing some kind of 'bullet-hell' video game. After giving them a couple of tips, you go back to your duties.
You find your human crew member playing a catchy tune from some advertisement on their harmonica. After listening for a while (and getting the song stuck in your head), you return to your duties.
Your human says they were a janitor on their previous ship. They're satisfied with their present job, and manage themselves well.
You go to talk to your human, but you find them cleaning the keyboard on the dashboard. You don't disturb them.
You find your human doing something very obscene. They beg of you not to tell anyone about this, and you leave confused...
The human says that they miss their native planet, and recently dreamed of the grass on the lawn in front of their house...
Your human tells you that they have begun to make notches on the hull to mark the number of ships defeated.
Your human says that it wouldn't hurt to clean the devices that they work on. They seem to be hinting at the rest of the crew...
Your human informs you that after the last incident they keep a small respirator in their pocket — "just in case".
Your human complains that they've never found a restroom on the ship, which created some 'difficulties' for them in the last battle.

event.name: NOTHING2_HUMAN_GOOD
event.text: You find your human crew member tinkering with a pile of salvaged electronics. They manage to reassemble a few drone parts from the old microchips.

event.name: NOTHING2_HUMAN_BEST
event.text: You find your human crew member tinkering with a pile of salvaged electronics. They manage to reassemble several drone parts from the old microchips.

event.name: NOTHING2_ORDER_HUMAN_GOOD
event.text: You find your human crew member tinkering with a pile of salvaged electronics. Grinning, they show you what they've crafted — an Order weapon!

textList.name: NOTHING2_ENGI_TEXT
textList.text: You go to talk to your Engi crew member, but they are busy setting up the system they manage. Better not to distract them.
You go to your Engi crew member and find them in the process of scanning for viruses. Yes, they too sometimes need to undergo preventive maintenance.
You approach your Engi crew member, but they are busy welding one of their limbs. It's unclear whether it's repair or improvement, but it's probably best not to distract them.
You come to your Engi crew member, but they are fascinated with calculating the optimal path for FTL jumps. After completing the analysis, they advise you to exercise precaution.
You come to your Engi crew member, but they are fascinated with calculating the optimal path for FTL jumps. After completing the analysis, they advise you to take some chances.
You go to your Engi crew member and find that they are carefully examining the screen, filled with zeros and ones. You don't understand anything about this, so you return to your duties.
You come to your Engi crew member, but find that they are connected to the internal electronic system of the ship and don't react to external stimuli.
You find your Engi crew member in the weapons room. They assure you that they have corrected the guidance system, so now the weapons will more accurately hit their targets.
You find your Engi crew member in the engines room. They claim to have optimized some circuits, making the engines give off less waste into outer space.

You go to your Engi crew member, but find there's no one in the room. Suddenly, a nearby chair begins to transform, and the Engi returns to their usual form. Quite frightened, you ask them not to do that again.
The Engi claims that they analyzed the latest events and found the root cause of all problems on the ship. However, their ethics module doesn't allow them to voice it.
You go into the room the Engi is in and find them watching the video archive of the previous battles. They give you a couple of recommendations, and then you go back to your post.
The Engi asks you a series of standard questions from their internal catalog of communicating with humanoids. You answer them, and, apparently, this can be considered a conversation held.
Your Engi reports: "01001000 01101001 00101100 00100000 01100011 01100001 01110000 01110100 00101110". You pretend to understand them, before returning to your post.
Your Engi reports that they updated your monitor's video card. It's not going to help save the Federation, but it's good news.

event.name: NOTHING2_ENGI_GOOD
event.text: The Engi is busy inspecting the damage to the ship's hull. After some time, they manage to patch it up a bit.

event.name: NOTHING2_ENGI_BEST
event.text: The Engi is busy inspecting the damage to the ship's hull. After some time, they manage to patch it up a bit.

textList.name: NOTHING2_MORPH_TEXT
textList.text: You go to talk to your Morph crew member, but they are busy setting up the system they manage. Better not to distract them.
You go to your Morph crew member and find them in the process of scanning for viruses. Yes, they too sometimes need to undergo preventive maintenance.
You approach your Morph crew member, but they are busy welding one of their limbs. It's unclear whether it's repair or improvement, but it's probably best not to distract them.
You come to your Morph crew member, but they are fascinated with calculating the optimal path for FTL jumps. After completing the analysis, they advise you to exercise precaution.
You come to your Morph crew member, but they are fascinated with calculating the optimal path for FTL jumps. After completing the analysis, they advise you to take some chances.
You go to your Morph crew member and find that they are carefully examining the screen, filled with zeros and ones. You don't understand anything about this, so you return to your duties.
You come to your Morph crew member, but find that they are connected to the internal electronic system of the ship and don't react to external stimuli.
You find your Morph crew member in the weapons room. They assure you that they have corrected the guidance system, so now the weapons will more accurately hit their targets.
You find your Morph crew member in the engines room. They claim to have optimized some circuits, making the engines give off less waste into outer space.

You go to your Morph crew member, but find there's no one in the room. Suddenly, a nearby chair begins to transform, and the Morph returns to their usual form. Quite frightened, you ask them not to do that again.
The Morph claims that they analyzed the latest events and found the root cause of all problems on the ship. However, their ethics module doesn't allow them to voice it.
You go into the room the Morph is in and find them watching the video archive of the previous battles. They give you a couple of recommendations, and then you go back to your post.
The Morph asks you a series of standard questions from their internal catalog of communicating with humanoids. You answer them, and, apparently, this can be considered a conversation held.
Your Morph reports: "01001000 01101001 00101100 00100000 01100011 01100001 01110000 01110100 00101110". You pretend to understand them, before returning to your post.
Your Morph reports that they updated your monitor's video card. It's not going to help save the Federation, but it's good news.

event.name: NOTHING2_MORPH_GOOD
event.text: The Morph is enthusiastically building something out of a pile of scrap and the drone part remains. Finally, they show you what they made — a brand new injector!

textList.name: NOTHING2_ENERGY_TEXT
textList.text: This time your Zoltan is somehow glowing particularly bright. You decide not to bother them.
You approach the Zoltan, but their aura blinds your eyes. You postpone the conversation for later.
The Zoltan tells you some details about their anatomy. You find such details were better left unknown.
You find your Zoltan turning on and off their system's equipment with a flick of their fingers. Seeing you, they pretend to work.
You find your Zoltan lying in a hammock in the middle of the room. Seeing you, they jump up and pretend to work.
Your Zoltan claims that they recently called their relatives, and they promised to bring useful equipment to the nearest store in this sector.

Having seen you, the Zoltan hides something quickly behind their back. Realizing that it is pointless to hide, they give you an open bottle of Zoltan grog. After reprimanding them, you take the grog and go to your quarters.
The Zoltan asks you to install a treadmill in their compartment. You promise to buy simulators in the nearest store... if there is extra scrap.
The Zoltan is entertaining themselves by changing the level of illumination in the room with their aura. Seeing you, they embarrassingly turn on normal lighting.
You find your Zoltan performing squats. They say that their legs are completely numb from sitting in the same place.
You find the Zoltan shining through the ventilation ducts. They claim that there was a rat on the ship.
Your Zoltan says there's a lot of illegal equipment on your ship, and that their people would never let you into their sector.
Your Zoltan shows you some LED bulbs they recently purchased from the store. Illuminating them one by one, they arrange a small light show for the crew.

event.name: NOTHING2_ENERGY_GOOD
event.text: Your Zoltan goes to the reactor, and now their aura glows so red-hot that it is impossible to look at. Suddenly, the glow subsides, and the reactor gets a boost of surplus energy.

textList.name: NOTHING2_ENERGYX_TEXT
textList.text: This time your Zolton is somehow glowing particularly bright. You decide not to bother them.
You approach the Zolton, but their aura blinds your eyes. You postpone the conversation for later.
The Zolton tells you some details about their anatomy. You find such details were better left unknown.
You find your Zolton turning on and off their system's equipment with a flick of their fingers. Seeing you, they pretend to work.
You find your Zolton lying in a hammock in the middle of the room. Seeing you, they jump up and pretend to work.
Your Zolton claims that they recently called their relatives, and they promised to bring useful equipment to the nearest store in this sector.

Having seen you, the Zolton hides something quickly behind their back. Realizing that it is pointless to hide, they give you an open bottle of Zolton grog. After reprimanding them, you take the grog and go to your quarters.
The Zolton asks you to install a treadmill in their compartment. You promise to buy simulators in the nearest store... if there is extra scrap.
The Zolton is entertaining themselves by changing the level of illumination in the room with their aura. Seeing you, they embarrassingly turn on normal lighting.
You find your Zolton performing squats. They say that their legs are completely numb from sitting in the same place.
You find the Zolton shining through the ventilation ducts. They claim that there was a rat on the ship.
Your Zolton says there's a lot of illegal equipment on your ship, and that their people would never let you into their sector.
Your Zolton shows you some LED bulbs they recently purchased from the store. Illuminating them one by one, they arrange a small light show for the crew.

event.name: NOTHING2_ENERGYX_GOOD
event.text: Вы заходите в комнату к золтонцу и видите, как он что-то делает со сломанной пушкой, которую он достал из кучи лома. Золтонец направляет на неё силу своей ауры и получает функционирующее ионное орудие!

textList.name: NOTHING2_MANTIS_TEXT
textList.text: It seems that the Mantis is out of sorts, grinding their teeth, making terrible sounds. You dare not risk going to them now.
The Mantis does not understand what you want from them. Yes, it's sometimes difficult to communicate with representatives of this race...
The Mantis is scratching the metal floor of their room for some reason. On your attempt to start a conversation, they make terrible sounds...
You find the mantis eating some great insect, a bit like a fly. On your attempt to start a conversation, they make terrible sounds...
Seeing you, the Mantis stands in a fighting stance and grinds their teeth. Looks like now is not the best time to talk...
You find the Mantis making ridiculous attempts to hold a wrench. Noticing you, they immediately throw it on the floor and become aggressive.

The Mantis is engaged in strange things. It seems that they are trying to keep a fire extinguisher in between their pincers, but it keeps falling. When they see you, they start to ominously grind their teeth, so you quickly leave.
The Mantis is standing motionlessly stiff and does not respond to your greeting. You go away.
The Mantis is busy sharpening its already quite sharp claws. You decide not to disturb them.
Your Mantis took a basket of fruit from the kitchen and is amusing themselves by throwing the fruit and cutting them in half in the air.

You find the Mantis with a book in their front limbs. Seeing you, they involuntarily squeeze them, and the book is cut into several parts. The Mantis is infuriated, and you decide to talk some other time.
You catch the Mantis sitting still on the dashboard. With a quick jerk, they trie to grab you with their forelegs, but you close the compartment's door just in time.
The Mantis grinds their forelegs about a wooden board. Seeing you, they make hissing, chirping sounds. Best not bother them...
Your Mantis is taking turns to clean all of their limbs, and ignores your attempts to strike a conversation.

event.name: NOTHING2_MANTIS_GOOD
event.text: Your Mantis offers to use an old broken rescue capsule to divert the Rebels' attention from your ship. You give the order to launch it in the direction of the Fleet; this should delay them.

event.name: NOTHING2_MANTIS_BEST
event.text: Your Mantis offers to use an old broken rescue capsule to divert the Rebels' attention from your ship. You give the order to launch it in the direction of the Fleet; this should delay them.

textList.name: NOTHING2_SLUG_TEXT
textList.text: The Slug pretends to be very busy. Well, you did not really want to talk to them anyways.
You were on your way to the Slug, but then you imagined how dirty you would get again from its secretions... Maybe some other time...

You come up to the Slug, when suddenly you realize that you are in a forest glade. After a little walk, you fall asleep among the flowers. And when you wake up, you are again on the ship. Your entire form is now covered with some stinky slime. What was it?..
The Slug evasively answers all your inquiries and slithers off to another part of the ship.
As soon as you open the door to the Slug, some disgusting smelly liquid splashes into your face. It would probably have been worth it to tell them about your visit beforehand...
You find your Slug in the fuel storage bay. They justify that they were checking to see if there were any harmful impurities in the fuel, after which they quickly slither away.
You find your Slug twisting a piece of the ship's plating. They justify that they were checking the tension of the bolts, after which they quickly slither away.
You find your Slug stuck to the room's wall. They are clearly upset about something, so you leave them be.
The Slug tries to clean its own mucus from the dashboard, but only smears it even more. You reluctantly help them, and then go to wash off while the engine charges.
The Slug is engaged in polishing their collection of dark glasses. You did not even know that they had such a hobby.
Entering the room, you slip on some slime and painfully land with your face flat on the floor. The Slug joyfully laughs and squelches its facial processes. You hobble back for pain relief ointment.
You find the Slug puffing a huge bubble of mucus. The bubble bursts with a crash and splashes the entire room with a stinky liquid. You go wash your uniform before the next jump.
You find the Slug twisting something off a missile warhead. They make an excuse that they were checking if the explosive was a dud before slithering away.
You find the Slug trying to pull the wires out of the dashboard. They make an excuse that they were removing the unnecessary parts from it, and ask you not to disturb them for no reason...

You see that the Slug is decanting its mucus into a canister, and about a dozen such capsules have accumulated in the room. Seeing you, the Slug tries to hide everything before slithering off to another part of the ship.

You see the Slug sticking photos of their relatives on the walls of the room. The images are quite nauseating, and instead of glue or some other adhesive, they use their own mucus. You decide to hold off conversation with the Slug until another time...

You are going to see the Slug, but suddenly you realize that all this time they were behind you, touching your head with their sticky limb. Realizing that you've noticed their presence, the Slug quickly slithers to their workplace, obviously not going to explain anything of their actions...

The Slug responds very negatively to your last combat decision, which nearly led to the collapse of the whole operation to save the Federation. After the conversation, you go back to your post, with something to think about.
You go to talk to the Slug and find them behind a pile of pimples covering their slimy skin. The sight is extremely nauseating.. unable to stand it, you return to your post.
The Slug praises you as a commander, convinced that the Rebels don't stand a chance in their fight against the Federation. After this pleasant conversation, you go back to your post.
The Slug hints to you that there are some useless life forms aboard your ship and that it's best to get rid of them. After this rather unpleasant conversation, you go back to your post.
The Slug tells you some popular Slurm recipes. After a brief conversation, you start to feel sick, but, restraining yourself, you return to your station.
The Slug crawls through the room with a tape measure and complains that they don't have enough space on your ship.
The Slug tells you in detail how sick they were after the previous FTL jump. After hearing a bit of it, you stop listening and return to your post.

event.name: NOTHING2_SLUG_GOOD
event.text: You enter the Slug's room at the moment when they are trying to hide something in their personal storage. Realizing that they were caught, they give you a few fuel tanks. "Thesse are the emergency ressservess, I mysself gathered them after the lassst battle..." This Slug needs to be monitored more closely.

event.name: NOTHING2_SLUG_BEST
event.text: You enter the Slug's room at the moment when they are trying to hide something in their personal storage. Realizing that they were caught, they give you a few fuel tanks. "Thesse are the emergency ressservess, I mysself gathered them after the lassst battle..." This Slug needs to be monitored more closely.

textList.name: NOTHING2_SLIG_TEXT
textList.text: The Slig pretends to be very busy. Well, you did not really want to talk to them anyways.
You were on your way to the Slig, but then you imagined how dirty you would get again from its secretions... Maybe some other time...

You come up to the Slig, when suddenly you realize that you are in a forest glade. After a little walk, you fall asleep among the flowers. And when you wake up, you are again on the ship. Your entire form is now covered with some stinky slime. What was it?..
The Slig evasively answers all your inquiries and slithers off to another part of the ship.
As soon as you open the door to the Slig, some disgusting smelly liquid splashes into your face. It would probably have been worth it to tell them about your visit beforehand...
You find your Slig in the fuel storage bay. They justify that they were checking to see if there were any harmful impurities in the fuel, after which they quickly slither away.
You find your Slig twisting a piece of the ship's plating. They justify that they were checking the tension of the bolts, after which they quickly slither away.
You find your Slig stuck to the room's wall. They are clearly upset about something, so you leave them be.
The Slig tries to clean its own mucus from the dashboard, but only smears it even more. You reluctantly help them, and then go to wash off while the engine charges.
The Slig is engaged in polishing their collection of dark glasses. You did not even know that they had such a hobby.
Entering the room, you slip on some slime and painfully land with your face flat on the floor. The Slig joyfully laughs and squelches its facial processes. You hobble back for pain relief ointment.
You find the Slig puffing a huge bubble of mucus. The bubble bursts with a crash and splashes the entire room with a stinky liquid. You go wash your uniform before the next jump.
You find the Slig twisting something off a missile warhead. They make an excuse that they were checking if the explosive was a dud before slithering away.
You find the Slig trying to pull the wires out of the dashboard. They make an excuse that they were removing the unnecessary parts from it, and ask you not to disturb them for no reason...

You see that the Slig is decanting its mucus into a canister, and about a dozen such capsules have accumulated in the room. Seeing you, the Slig tries to hide everything before slithering off to another part of the ship.

You see the Slig sticking photos of their relatives on the walls of the room. The images are quite nauseating, and instead of glue or some other adhesive, they use their own mucus. You decide to hold off conversation with the Slig until another time...

You are going to see the Slig, but suddenly you realize that all this time they were behind you, touching your head with their sticky limb. Realizing that you've noticed their presence, the Slig quickly slithers to their workplace, obviously not going to explain anything of their actions...

The Slig responds very negatively to your last combat decision, which nearly led to the collapse of the whole operation to save the Federation. After the conversation, you go back to your post, with something to think about.
You go to talk to the Slig and find them behind a pile of pimples covering their slimy skin. The sight is extremely nauseating.. unable to stand it, you return to your post.
The Slig praises you as a commander, convinced that the Rebels don't stand a chance in their fight against the Federation. After this pleasant conversation, you go back to your post.
The Slig hints to you that there are some useless life forms aboard your ship and that it's best to get rid of them. After this rather unpleasant conversation, you go back to your post.
The Slig tells you some popular Slurm recipes. After a brief conversation, you start to feel sick, but, restraining yourself, you return to your station.
The Slig crawls through the room with a tape measure and complains that they don't have enough space on your ship.
The Slig tells you in detail how sick they were after the previous FTL jump. After hearing a bit of it, you stop listening and return to your post.

event.name: NOTHING2_SLIG_GOOD
event.text: You enter the Slig's room right when they start to sip Slurm straight from the keg. "It'ss brewed to the ssspecificationssss of my grandmother'sss recccipe, go on, try ssssome..." You take the barrel and walk away.

textList.name: NOTHING2_ROCK_TEXT
textList.text: You go to your Rock crew member, but they stand as stiff as a piece of stone and don't respond to external stimuli. They must be asleep.
You go to your Rockman. The large bulky being looks quite impressive. After chatting for a couple minutes about different things, you go to the bridge and give the order to jump.
You come to your Rockman. They are busy cleaning moss from their back. Perhaps, it would be better to postpone the conversation to next time.
You reach your Rock crew member. They are trying to carve a sort of finger on the edge of their huge stone hand. It must be quite difficult to control systems with such cobblestones.
You reach your Rockman. They repeatedly hit the walls and floor of their room, trying to kill some insect. They almost smash up the whole ship, but you calm them down in the nick of time.
The Rockman suddenly dances about their quarters from idleness, rocking the whole ship and causing a roar, to which you ask them to not make so much noise.
The Rockman asks to board someplace, preferably a burning ship. You promise to do this the first chance you get.
The Rockman amuses themselves by collecting a pyramid of stones. One awkward movement, and the pyramid crumbles... the Rockman rumbles in discontent, and you leave as quickly as you can.
The Rockman sleeps in their bunk and their snores can be heard throughout the room. Your cover your ears, and quickly leave.
The Rockman browses through a pile of defective ammunition in a storage bay. Nothing useful, just a pile of rubbish.
You go into the room the Rockman's in, and they show you an ugly stone statue. To your inquiries about what it is, they just silently smile...

event.name: NOTHING2_ROCK_GOOD
event.text: You go to the storage bay to see what your Rockman is up to. They examine a batch of defective ammunition and manage to refit several of them to be suitable for use. Your Rockman definitely doesn't eat their meals for nothing.

event.name: NOTHING2_ROCK_BEST
event.text: You go to the storage bay to see what your Rockman is up to. They examine a batch of defective ammunition and manage to refit several of them to be suitable for use. Your Rockman definitely doesn't eat their meals for nothing.

textList.name: NOTHING2_MAGMAN_TEXT
textList.text: Magmen have the ability to regulate their body temperature. You pat them on the back and feel a chill surge through your arm. You walk away but feel the Magman's smile behind you.

Magmen have the ability to regulate their body temperature. You're about to pat them on the back when you feel the intensity of a hot spring. You change from patting to waving, and walk away, though you swear the Magman chuckled or something.
The Magman is first covered with frost, then bursts with heat. You marvel at their unusual ability before leaving.
The Magman changes the color of their aura from cold blue to hot red. It looks pretty cool.

event.name: NOTHING2_MAGMAN_GOOD
event.text: Магмен с увлечением возится с каким-то оборудованием. Вы ждёте, и через некоторое время он показывает вам готовую огненную бомбу! Также он всячески намекает на необходимость телепортера на вашем корабле...

textList.name: NOTHING2_ORCHID_TEXT
textList.text: The Orchid sprays a soothing pollen mist all about their quarters. All your worries immediately fade away. You leave in a good mood.
You ask the Orchid a few questions, but they just sway in response and write some nonsense into the communicator. Maybe they're just illiterate?
Although Orchids are unable to speak, they can still communicate in writing. After a little chat, you walk away.
The Orchid sprayed some kind of sleep-inducing pollen in their quarters. Moving your legs with difficulty, you leave.

event.name: NOTHING2_ORCHID_GOOD
event.text: The Orchid's room is overgrown with dense vegetation. The Orchid points their stem towards a particularly overgrown corner, so you push through the foliage and find an explosive replicator there! You ask where it came from, but the Orchid just sways their leaves contentedly.

textList.name: NOTHING2_SHELL_TEXT
textList.text: Броненосец свернулся в клубок и катается по всему отсеку. Понаблюдав немного за его игрой, вы уходите.
Броненосец сворачивается в клубок и начинает делать круги вокруг вас. У вас начинает кружиться голова и вы неловко падаете. Ну и шуточки у него...
Броненосец просит вас проверить его панцирь на прочность. Вы пинаете его со всей силы и отбиваете себе ногу. Прочный...
Броненосец лениво перекатывается из угла в угол. Он просит поскорее отправить его в абордаж — на корабле ему скучно.

Броненосец проводит какие-то химические опыты с ядовитыми газами. Вы наблюдаете в стороне, стараясь не мешать ему. Одна из пробирок взрывается, и броненосец спешно включает вытяжку. Вы тихонько уходите.

textList.name: NOTHING2_SHELL_GOOD_TEXT
textList.text: Броненосец проводит какие-то химические опыты с ядовитыми газами. Вы наблюдаете в стороне, стараясь не мешать ему.

textList.name: NOTHING2_SHELL_GOOD_TEXT_2
textList.text: В конце концов ему удаётся получить формулу ядовитого газа, который разъедает тела вражеских абордажников, но безопасен для вашей команды. Удивительно!

textList.name: NOTHING2_SHELL_GOOD_TEXT_3
textList.text: В конце концов ему удаётся улучшить формулу ядовитого газа, защищающего вас от абордажников. Теперь они будут получать ещё больше урона!

textList.name: NOTHING2_SHELL_GOOD_TEXT_4
textList.text: В конце концов он говорит, что концентрация газа уже на максимуме. Тем не менее вы получаете дополнительную порцию яда на продажу!

textList.name: NOTHING2_ANAEROBIC_TEXT
textList.text: You go to the quarters of your Lanius. Unfortunately, the low oxygen level prevents you from staying there for long. You return to the bridge and give the order to jump.

You go to your Lanius's quarters, and remember to bring an oxygen tank. Unfortunately, the pocket translator went haywire again, so you stop understanding them. You make a note of this in your logs: "Buy a new translator."
You find your Lanius eating a piece of metal in your cargo bay. Seeing you, they spit it out guiltily and leave.
You find your Lanius caught in an acute part of the hull in a passage between rooms. After spending a lot of time, you manage to unhook them without breaking anything.

The Lanius is picking about under the dashboard, when you hear the sounds of screws turning. You're surprised to see how, in your eyes, their limb takes the form of a screwdriver. Strange creatures, these Lanius...
Looks like the Lanius is busy cleaning up. One of their hands takes the form of a vacuum cleaner nozzle, and then the Lanius puffs, absorbing small metal debris on the floor.
The Lanius experiments with their limb, giving it the shape of various blades. They stop on the Flamberge form and then growl.
You find your Lanius trying to break off the metal leg of their bed. Noticing you, they pretend that they've lost something on the floor.
The Lanius is having fun cutting the ship's plating and then melting it. You ask them to stop doing that.
Looks like earlier the Lanius was larger. You'll have to give them an extra portion of metal for dinner.

event.name: NOTHING2_ANAEROBIC_GOOD
event.text: You go into your Lanius's quarters, remembering to wear an oxygen mask. After a small chat, you complain to them about the recent shortage of scrap, after which the Lanius detaches their metal arm, melts it down into scrap and hands it to you. Gradually, a new arm regrows from their shoulder, however, it seems that the Lanius has slightly decreased in size. Or maybe it just looks that way to you.

event.name: NOTHING2_ANAEROBIC_BEST
event.text: You go into your Lanius's quarters, remembering to wear an oxygen mask. After a small chat, you complain to them about the recent shortage of scrap, after which the Lanius detaches their metal arm, melts it down into scrap and hands it to you. Gradually, a new arm regrows from their shoulder, however, it seems that the Lanius has slightly decreased in size. Or maybe it just looks that way to you.

textList.name: NOTHING2_CRYSTAL_TEXT
textList.text: You go to talk with your Crystal. They talk at length about their homeland boringly. Finally, the FTL Drive charges, and you can jump on.
The Crystal which you've come to speak with responds reluctantly and tersely. Realizing that there's no use in a such a conversation, you leave them alone.
You go to talk with your Crystal. They talk about their homeworlds entertainingly. Meanwhile, the FTL Drive charges, and you can jump on.

The Crystal stares at you intently, and you freeze in astonishment. Their crystal surface slowly changes shape and becomes very similar to you, and then returns to its previous state. What a marvelous creature!
Your Crystal speaks quite arrogantly, constantly mentioning the exclusivity of their people. You quickly get bored, and leave.
The Crystal shows you photos of various other Crystals from their home planet. Barely waiting for the FTL Drive to charge, you leave once it does so.
Your Crystal is intently reading about the races in the ship computer's database. Their interest can be well understood, and you leave quietly, not wanting to disturb them.
The Crystalline being is sorting their collection of crystals. You don't quite understand what they're doing, and go away.
The Crystal has locked down their room with crystal shards, a clear sign that they're not interested in talking.
Your Crystal trains their breathing, opening and closing their room's airlocks. You'd rather not join them in that and instead leave.

event.name: NOTHING2_CRYSTAL_GOOD
event.text: When you go to your Crystal, they've grown some special crystalline structure. Adding several control circuits to it, they've made an augmentation for your ship — crystal vengeance. It'll be necessary to write out an award to them.

textList.name: NOTHING2_GHOST_TEXT
textList.text: You go to the room the Avatar's in. After observing them for a bit, you see that the system under their control functions without problems. Under the AI's supervision all systems operate without interruptions.
You find that the Avatar has just finished scanning the ship's systems. The Avatar cannot communicate with living beings, but everything looks to be in order. As it always is.
You find the Avatar drinking holographic coffee. While communication may be impossible with holograms, it's quite clear they enjoy your company.
The Avatar hopelessly flickers when you ask for something. Their ability to communicate is severely limited...

You enter the Avatar's quarters, but the crew member is nowhere in sight. Suddenly, the hologram appears from a mechanism on the floor. You jump a little in surprise, and quickly leave, after which the Avatar disappears again.
The mechanism that displays the Avatar indicates the Avatar's hibernating for the duration of the jump. You return to your cabin.
You try to talk to the Avatar, but they flicker all about before promptly disappearing, probably in frustration. There's no point trying to talk to a hologram...
The Avatar is busy adjusting the computer's software. Apparently, they must interface directly with it, since they're unable to physically press the buttons.
You go into the Avatar's quarters. After inspecting the room, you note that the crewman's bed should be replaced with something more useful.
Your Avatar waves at you with their holographic hand. Seems they're able to pick up some gestures people make. You wave back at them and leave.

event.name: NOTHING2_GHOST_GOOD
event.text: You move into the Avatar's room, right when they begin to perform a strange procedure. The hologram suddenly begins to flicker and then suddenly splits into two! It looks like Avatars have the ability to self-reproduce.

textList.name: NOTHING2_MUSHROOM_F_TEXT
textList.text: Вы заходите в комнату к машруму, но на все ваши вопросы он упорно молчит. Это следовало ожидать от гриба...
Машрум не может с вами поговорить, потому что он всего лишь гриб.
Как только вы заходите в отсек, машрум выбрасывает в вашу сторону свои споры. К счастью, они ещё не дозрели и не имеют никакого эффекта.

textList.name: NOTHING2_MUSHROOM_GOOD_F_TEXT
textList.text: Машрум превратил свой отсек в подобие лесной поляны с питательным экстрактом. Зарывшись в землю, он сбрасывает свою шляпку и меняет обличье! Вы уже не уверены, что перед вами находится тот же самый машрум...

textList.name: NOTHING2_MUSHROOM_GOOD_TEXT
textList.text: Машрум превратил свой отсек в подобие лесной поляны с питательным экстрактом. Он разбрасывает свои споры, и из-под земли появляется молодой машрум, готовый служить под вашим руководством.

event.name: ASTEROID_EXPLORE
event.text: Scans reveal a large asteroid field nearby. Short-range scanners may discover useful materials while we wait for the FTL to recharge.

choice.text: Too dangerous. We'll just wait for the FTL to charge and then fly away.
Attempt to mine a large asteroid using explosives.

event.text: You plant the explosives into the asteroid and detonate them from a safe distance away.

choice.text: (Scrap Recovery Arm) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.
The resulting explosion splits the asteroid into pieces. You collect many useful minerals among the remains.
A little off to the side, you notice a few more asteroid fragments.
The resulting explosion splits the asteroid into pieces. You collect many useful minerals among the remains.
A little off to the side, you notice a few more asteroid fragments.
The resulting explosion splits the asteroid into pieces. You collect many useful minerals among the remains.
A little off to the side, you notice a few more asteroid fragments.
The resulting explosion splits the asteroid in two. You collect what useful minerals you can from the two halves.
A little off to the side, you notice a few more asteroid fragments.
The resulting explosion splits the asteroid in two. You collect what useful minerals you can from the two halves.
A little off to the side, you notice a few more asteroid fragments.
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest. Time to get out of these asteroids!
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest. Time to get out of these asteroids!
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest. Time to get out of these asteroids!
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest. Time to get out of these asteroids!
Scans reveal several asteroids rich in unstable elements. You manage to process them some fuel from them.
You discover the remains of ship embedded into an asteroid. It still has some functional missiles.
You happen upon an abandoned mining site. A few mining drones were left behind and could be repurposed.
The asteroid field proved more dangerous than expected. Some asteroids managed to get through your ship's defenses.
A pirate ship hiding behind one of the larger asteroids attacks you!
They thank you for the deal and you move on.

choice.text: Hire the mercenary to scout out the sector.

event.text: Your map has been updated.

choice.text: Buy some drone parts from them.

event.text: Mercenaries are worse than Rebels. The only honorable course is to engage the mercenary in battle.

choice.text: You have no need of their services.

textList.name: MERCENARY
textList.text: You find a mercenary for hire at this Beacon. Their unique skills can sometimes prove to be useful.
A mercenary hails you: "Greetings, friend! We've heard tell of your quest and are here to offer our valuable services."
There's a ship with pirate markings orbiting the nearby planet. You receive his hail: "Anything is possible, for the right price."
The captain of this ship claims he can provide "services" as long as you've got the scrap.
Mercenaries are swarming the galaxy now, knowing that their less-than-legal services are in demand during this period of unrest. One is waiting at this beacon and hails you.

A ship hails you: "Good sir! It seems you're having some troubles with the Rebels. I'd like to help you, but I can't afford the upkeep required on this hunk of junk I'm flying... maybe we can come to an arrangement?"

textList.name: MERCENARY_BUY_AMMO
textList.text: They agree to trade their ammo for scrap.

textList.name: MERCENARY_BUY_DRONES
textList.text: They agree to trade their drone parts for scrap.

event.name: PIRATE_STATION_CROPS
event.text: Scans show a remote settlement being blockaded by a pirate ship. The ship hastily messages you, "Stay out of this, or you'll be next!...Concentrate fire on..."
"You asked for it!" They pull away from the planet and move in to engage.
It's just not possible to save every civilian affected by this war. You prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Fire Beam) Show the pirates how to intimidate settlers: burn their crops!

event.text: The pirate watches as you start to light the meager crops on fire. In a few moments the settlement surrenders, offering tribute to leave them alone. The pirate seems impressed.

choice.text: (Fire Bomb) Show the pirate how to intimidate settlers: start fires in their crude dwellings!

event.text: The pirate watches as you teleport an incendiary explosive into the settlement. As the settlers scramble to put out the fires, their rudimentary planetary defenses power down. Forcing their surrender was laughably easy, but the pirate seems impressed with your tactics and agrees to share the settlement's 'tribute'.

event.name: PIRATE_STATION_CROPS_RESULT
event.text: With the pirates gone you signal the station. "We appreciate what you've done, but there'll just be another ship looking to profit from our isolation soon enough. Sorry we can't give you more."

surrender.text: "Alright! We give up! We're terrible at this pirating thing anyway..."

choice.text: Piracy is a crime punishable by death. Attack!

escape.text: They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.

destroyed.text: You pick through the remains and contact the settlement.

deadCrew.text: You briefly inspect the ship's holds and contact the settlement.

event.text: You ship some fuel over to them.
Looks like they didn't expect such hostility, but are nonetheless preparing to defend themselves.

choice.text: Apologize, wish them luck, and move on.

event.text: "We understand... Please send help our way if you meet anyone trustworthy, okay?"
"Thank you so much! We don't have much to offer, but have a look at the sector scans we took, along with a bit of scrap." Your map is updated.
"Thank you. Take some scrap as thanks."
"Thank you. Take this scrap as thanks."
"Thank the Gods. We can finally get out of here! We're jumping straight home so take this extra weapon. We won't need it, hopefully."
"Thank you. Perhaps as payment our engineer can try to optimize your ship's reactor output?"
"Thank the Gods. We can finally get out of here! We're jumping straight home so take this extra weapon. We won't need it, hopefully."
"Thank you. We have nothing with which to repay you, but our technician wants to join your crew. What do you think?"
Your new crew member welcomes their new duties and takes their place.

textList.name: FRIENDLY_BEACON
textList.text: "Greetings! It is so good to see you! We've been out of fuel and floating out here for weeks. We were terrified a pirate or those damn Rebels would find us first. Could you spare some fuel?"
You arrive to find a ship floating among some debris. "Hello. Our impulse drives are shot and we can't jump. Could you give us some fuel?"
A small civilian ship flies over as soon as you arrive. You're prepared to fight but they just inform you that they're out of FTL fuel and can't jump.

"Hello. We used our last FTL fuel to jump to this station." They indicate a burnt out husk of debris and warped metal. "As you can see the war must have spread to this sector. We've been stranded ever since."
The ship emitting the distress beacon messages you, "Sorry to bother you, but we're out of fuel and can't get out of this barren sector. Could you help us out?

event.name: PIRATE_CIVILIAN_BEACON
event.text: The distress beacon is coming from a civilian ship. It appears it is being chased by a pirate.
You power up your weapons and engage the pirate ship.
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range; however, after a time the distress calls stop.

choice.text: (Improved Weapons) Fire a warning shot from your strongest weapon.

event.text: Detecting the greater threat (and potential reward), they turn and engage your ship.
It seems the pirate wasn't looking for a fight with someone who could fight back. They leave and you move to contact the civilian ship.
Detecting the greater threat (and potential reward), they turn and engage your ship.
It seems the pirate wasn't looking for a fight with someone who could fight back. They leave and you move to contact the civilian ship.
Your warning volley accidentally hits the civilian ship. In a bright flash, the ship breaks apart, and seeing this, the pirates quickly back off. Well, you tried...

event.name: STRANDED_BEACON
event.text: It appears the distress beacon is coming from the surface of a nearby moon. Your sensors are picking up a single life form.

choice.text: Go down to the surface to investigate.

event.text: You find a colony that seems to have been recently attacked. Exploring the devastation, you find a lone survivor. You bring them on board.

choice.text: Invite him to join your crew.
Take him home to his family on a nearby planet in this system.

event.text: You find a settler living alone in a cave. From the appearance of his wrecked ship, it seems he's been here for many years. He looks healthy, but his mental state is questionable.

choice.text: Bring him back to your ship in hopes of finding some help for him.
Leave the madman to his ravings, he's not worth the risk.
(Improved Medbay) Bring him to your medbay.

event.text: Once inside your medbay, the system is able to restore his body and undo some of the damage to his brain. Once awake he states, "I feel almost like my old self again... Thank you. Please let me serve on your ship."

choice.text: (Advanced Medbay) Bring him to your medbay.

event.text: Once inside your advanced medbay, the system is able to identify and minimize the trauma associated with being alone for so long. Once awake he states, "I don't know how to repay you, I feel 10 years younger... Let me serve on your ship."

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) "Sir, allow me to assess his mental state."
(Slug Crew Member) "Sir, allow me to assess his mental state."
(Orchid Crew Member) Calm him down before bringing him back to the ship.

event.text: Once aboard, the human massages his shoulders and calms down. Though he will need time to recover, he is happy to join your crew.
It seems he was in worse health than we first thought. He collapses on the trip up to the ship. It doesn't look like he's going to make it...

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Quickly bring him to the medbay.

event.text: Your improved medbay was able to resuscitate him. After a short time he recovers greatly saying, "I really thought I was a goner... I haven't eaten for days. Would you mind if I stayed on your ship?"

choice.text: (Improved Clonebay) Quickly register him into the clonebay.

event.text: Your quick reaction allowed your Clonebay to revive him after he passes. After he steps out of the machine he states, "How am I alive? Wasn't I just dying on some shuttle? Technology sure has changed."
The family apparently owns one of the most valuable mining enterprises in the sector. For the safe return of his son, the patron of the family offers you a substantial reward.
The survivor's family is of modest means, yet they manage to offer you a reward for your virtuous deed.
Overjoyed with the return of their son, the family of the survivor arranges to repair your ship's hull as compensation.
Once back in orbit, the settler turns increasingly violent. Eventually he turns on your crew and manages to kill one before you can subdue him.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: Luckily, your clone bay is able to revive your crew member.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
He seems to improve immensely upon getting back to the ship. It might take a while for him to truly be well again, but until then he seems happy to serve as a member of your crew.
Being back in space terrifies him. He goes mad and nearly blows a hole in the side of your ship with a makeshift explosive in an attempt to "escape this metal prison." He dies in the explosion.
It seems he was in worse health than we first thought. He collapses on the trip up to the ship. It doesn't look like he's going to make it...

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Quickly bring him to the medbay.

event.text: Your improved medbay was able to resuscitate him. After a short time he recovers greatly saying, "I really thought I was a goner... I haven't eaten for days. Would you mind if I stayed on your ship?"

choice.text: (Improved Clonebay) Quickly register him into the clonebay.

event.text: Your quick reaction allowed your Clonebay to revive him after he passes. After he steps out of the machine he states, "How am I alive? Wasn't I just dying on some shuttle? Technology sure has changed."
You bring the ship closer. The Slug enters a trance-like state for 1 to 2 seconds, then quickly snaps out of it. He states, "Thisss persson is clearly unssstable. It is bessst we leave them alone."
You bring the ship closer and the Slug, after a pause, says that the subject is stable and that his intentions are good.

choice.text: Invite him to join your crew.

event.text: He states that he was a weapons operator before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was a shield operator before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was a pilot before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was an engineer before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was an infantryman before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was a shipwright before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".

textList.name: TRAP_BEACON_TEXT
textList.text: You arrive at the beacon and immediately detect a pirate ship. It seems this distress beacon was a trap!
"Haha! I knew someone would fall into our dastardly trap!" It appears this distress beacon was nothing but a decoy for a pirate ambush.
Your cockpit lights up with warning signals. You are being targeted by a nearby ship. The distress call was a lure to attract unwitting ships into weapons range. You prepare for a fight.
As soon as you arrive at the distress signal, shots are fired toward your ship. A trap!

event.name: CIVILIAN_ASTEROIDS_BEACON
event.text: You follow the distress beacon to a tiny asteroid belt. You find a small ship struggling to maneuver through the field.

event.name: CIVILIAN_ASTEROIDS_BEACON_2
event.text: They respond: "Help! Our shields are down and we won't last long!"

choice.text: Try to shield their ship with yours.
Don't risk our ship. Leave them to their fate.
(Defense Drone) Use a Defense Drone to protect their ship.
(System Repair Drone) Send a System Repair Drone to fix their Shields.
(Teleporter) Offer to beam them aboard your ship.
(Rock Armor Plating) Shield their ship with yours and escort them out.

event.text: You succeed in preventing them from being entirely destroyed, your improved hull taking the brunt of the asteroids that make it past your defenses. They offer you some of the scrap and fuel they were mining out of the asteroid as thanks.

choice.text: (Zoltan Shield) Shield their ship with yours and escort them out.

event.text: You succeed in preventing them from being entirely destroyed, your energy shield taking the brunt of the asteroids. They offer you some of the scrap and fuel they were mining out of the asteroid as thanks.

choice.text: (Repair Burst) Escort the civilians by firing at their ship with repair bursts.

event.text: Repair bursts eliminate some critical damage to their systems. You then get out of the asteroid field.
In gratitude, they offer you a bit of scrap and fuel, which they extracted from the asteroid.

choice.text: (Hull Repair Burst) Escort the civilians by firing at their ship with repair bursts.

event.text: Repair bursts eliminate some critical damage to their systems. You then get out of the asteroid field.
In gratitude, they offer you a bit of scrap and fuel, which they extracted from the asteroid.
You succeed in preventing them from being entirely destroyed, but your ship took a number of hits in the process. They offer some of the scrap and fuel they were mining out of the asteroid as thanks.
You try your best but one stray rock hits a key structure in their ship. It breaks apart in front of your eyes. You salvage what you can before leaving, and try not to think about the lost crew.
Despite your best efforts, the civilian ship breaks apart from the constant barrage. You are barely able to break out of the asteroid field yourself. The ship sustains some damage in the process.

Your drone succeeds in keeping their ship from breaking apart while they fix it, however you take some damage while attempting to leave the asteroid field. They offer you some military supplies as thanks for saving them.

The drone keeps the ship stable enough to allow them to escape the asteroid field. They message you with map coordinates, "You're that Federation ship the Rebels are after, aren't you? I can't offer much but I heard there was a Federation loyalist base nearby. Maybe they can help you?"

They reluctantly agree. Once aboard, you watch as their ship crashes against a massive rock. They thank you, but say "I don't know what we'll do without our ship. As the Captain, I feel obligated to help you with your mission."

They refuse at first, but after another blast rocks their ship they agree and beam aboard your ship. They say, "Thank you but we really should return to our families... I'm sure we can muster up a reward if you take us home."

choice.text: Take them to the nearby planet, where they're from.

event.text: You regretfully leave the area, not able to watch them get destroyed. A short while later you get a second message, "We survived, no thanks to you! Don't think I don't know that the Rebels are hunting for you. I'll be sure to tell them where you are the next time I see them!"
You watch helplessly as their ship smashes against a cruiser-sized rock...

event.name: ESCORT_BEACON
event.text: Once you arrive at the location of the distress call a civilian ship hails you, "Thanks for responding to our beacon. Our FTL navigation has gone haywire and we can't plot a course to the nearest depot to get it fixed. Could you lead us there?"
"Take this bit of scrap as a down-payment. We'll use your jump signatures to follow you. You're really helping us out here."
"Alright... If you're not going that way I guess it can't be helped. We'll just wait for the next ship to come."

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Have your navigation software calculate and upload route instructions to their ship.

event.text: "We're receiving your transmission... Wow, I didn't know that chain-jumping was possible with this class of ship. We'll get back in a single jump! Thank you so much, please accept this."
You power up your weapons and engage the Rebel ship.
The Rebel's preoccupation with the Federation ship allows you to slip away undetected. However you can't help but feel you should have helped them.

textList.name: REBEL_VS_FEDERATION
textList.text: Upon arriving at this beacon, you detect a distress call. Local scans reveal that a Federation transport is under attack from a Rebel scout!

You immediately notice a Rebel ship chasing what appears to be a civilian transport. However you are detecting chatter on an encrypted Federation channel... That transport is carrying Federation loyalists!
Your sensors are picking up a distress call on an encrypted Federation channel. You eventually find a Federation scout being chased by a Rebel fighter!

event.text: "Thank you for saving us. This ship is transporting Federation civilians on the run from the rebellion and we don't have the equipment to fight for ourselves. I don't have much to offer, but I can inform you of a hidden Federation base nearby. Perhaps they can assist you more."
"Thanks, we didn't think there would be Rebel ships all the way out here. They seem to be searching for something. Take some extra supplies as thanks for your aid."

event.name: REBEL_VS_FEDERATION_SAVED_LIST_CHECK_CARGO
event.text: Their ship looks to be on the verge of destruction and life signs are fading quickly.

choice.text: Quickly try to rescue the crew.

event.text: Despite your efforts the majority do not survive. The sole survivor offers to join your crew and helps you strip the now derelict ship of useful components.

choice.text: (Engi Med-bot Dispersal) Pump their ship with Nano Med-bots to aid in the rescue.

event.text: You drag the injured and dying crew on to your ship. The Med-bots help stabilize their condition, but most perish. The surviving shields operator offers to join your crew and helps you strip their broken ship of scrap.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Lock on to all remaining life signatures and beam them onto your ship.

event.text: Your quick reactions allow you to stabilize a few of the seriously wounded crew members. An infantryman offers to join your crew and the rest tell you of a hidden Federation base a few jumps from here.

choice.text: (Healing Burst) Use a healing burst to keep them alive.

event.text: You launch a healing burst into their ship and the Nanobots are able to keep the crew stabilized. Once they come to, you send over some supplies to keep them healthy enough to get to friendly territory.
Now that they're safe an engineer offers to join your crew and the rest tell you of a hidden Federation base a few jumps from here.

event.name: DISTRESS_TRAPPED_MINER
event.text: You arrive at the distress beacon near a small asteroid belt and find a ship with pirate markings partially crushed between two large rocks. It must have been illegally mining the belt without proper equipment.

choice.text: Try to dislodge the ship by shooting at the rocks.
Destroy and loot the ship. They're just pirates.
This is not your problem; let them sort it out themselves.
(Beam Weapon) Carefully cut the ship out.
