event.text: You use your beam to make a few precision cuts in the asteroid. The ship gives a quick burst of thrust and the rock crumbles away. They thank you and offer some of the resources they have collected.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Have your drone cut the ship out.

event.text: You program the drone to work carefully around the trapped ship. In a short time it allows the ship to easily slip out of its cage. They thank you and offer some of the resources they have collected.

You take a few careful shots but you expose a mineral patch in the rock that reacts violently with your weapon. A shockwave forces you back as debris pelts against your hull. When you regain control you find there is not much left of the ship.
You fire a few volleys into the rock and it starts to shudder and break apart. Without shields the pirate ship takes a beating but eventually pulls free. They thank you for your assistance.
You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull causing the ship to depressurize and break apart. You move in to loot the remains.

You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull. Before you can scrap the remains another pirate ship flashes on your radar. Perhaps they saw your deed, or perhaps they want to claim the spoils for themselves, but for whatever reason, they're charging weapons!

event.name: DISTRESS_INFESTATION
event.text: You find a number of ships fleeing from a small space station. You hail them, asking what's wrong: "Help! We're being overrun by some sort of giant alien spiders!"

choice.text: Send the crew to help! Giant alien spiders are no joke.

event.text: You can't risk fighting some unknown alien on every backwater station you come across. You prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew Member) Send your Mantis on the hunt — to the Mantis, giant spiders are considered a delicacy.
(Two Mantis Crew Members) Send two of your Mantises on the hunt — to the Mantis, giant spiders are considered a delicacy.

event.text: The arachnids are unable to repel one of your Mantises, let alone two, which quickly fill their bellies with the spiders' meat. The station owners are disgusted by watching this, but nevertheless thank you and give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Anti-Personnel Drone) Send your battle drone in to help.

event.text: You pull up alongside the station and release the drone through the airlock. Within a short time the majority of the creatures are dead, with only a little collateral damage. They express their most sincere gratitude.
The station's owners express their sincere gratitude.

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Launch a Boarding drone into the station.

event.text: You launch the drone and it crashes through their hull, leaving a huge breach. You watch as the drone tears through the creatures while debris and dead bodies fly out of the breach. The owners of the station are less than effusive when they thank you, and offer only a meager payment. Maybe it's a good time to leave...
Perhaps it's time to leave...

choice.text: (Anti-Bio-Beam) Use the beam to pick off the spiders.

event.text: You instruct them to drop their shields and you are able to kill the creatures without damaging the station. "The monsters just started bursting into flame as we watched. What a terrifying weapon... Here, take this for your help, friend."

choice.text: (Two Biological Bombs) Launch a pair of bio-bombs at the spiders.

event.text: You teleport two bio-bombs over to the giant spiders, and a few minutes later it's all over. "The monsters just started bursting into flame as we watched. What a terrifying weapon... Here, take this for your help, friend."
You accept the reward and move on.
Your mantis starts to devour the arachnids, but it is just too overrun. At some point your Mantis has to retreat. At least they won't need to be fed for a couple of days.

The arachnids are unable to repel your Mantis, which quickly fills their belly with the spiders' meat. The station owners are disgusted by watching this, but nevertheless thank you and give you some supplies.

The arachnids are unable to repel your Mantis, which quickly fills their belly with the spiders' meat. The station owners are disgusted by watching this, but nevertheless thank you and give you some supplies.

Your crew boards the station, cautiously moving between corridors. Suddenly a man-sized arachnid bursts from a vent in the ceiling, followed by countless more. You fight your way back to the airlock and are forced to leave before accounting for all crew members. Not everybody made it back.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: You take a hopeful trip to the Clone Bay, and to your relief a clone is already prepared for the lost crew member.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

Your crew slowly creeps up on a cluster of the creatures from behind. Without warning, the giant arachnids turn and charge. However, your team stays in control and before long you've beaten them back.
They are thrilled with your success and offer you a reward.

event.name: DISTRESS_SATELLITE_DEFENSE
event.text: The distress signal is coming from a small space station orbiting an uninhabited planet. Their satellite defense system has gone haywire and their repair crew can't approach without being fired on. They're looking for help to fix or disable it.

choice.text: See if you can do anything.

event.name: DISTRESS_SATELLITE_DEFENSE_OPTIONS
event.text: You consider your options.

choice.text: Simply fire on the defense system from a distance.

event.text: You use your ion weaponry to disable the gun long enough for their repair crews to fix it. They message you, "I've never seen a weapon like that before! Thanks for your help. Please accept this reward."

choice.text: (Cloaking) Use your Cloaking to disable the system.

event.text: You use your ship's Cloaking to try to prevent the defense system from getting a lock. However before you are able to safely disable the system your cloaking gives out and you are forced to destroy the satellite. No one was harmed but they don't seem happy with your solution.

choice.text: (Improved Cloaking) Use your Cloaking to disable the system.

event.text: You use your ship's Cloaking to prevent the defense system from getting a lock. Once closer, you hasten to disable the system without damaging it. It was a sloppy job but they appreciate it and offer a reward.

choice.text: (Advanced Cloaking) Use your Cloaking to disable the system.

event.text: Thanks to your Advanced Cloaking, you're able to approach the defense system without an issue. Once closer, you are able to safely disable the system. They thank you for your help and offer a reward.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Remotely repair its targeting system.

event.text: Your crew-member is able to remotely fix the glitch in the defense AI, allowing the repair crew to close in and finish the job. The station gives you its thanks along with a reward.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Remotely repair its targeting system.

event.text: Your crew-member is able to remotely fix the glitch in the defense AI, allowing the repair crew to close in and finish the job. The station gives you its thanks along with a reward.

choice.text: (Lanius Crew Member) Your crewman offers to help.

event.text: Your Lanius crewman appears to have a solution. The Lanius simply jumps out of the airlock towards the satellite. Apparently their lack of heat signatures renders them hidden from the satellite's targeting sensors. Once there they simply melt it down into scrap. You quickly pick them up and prepare to jump before the station can question your methods.

choice.text: (Defense Scrambler) Scramble the defense system's targeting.

event.text: Your defense scrambler is able to render the system useless, allowing the repair crew to safely approach it. With the problem solved, they offer you a reward for your help.

choice.text: (Decoy Combat Drone) Distract the defense system using your decoy drone.

event.text: You launch the decoy drone towards the station's defense system, and move yourself little bit away...
... while the drone distracts the defense system's weapons, you dock with the station, and the repair crew fixes the malfunction. They offer you a reward for helping them.

choice.text: Leave them alone and fly away.

event.text: Their defense system is too dangerous for you to risk your ship on. You promise to send them help from nearby beacons.

You fire a few volleys from a distance and it is clear the defense system is no match for your weapons. However, the station does not seem happy with your 'solution'. You salvage what you can and jump before there is trouble.

You fire a few volleys but aren't able to penetrate the defense system's shields. Its weapons have no trouble piercing yours though, and you take minor damage before escaping. The station will need to find help elsewhere.

event.name: DISTRESS_STATION_FIRE
event.text: You find the source of the distress call, a small research station. It appears a small laboratory fire got out of control and is threatening to destroy the station. Their fire suppression system is not responding.

choice.text: Send your crew in a shuttle to help put out the fire.
Send your crew in a shuttle to help put out the fire.
Dock and try to rescue the survivors.

event.text: You coldly shut off communications and prepare to leave. Your crew seems upset but you assure them that nothing could have been done.

choice.text: (Rock Crew Member) Send your Rock crew member in.

event.text: Your Rock soldier tears through the airlock directly into the fire. You've never seen someone that large move that fast. It disperses as much fire suppressant as possible into the heart of the blaze and eventually the fires start to die down.
With most of the fire under control, the scientists are able to help secure the station. They express to you their sincere gratitude and offer a generous reward.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Send your Engi crew member in.

event.text: Having had extensive experience in extinguishing fire, your Engi is able to handle the fire without problems. True, they almost burnt themselves to a crisp, but fortunately, everything turned out fine.
The station's scientists thank you for your help and send some of their engineers to improve your ship's reactor and patch up a bit of hull.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Send your Morph crew member in.

event.text: Having had extensive experience in extinguishing fire, your Morph is able to handle the fire without problems. True, they almost burnt themselves to a crisp, but fortunately, everything turned out fine.
The station's scientists thank you for your help and send some of their engineers to improve your ship's reactor and patch up a bit of hull.

choice.text: (Lanius Crew Member) Send your Lanius crew member in.

event.text: Your Lanius leaps into the laboratory and begins to pump oxygen out of it. Soon the fire starts to die down, and then completely extinguishes.
Once the oxygen is restored to a safe level, the researchers restore order back to the station. They offer you scrap as a reward.

choice.text: (System Repair Drone) Send your System Repair drone into the fire.

event.text: You send the System Repair drone in and it methodically puts out the fires. Once it has made some progress, the rest of your crew helps to secure the station.
They express to you their sincere gratitude; the station would have surely been destroyed without your assistance. They transfer a small reward and an additional drone schematic.

choice.text: (Fire Supression) Turn on your fire extinguishing system.

event.text: You direct your fire suppression system at the station and it quickly extinguishes the fire.
The scientists thank you and send a reward for your help.

event.name: DISTRESS_STATION_FIRE_CREW_ORCHID
event.text: You send your crew into the station. One of your Orchids separated from the main group and caught fire. You quickly try to dock to evacuate them, but they have already received fatal burns. After what happened, sending Orchids to put out fires doesn't seem like such a brilliant idea.

removeCrew.text: Orchids are all too familiar with their frailty to fire, and your crew member's clone seems to droop a little for their futility.

event.name: DISTRESS_STATION_FIRE_CREW_DEATH
event.text: You send your crew into the station. Unfortunately as soon as they enter the fire breaches the station's fuel cell containment. You quickly try to dock and retrieve your crew but not before an unfortunate soul is lost in the inferno.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: With a new-found respect for flames, your crew member's clone stumbles out of the Clone Bay.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

Your crew valiantly keeps the fire at bay long enough to allow some of the scientists to escape, but it appears to be a losing battle. Before long you order the retreat. The few scientists they were able to save are distraught but grateful. You'll drop them off at the next station.
With the help of your crew, the scientists are able to deal with the blazing fire. Grateful, they give you some supplies.

You locate the highest concentration of life forms and bring the ship alongside the station. Before you can begin to offload the survivors, a huge blast splits the station apart. Your ship is thrown away and some debris pierces your hull. You watch helplessly as the last of the survivors are consumed in the collapse of the station.

You pull up alongside the station and cut through their hull. You are able to rescue a few survivors but many more are lost. One of the survivors offers to join your crew and you offload the rest on a nearby station.

event.name: DISTRESS_STATION_DISEASE
event.text: You locate a nearby human mining colony where an unknown disease has spread virulently. They are setting up a quarantine to contain it but a riot has broken out.

choice.text: Send in your crew to help control the crowds.
Ignore their request and move on.

event.text: Unfortunately your mission is too important and you're not willing to risk your crew. You prepare to move on.

choice.text: Ignore their request and move on.

event.text: Your ship doesn't have anything that could help them, and you move on.

choice.text: (Rock Crew Member) Send your Rock crew-member to prevent a riot.

event.text: It's unlikely the Rock's impressive immune system is susceptible to a human virus so you send it in. It is able to intimidate the workers long enough for the colony forces to set up a quarantine. Their leaders offer a reward and assure you they will try to find a cure as soon as possible.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Send your Engi to calm down the infected.

event.text: With no fear of catching the disease, your Engi crew member helps reassure and organize the infected humans. Calmed by its extensive knowledge of human physiology, the infected submit to the quarantine in the hopes that a cure can be found soon. The colony leaders offer a reward for helping to prevent an ugly incident.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Send your Morph to calm down the infected.

event.text: With no fear of catching the disease, your Morph crew member helps reassure and organize the infected humans. Calmed by its extensive knowledge of human physiology, the infected submit to the quarantine in the hopes that a cure can be found soon. The colony leaders offer a reward for helping to prevent an ugly incident.

choice.text: (Avatar Crew Member) Send your Avatar to calm down the infected.

event.text: Your Avatar is sent to the quarantine zone to calm down the infected, but suddenly panic starts among them! They think that your crew member is a ghost that has come to take away their souls, and the panic quickly turns into a stampede, and several people are trampled to death... You quickly retreat. However, your crew member calmly grabbed several fuel cells, thrown by someone in the confusion.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew Member) Distract and soothe the infected.

event.text: The mining colonists have never seen an Orchid before, and they made a lasting impression on them. Being unable to catch human diseases, gifted with natural beauty and a pleasant aroma, it seems as if Orchids were created to calm frightened people.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Use your Medbay to help synthesize a cure.

event.text: Your military-grade medical computers are easily able to isolate the cause of the virus, a previously unknown spore that was unearthed during excavations. You are quickly able to inform the colony's leaders of your success in reverse engineering a cure.
"Thank you so much! We don't have the funds to hire outside help and it would have taken our staff weeks to figure that out. Here, take this as payment!"

choice.text: (Engi Med-bot Dispersal) Use the Nano med-bots to accelerate the dispersal of the cure.

event.text: You reconfigure your ship's Nano dispersal system. In a matter of minutes all of the workers are cured. The leaders can hardly believe what you have achieved. They offer you what they can as payment.

Your crew tries to keep the crowds in line but the scene quickly turns ugly. Half-crazed with fear, the infected grab mining tools and push back at your crew, forcing them to retreat hastily. They barely get away without injury but the same can't be said for the colony's leaders. You quickly leave.

With the visible threat of your weapons, the infected become subdued enough for you to set up a rudimentary quarantine. However before you leave, one of your crew presents signs of infection. You have no choice but to leave them on the station in the hopes that they discover a cure quickly. You leave before more crew succumb.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: As your crewman is still alive and working towards a cure, it would be against Federation regulation to create a clone to continue with you on your journey.

textList.name: BOARDERS_TEXT
textList.text: What appears to be a civilian ship sends a friendly hail. As you approach the vessel, you detect a teleporter signal but it's too late... intruders have beamed aboard!"

A heavily damaged ship is drifting near this beacon. You receive a communication: "Hello! Nice of you to drop by. As you can see, our ship has seen better days. Yours is looking quite nice, I think we might be taking it from you now." Intruders beam aboard.
You detect life-signs actually on the beacon itself! A teleporter signal warns you but it's too late, they've beamed from the beacon onto your ship and seem intent on taking it over.
Your ship detects a faint distress signal on a nearby moon. As you approach the rock, warning lights flash as hostiles beam aboard the ship from some hidden location.
As you arrive, you become aware of a small Rebel outpost near the beacon. You are hardly able to bark an order before a small team is beamed aboard your ship. They must have been expecting you...

event.name: BOARDERS_HACKING
event.text: You catch a glimpse of a strange signal coming from a space station before your sensors shut off unexpectedly. As you discover that your sensors are being jammed, you hear hostiles beam onto your ship.
Until you are able to jump away from the hostile space station, your sensors will be disabled. You should deal with these boarders first though!
Your hacking system automatically counters the digital assault. Your Sensors flicker back on and you prepare to fight the boarders.

event.name: STATION_SICK
event.text: You arrive to find a small research station putting out a distress signal. There is no response to your hails.

choice.text: Dock at the station and investigate.
Dock at the station and investigate.
(Anti-Personnel Drone) Use an Anti-Personnel Drone to investigate.

event.text: Sensors show scattered signs of life although most of the crew are deceased. However the health signatures of the living indicate they are violent and unstable. You decide it's better to move on than risk engaging the remaining crew.

There are no life signs detected on the ship although there appears to be a number of deceased crew. There does not appear to be any airborn contagions so your crew quickly salvages what they can before moving on. You can only wonder what befell the station.
Inside there are signs of a great struggle; scientists lie dead where they fell, brutally dismembered. You grab a few research drone parts lying on a desk near the door and leave quickly.

You dock with the station and see a frantic person banging on the airlock door. Once inside your ship, he drops to the floor saying, "My... friends... They've gone insane... They're coming!" You hand him a blaster and turn to see a number of people charging toward the ship.

choice.text: (Advanced Medbay) Have the Advanced Medbay analyze their condition.

event.text: You hold them off while retreating into the Medbay. Its advanced systems determine that an alien neurotoxin is the cause of their frenzy. It synthesizes an antidote and releases it into the room. After a time, the scientists recover. One offers some scrap as a token of gratitude.

As you explore the base, crazed screams are heard. Your team retreats back to your ship with a number of armed scientists in pursuit. One of your team starts to cough and falls in a spasm onto the floor.

choice.text: Drag him back to the ship and prepare for a fight.

event.text: As you get back on board, your injured friend rises up and starts to attack you, screaming. Caught off-guard, your remaining crew fall back as the other scientists fight their way onto the ship.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Use your Teleporter to retrieve your crew.

event.text: You beam your away team back to the ship and disengage from the station. Although the ship is safe, the infected crew member quickly becomes frenzied and attacks.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Drag him back to the Medbay.

event.text: You hold him down and the Medbay is able to stop whatever neurotoxin was on the ship from fully infecting your crew. Once he recovers, you prepare to fight off the scientists, who are beyond help.

choice.text: (Advanced Medbay) Have the Advanced Medbay analyze their condition.

event.text: You hold them off while retreating into the Medbay. Its advanced systems determine that an alien neurotoxin is driving your crew member insane. It synthesizes an antidote and releases it into the ship. After a time, the frenzied scientists recover and one offers to help out as thanks for saving them.
Inside there are signs of a great struggle; scientists lie dead where they fell, brutally dismembered. You grab a few research drone parts lying on a desk near the door and leave quickly.

You dock with the station and see a frantic person banging on the airlock door. Once inside your ship, he drops to the floor saying, "My... friends... They've gone insane... They're coming!" You hand him a blaster and turn to see a number of people charging toward the ship.

choice.text: (Advanced Medbay) Have the Advanced Medbay analyze their condition.

event.text: You hold them off while retreating into the Medbay. Its advanced systems determine that an alien neurotoxin is the cause of their frenzy. It synthesizes an antidote and releases it into the room. After a time, the scientists recover. One offers some scrap as a token of gratitude.

You send your Anti-Personnel drone to explore the station. What you find is disconcerting... It appears that something has caused the scientists and guards to tear each other to pieces. You abandon the drone on the station for fear that it is contagious.

Once on board the station, your drone is immediately beset by frenzied scientists and guards. It eventually gets torn apart by the mob but it has bought you enough time to disengage from the station and escape into empty space.
The cameras mounted to your Anti-Personnel drone show a chaotic scene. No people are to be found but the remnants of a recent battle on-board the ship are obvious.
You instruct the drone to retrieve some useful materials before leaving.
The cameras mounted to your Anti-Personnel drone show a chaotic scene. No people are to be found but the remnants of a recent battle on-board the ship are obvious.
You instruct the drone to retrieve some useful materials before leaving.
The cameras mounted to your Anti-Personnel drone show a chaotic scene. No people are to be found but the remnants of a recent battle on-board the ship are obvious.
You instruct the drone to retrieve some useful materials before leaving.
The cameras mounted to your Anti-Personnel drone show a chaotic scene. No people are to be found but the remnants of a recent battle on-board the ship are obvious.
You instruct the drone to retrieve some useful materials before leaving.

event.name: BOARDERS_ASTEROID_PRIZRAK
event.text: You jump into the middle of an asteroid field. Looking around, you find you are surrounded by dozens of wrecks of other ships. Faint wisps of light can be seen moving between wrecks. As you watch, they seem to be changing path and floating toward your ship!
Your team is terrified that they have to fight off the ghosts! A few large asteroids break through the ship's protective barriers.

choice.text: (Improved Engines) Activate full impulse drive to escape.

event.text: With your Advanced Engines you were able to quickly get out of the asteroid field, however your ship took a number of hits on the way out.

choice.text: (Improved Piloting) Have your pilot maneuver you out of the asteroid field.

event.text: Thanks to your pilot, you were able escape the worst of the asteroid field unscathed. However, the wisps of light stream out of the field following your ship!

event.name: AUTO_ASTEROID
event.text: You arrive in an asteroid belt to discover that a Rebel automated-scout has been stationed here. Prepare for a fight!

event.name: AUTO_SUN
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to find yourself dangerously close to a star. An automated Rebel ship, impervious to the heat, moves in to engage.

textList.name: STORE_TEXT
textList.text: A ship engineer has set up a small shop here.
You find yourself surrounded by a group of mysterious alien vessels. They hail you and apparently have some valuable technology for sale.
A transmission from the nearby planet indicates an outpost below which offers supplies to travelers. You send down an away party to check it out.
The space station here has a traveling merchant who shows you his wares.

There is only one other ship at this beacon, and it is showing heavy damage. You receive a message on your console: "Greetings traveler. We were crippled by a band of pirates and are now forced to sell our remaining valuable equipment to acquire the necessary supplies to get home."

event.name: SPECIAL_STORE
event.text: You were already heading to the local store, when a tattered Federation ship, located nearby, comes into communications. Their captain suggests to take you to "good friends" who are also involved in trade and have a "top quality" product. For their services as guide, they ask for a bit of scrap.

choice.text: Pay the fee to look at the "top quality" product in another store.

event.text: The captain accepts the payment and proposes for you to follow them.

You fly for a bit, keeping the jump beacon within sight. The Federation ship in front of you slows down at the store, hidden behind another station. You are told to wait, and after a while the owner of the store gets in touch to discuss the "special offer".
It turns out they have a pre-igniter without factory marks. Its use can be risky, and even the owner asks for a round sum.

choice.text: Take the risk and pay the required amount.

event.text: The owner joyfully rubs their hands, takes your scrap and gives an order to their workers to install a pre-igniter on your ship. It seems that everything is in order. You go to the store to look at the rest of the goods.

choice.text: Refuse and look at other goods instead.
Renounce their offer and go to this store.

textList.name: FIND_DRONE
textList.text: When you ask a nearby station for aid, a friendly programmer gives you the schematics for a drone!
An abandoned space station circles a lonely planet. A quick check yields schematics for a drone. You bring them aboard the ship.
Federation sympathizers contact you as you arrive. "We know your mission should be secret, so don't ask how we know about it. Take this schematic, it's all we can do to help."

A small Engi research vessel is trying to fend off a Mantis ship. You move in to engage, but after a quick scan of your ship the Mantis ship retreats. The Engi offer you a drone schematic as thanks for your timely arrival.
You find an abandoned mining station on a nearby moon. A quick scan shows no life forms; however, you discover a usable drone schematic!
You receive a wide-band message, "Free schematic samples! Be sure to visit our new military-grade drone store opening in sector XR1-45!"

textList.name: FIND_WEAPON
textList.text: Holy crap! A weapon is just floating in space!
You inform a nearby station of your flight from the Rebels. They offer to outfit your ship with a weapon and wish you well.
A settlement still loyal to the Federation hails your ship. They have prepared a weapon to aid your escape from the Rebels.
As soon as you arrive a small Mantis ship detaches from a wreck and jumps away. You must have interrupted their salvage operation because you find a weapon ready to be installed!
A small merchant ship messages you, "Underground Federation comm channels are all talking about your 'secret' mission. Let us install a weapon to help. Good luck!"
Debris from a battle is scattered around this system. A few pieces bounce against your ship. You passively scan them and discover there is a functioning weapon among them!

textList.name: FREE_ITEMS
textList.text: You arrive in a system and immediately discover a pirate ship nearby. Strangely, scans indicate there are no lifeforms aboard. You salvage anything useful, but find no clue as to the whereabouts of the former crew.
Not much remains in this abandoned system; however, scans reveal a nearby mining platform with some salvageable materials.
As you arrive in the system you are hailed by a loyalist settlement. Upon learning of your quest, they offer you supplies.
Debris from a forgotten battle still orbits the gas giant in this system. Some of it still might be usable.

You receive a message from a nearby station, "A Federation cruiser jumping into Rebel territory? Quite the bold move." You quickly move to arm the weapons but he continues, "Lucky for you we're not all in support of the Rebellion. Perhaps these supplies will help you get to friendlier space alive."
You happen upon the remains of a space station. It has been mostly picked clean but there appears to be a few materials that will aid you in your mission.

textList.name: FUEL_FOR_DRONE
textList.text: A nearby space station hails you. "Greetings! Your arrival is most fortuitous. We recently came across some extra drones. If you have some fuel, perhaps we can make a deal?"
A strange vessel approaches. A digital message appears on your view-screen: "This is an automated merchant. Refill this vessel with fuel and it will supply you with drones."
You arrive in the sector and are greeted by a science vessel waiting by the beacon. They hail you, "We find ourselves low on fuel and have a proposition."

textList.name: FUEL_FOR_DRONE_ACCEPT
textList.text: You drain some of your fuel in exchange for the drone parts.

event.name: REFUEL_STATION
event.text: A ship refueling station is stationed at this beacon. We can purchase fuel here.
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."

event.name: NEW_REPAIR_STATION
event.text: You see a small station fitted with hundreds of Repair drones. You receive an automated message, "We don't know who you are and we don't care, but this is the right place for some ship repair!"
"Thank you for your business, no refunds!"
"Thank you for your business, no refunds!"
"Thank you for your business, no refunds!"
"Thank you for your business, no refunds!"
"Thank you for your business, no refunds!"

event.name: SELL_MISSILES_STATION
event.text: There is a black market hub here. You receive a message, "These are dangerous times. If you have extra military-grade explosives, we'll gladly pay you for them."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."

choice.text: Produce missiles using your missile replicator to sell more of them.

event.text: You prepare the replicator for operation.
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."

choice.text: Change your mind and don't sell any missiles.

event.name: SELL_DRONES_STATION
event.text: You see a civilian space station with heavy damage. You receive a message, "We've been hit hard by the war. We need more drone parts to speed up our repairs. We'll buy some from you if you have extra."
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."

textList.name: TRADER_CIV
textList.text: You arrive at a quiet spaceport and are immediately hailed by another ship at port with a "once in a lifetime deal!"
You jump into a sector filled with civilian activity. Your scan the various advertisement channels while waiting for your FTL to charge, and are intrigued by a grey-market shipwright.
Your ship is flooded with advertisement transmissions from nearby merchants as soon as you arrive at this beacon. You arbitrarily pick one to examine in detail.
Despite the barren area, a trader has set up shop at this beacon. He presents his offer.
The beacon at first glance seems home to a junk yard. Upon closer inspection, it reveals itself to be a ramshackle market. One trader has a deal that catches your eye.
A pawn broker has set up shop at this obscure beacon. He might be offering something worth looking at.

choice.text: This is a great opportunity. Let's dock and see if we can find valuable supplies.
We're in a hurry, let's just quickly pull some scrap off the ship.
Something seems wrong here. Let's just leave.

textList.name: PRIZRAK_SHIP_TEXT
textList.text: This beacon lies in an empty section of space. You almost move on before spotting a heavily damaged ship drifting nearby. The ship's markings are unfamiliar.
You share this beacon with just one other ship, but it appears ancient and long since abandoned.

Another ship is jumping away just as you arrive. They send out a quick communication before their jump completes: "That ruined bulk is more trouble than it's worth." You see a drifting, abandoned vessel nearby.
There's a heavily damaged ship at this beacon. You briefly pick up a very distorted communication from the ship but are unable to understand it. Your sensors detect no life-signs.

event.text: Your crew complains of hearing strange voices as they work. One requests that they end the salvage operation early.

choice.text: They're being ridiculous. Finish the job.
They've gathered enough supplies. Let's get going.
(Advanced Sensors) Wait, sensors are picking up something strange...

event.text: Your sensors are picking up some subtle but anomalous activity, it's as if the ship is slowly activating. You pull everyone back to your ship with what they have gathered.

event.name: PRIZRAK_SCRAP
event.text: You recover what you can before making preparations to jump away.
Suddenly the wreckage powers up. Still no life-signs are detected. You have no idea who's piloting the ship, but it has clearly become hostile.
You receive a transmission from the ship: "You got what you came for. Now leave us!" No life-signs are detected still.

choice.text: You take the empty ship's advice and leave.
This ship could be dangerous to future travelers. We should destroy it.

event.text: The salvage operation ends without a hitch. You get your crew-members back on board and prepare to jump away.
Just as they're finishing the salvage operation, your crew reports they're being attacked by what they claim to be the ghosts of the previous crew. They seem confident they can deal with them though.

choice.text: Order your crew to retreat with what they can and get back to the ship.
Order them to stand their ground, they should be able to handle a few ghosts.

event.text: The fight doesn't doesn't go well. Eventually your crew is forced to abandon the supplies and retreat of their own accord.
The ghosts prove to be even weaker than you'd expected. Your crew quickly mops them up and brings back a large cache of supplies.
Your crew is losing the fight against the ghosts. If this continues, you'll lose everyone.

choice.text: Retreat if possible, but protecting the ship is the primary goal.

event.text: You lose a crew-member to the fight but manage to escape the ghost ship and its inhabitants.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: You get back to find your crew-member cloned, though annoyed with the command decisions that lead to his death.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

event.name: PRIZRAK_BOARDED
event.text: The ghosts follow your crew-members back on board the ship!

event.name: MERCHANT_REQUEST
event.text: You arrive at a populated sector. One merchant seems to be mass-broadcasting a request for a mercenary ship to aid them. Shall we respond?

"Great, I was worried no one would respond. My usual carrier is days late. I need you to deliver this cargo of drone parts to a small station a few jumps from here. We can't afford to pay another carrier, but they will surely tip you generously."
"Great! I uploaded their location to your star map. I'm running out of options, so I have no choice but to trust you'll do what you have agreed to do."
"Fine, I'll keep looking for someone who wishes to make some easy money..."

"Your ship seems reasonably equipped... A freighter carrying a shipment of my goods is a week late. The fools flew through a pirate-filled sector in their haste and I fear for the cargo's safety. I'm looking for a less incompetent captain to investigate."
"At least you're confident, for what little that's worth. Here is their last known location." You are given some scrap in advance.
"At least YOU are willing to admit your incompetence. Thank you for saving me the cost of paying more fools to go to their death."

event.name: MERCHANT_DELIVER
event.text: You arrive at the location given to you by the merchant. You are supposed to deliver drone parts to a station here.

You find the station and they respond to your hails immediately, saying, "It took you long enough! We have practically no use for these now... I refuse to pay full price, take this and leave the cargo in our holds."
You drop the parts off and take your pay.

choice.text: Refuse and keep the drone parts.
(Mind Control) Convince him that he's being 'unfair'.

event.text: "I'm being unfair. You did the job and the parts are here safe and sound. Here is the agreed upon amount."

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Your Slug says he's bluffing.

event.text: "Fine, I was bluffing. I'll pay the full price".

choice.text: (Advanced Weapons) Remain silent but power up your weapons.

event.text: "You make a good point. You traveled all the way out here to fulfill our request, despite what must have been... a difficult scenario to cause such a delay. Here, we'll even tip you for the inconvenience you must have gone through..."

event.name: MERCHANT_DELIVER_LIST_CHECK_CARGO
event.text: You find the small research station and discover that it's putting out a distress signal. Strangely, there is no response to your hails.

choice.text: Dock with the station and investigate.
Dock with the station and investigate.
(Anti-Personnel Drone) Use an Anti-Personnel Drone to investigate.

event.text: "Fine, I was bluffing. I'll pay the full price".
The merchant disconnects in a huff.

event.name: MERCHANT_INVESTIGATE
event.text: You arrive at the last known location of the merchant's delivery. You begin to scan for the lost ship.

You find the remains of the ship. It seems to have severe external damage, but you cannot pinpoint a cause. The majority of its cargo seems intact. You manage to discern the ship's intended destination.

choice.text: Take the cargo and head to its original destination in search of a reward.

event.text: You transfer the cargo to your ship and mark the target on the map.

You find a severely damaged ship floating among some debris. The crew hails you, "I can't believe that cheap bastard sent someone after us! I thought we would freeze to death. If you help us complete the delivery, we'll share the reward and join your crew."

choice.text: Promise to deliver the cargo and ask if any would be interested in joining your crew.

event.text: They upload the delivery destination once on board. One takes you up on your offer, the rest you drop off at a nearby station.

choice.text: Take the cargo but drop them off at a nearby station.
(Teleporter) Beam the cargo aboard and leave them to their fate.

event.text: After a quick scan, you find a ship being chased by a pirate. This must be the missing delivery ship! You move in to rescue them.
The cargo was some food and medical supplies, nothing that you need right now. You make a note of the delivery destination in case you want to drop off the cargo for the payment.
You find a weapon inside. You quickly install it on the ship and move on.
There were general military supplies in the cargo crates. You take what you can use.
Inside you find a weapon. You quickly install it on your ship and move on.
The cargo boxes contain mostly military supplies. You take everything that might come in handy.

event.name: MERCHANT_INVESTIGATE_DELIVER
event.text: You find the station that had ordered your cargo. You drop it off and they respond, "Ignoring the fact that this is days late, we really appreciate that you delivered our materials. We realize how dangerous this sector is these days. Take this as payment."

event.name: FEDERATION_PLANET_SIGNAL
event.text: A Federation encrypted signal is being broadcast from a nearby planet.

choice.text: Send an away party to investigate.
It could be a trap. Let's move on.

event.text: You find a secret Federation outpost. They are regrettably out of supplies but are eager to tell you of another secret base. They give you the coordinates.

You find a hidden Federation outpost. They message you, "Quick, we just got word from a sister outpost that they've been discovered by the Rebels and are under attack! If you are still loyal to the Federation, go save them!"

You find a secret Federation outpost... but it appears the Rebels have found it before you; the place is empty and faint bloodstains can be seen in the living quarters. You find the encrypted signal emitter and shut it off before leaving.
You find a small cache of supplies that were surely left for any loyal Federation ships in trouble. You take all that you need, leaving some for others to find.
As you approach the signal you receive a message on a Rebel channel, "I knew we'd catch some Federation fish with this signal. Prepare to be boarded, scum!"

You find the planet at the indicated coordinates. Your initial scans show the planet to be barren and devoid of life, but you get a prompt reply when you broadcast on Federation frequencies. "Hello! So nice to see friends. We'll bring you up some supplies."
By following the directions given to you, you find a well-disguised outpost. You are welcomed by a friendly face who offers to assist you in your quest by joining your crew.
After a quick search you discover the hidden Federation space-dock. They offer you some supplies in addition to fully repairing your ship.
You search near the coordinates given to you, but your search yields no results. Perhaps they were mistaken.

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Run a second scan pass.

event.text: Your improved sensors pick faint signatures of what appears to be a storage space hidden under the rock. You find the access point and discover a supply cache whose Federation signal emitter has malfunctioned.

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Run a second scan pass.

event.text: Your advanced sensors pick faint signatures of what appears to be a storage space hidden under the rock. You find the access point and discover a weapons cache whose Federation signal emitter has malfunctioned.

Your improved scanners pick faint signatures of what appears to be a storage space hidden under the rock. You find the access point and discover a weapons cache whose Federation signal emitter has malfunctioned.
You arrive in the sector to see a small outpost being bombarded by an automated drone. This must be the Federation base you were told about!
You arrive in the sector to see a small outpost being bombarded by an automated drone. This must be the Federation base you were told about!

Upon arrival in the sector, you see a Federation outpost being attacked by a group of Rebels. Nevertheless, while you were approaching, the soldiers of the outpost charged their Anti-Ship Battery and managed to destroy two small enemy ships. You fly into the formation of the remaining opponents and attack the commander of the Rebel group.

Upon arrival in the sector, you see how a small Federation outpost is firing from its Anti-Ship Battery on automated drones. Judging by the abundance of debris from many ships, the main heat of the battle is already over. You rush to the rescue.
"Great. Take this bit of fuel as a down-payment. We'll be one step behind you, following your jump signatures. Don't want to take any risks now, do we?"
"We understand. Not everyone is confident they can survive in these hostile times, let alone take the responsibility of protecting others."

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Send them data of a safe route.

event.text: "You have greatly helped us out with this information!" They send you supplies in gratitude.

textList.name: QUEST_ESCORT_TEXT
textList.text: After a short time you receive a message, "Hello. I hope it's not a bother, but I'm looking for an escort to a nearby system. This region is quite dangerous and our ship is not well-armed."
There is a single ship at this beacon. They hail you, "We could really use some help. Our FTL navigation system is shot. Can you help us get to a nearby station where they can patch us up?"
"Hello," your communicator opens a hail from a nearby ship. "Our weapon systems are malfunctioning and we're too afraid of pirates to travel home unassisted. Can you escort us?"

event.text: You escort the ship to the requested beacon. Much to your dismay you are ambushed by a Rebel ship. You walked right into their trap!
Shortly after you arrive, the ship you were escorting jumps nearby. They thank you for your help and offer you a reward.
The ship you were escorting thanks you, "I don't think we could have made it without your help. Let my friends patch up some of your hull and show you their wares."
You arrive and the ship you were escorting jumps in behind you. "Thanks for the help. We work at a nearby fusion power plant, we could try to improve your reactor's output as a form of compensation."

event.name: STORE_RESCUE
event.text: Once you arrive at this populated region, you immediately pick up a distress signal. A small shuttle is asking anyone who'll listen for help protecting their family from a Rebel ship. Unsurprisingly, no one has yet responded to their request.

choice.text: See if you can assist them.

event.text: It seems that a small space dock has done something to anger the Rebels. The store there is run by his family and he pleads that you rescue them. He uploads the coordinates of the station to your navigation system.
You block the channel and prepare to jump as soon as possible.

event.name: QUEST_STORE
event.text: You follow the directions given to you and find the hidden space dock. The owner hails you, "I got a message that you were coming. I don't normally offer goods to strangers, but I'll make an exception. Take a look."

event.name: QUEST_STORE_RESCUE
event.text: Once you arrive at the beacon you detect a Rebel scout assaulting a compound on a nearby desolate moon.

choice.text: Engage the Rebel and rescue the space dock.

event.text: After a time the ship powers down its weapons and jumps away. No life-signs are detected on the moon.

event.name: MERCENARY_WORK_START
event.text: You are immediately contacted by a settlement, "Hello, travelers. Your ship seems to be outfitted for combat...care to take up a bit of mercenary work?"

"A space dock is under assault from the Rebels. Although the dock is... technically... illegal within their laws, it's very important for our trade. We'll pay you in fuel and scrap if you promise to save them."
They transmit the space dock's coordinates.
They regretfully accept your decision.

"Some of our friends have taken to piracy in the recent chaos of the war. We'd like you to "convince" them of their poor decision by severely damaging their ship. We'll pay you well as long as you don't kill them all."

"Just be sure not to blow them up!" they say nervously as they direct you to a nearby moon. You find the pirate ship docked there. They immediately respond to your appearance with, "Your money or your life!" They must be new to this.
"Fine. I don't know what we'll do about them though..." You prepare to jump away from this sector.

"Captain, our business partners decided to leave the business. It would be fine otherwise, but they owe us and don't intend to repay. They are not far from this planet... will you help us reclaim that debt?"
"Do what you want with them, but don't damage the equipment they owe us," they specify and transmit the coordinates of the ship.
You rush into battle!

choice.text: (Advanced Weapons) Activate your entire arsenal in front of the ship and report that you've arrived to settle the debt.

event.text: The captain of the ship confusedly reports that they were just going to return everything anyway, after which they give you the equipment. Returning to the settlement, you get a well-deserved reward.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew Members) Contact the captain of the ship, show them your terrifying crew and remind them of the debt they owe.

event.text: The captain of the ship confusedly reports that they were just going to return everything anyway, after which they give you the value owed. Returning to the settlement, you get a well-deserved reward.
You fly away. Space is already too dangerous.
"Okay. We'll figure it out ourselves."

surrender.text: In the comms link, you see your opponent waving some white rag. It seems they want to surrender.

event.text: You take the debt and return it to the settlement, fetching a well-deserved reward.

destroyed.text: Having destroyed the valuable equipment along with the ship, you decide against reporting back to the settlement and instead just collect everything that survived.

deadCrew.text: With the last of the crew dead, you clean out their holds...

event.text: ... and you give the settlers back their valuable equipment, receiving a well-deserved reward.

event.name: QUEST_MANTIS_INVASION_START
event.text: You receive a request, "All of our military ships have been destroyed or damaged during the rebellion. However, there have been reports of a Mantis war camp only a few jumps from us. Can you help?"

choice.text: Pledge to do what you can.

event.text: "Thank you! If you can just give us a count on their numbers perhaps we can get the Rebels to help."
There's no way you are crazy enough to want to take on a Mantis war-band.

event.name: QUEST_MANTIS_INVASION
event.text: You find the Mantis encampment but there are far too many of them to count accurately. You send a long range message back to the settlement with your findings but unfortunately there's not much you can do. It would be suicide to attack directly.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) A crewman suggests using the lifeform scanner to ascertain the number of Mantises.

event.text: You start the scan... The counter on the monitor reaches 161, at which point it stops. You return to high orbit and send the additional data with the figures to the settlement. In gratitude, the give you the coordinates of a secret Federation base, where you can look forward to a reward.

choice.text: (Techno-missiles) Bombard the hangar with the ships.

event.text: You fire a volley of techno-missiles on the hangar. Their defense systems prove incapable of taking out the cloaked missiles, leaving most of the ships too damaged to fight, but one still takes off!

You fire at their fuel depot, but a shot from the surface rips the missile to shreds. They must have a planetary defense system set up already! You try to get away but a nearby patrol ship moves in to attack.

choice.text: (Two Fire Bombs) Teleport fire bombs into their key structures.

event.text: It appears they have not set up a Teleporter disruption field yet. You deposit one bomb in a fuel depot and another in the barracks. Mantis comm channels fill with panicked chatter and you watch a number of structures go up in flames.
With most of their ships and forces focused on the chaos, you slip undetected to a nearby depot. You find some useful resources and an Engi slave who gladly accepts your liberation.

choice.text: (Biological Bomb) Teleport a bio-bomb into their command center.

event.text: It appears they have not set up a Teleporter disruption field yet. You deposit a bio-bomb in the command center, and after a few seconds an explosion is heard, filling Mantis comm channels with panicked chatter... it seems that you managed to kill one of their commanders!
With most of their ships and forces focused on the chaos, you slip undetected to a nearby depot. You find some useful resources and an Engi slave who gladly accepts your liberation.

choice.text: (Stealth Beam Drone) Burn the camp with a cloaked beam drone.

event.text: The Mantis are unable to detect the source of danger, and your drone attacks their settlement. After a while, only smoking ruins remain of the camp, and you move in to collect the remaining supplies.
While you were gathering supplies, a Mantis patrol ship approached the camp! Prepare to fight!

choice.text: (Decoy Combat Drone) Distract the Mantis using your decoy drone.

event.text: You launch a decoy drone into the Mantis encampment, and by yourself on an inconspicuous trajectory you enter the equipment warehouse...
...the Mantis go crazy in desperate attempts to take out the annoying drone, and in the meantime you quietly load up with useful materials and fly away.
As you try to leave, a patrol spots you. Wailing sirens begin to blare around the camp and the ship moves in to attack!
They must have been focused on setting up camp since you got far enough away to attempt a jump without being noticed.

destroyed.text: With the patrol ship destroyed you hasten to leave. It won't be long before the other ships catch up.

deadCrew.text: With the patrol ship taken care of you hasten to leave. It won't be long before the other ships catch up.

event.name: QUEST_CREWDEAD_START
event.text: You arrive to find a number of ships convening around a station. There is some unencrypted chatter between the ships, you tune in and listen for anything interesting.
Overhearing their conversation, it seems they're going to sabotage the incoming Rebel Fleet, but they need drone parts.

choice.text: Attack them before they go to the Rebels.
Give them the drone parts they require.

event.text: They thank you for your help, and after filling up on missiles, the group of ships jumps towards the Rebel Fleet. They'll no doubt delay the advance for a quite a while.
If they wanted your help they would surely ask for it. You prepare to leave.
Overhearing their conversation, it seems they're going to destroy a nearby Mantis encampment, but they need more ammunition.

choice.text: Attack them before they go to the camp.

event.text: Sell how many missiles?
You make a profitable trade and then move on.
You make a profitable trade and then move on.
You make a profitable trade and then move on.
You decide against selling missiles and then move on.

choice.text: Offer to join the group and help them attack the camp.

event.text: You're given a bit of fuel to get to the beacon near the Mantis encampment. After jotting down the coordinates, you charge up your FTL engines. The group of armed ships heads in the direction toward the camp, and promise to wait for you.
If they wanted your help they would surely ask for it. You prepare to leave.

event.name: QUEST_CREWDEAD_START_2_CHECK_CARGO
event.text: Overhearing their conversation, it seems that they need to take possession of an enemy ship intact.
They briefly scan your ship and inform you that you are not "properly equipped" for this type of mission.
If they wanted your help they would surely ask for it. You prepare to leave.

choice.text: (Baton Beam) Offer to "remove" their crew with your beam.
(Bo Beam) Offer to "remove" their crew with your beam.
(Staff Beam) Offer to "remove" their crew with your beam.
(Mace Beam) Offer to "remove" their crew with your beam.
(Fire Beam) Offer to burn their crew.
(Flamberge Beam) Offer to burn their crew.
(Fire Bomb) Offer to burn their crew.
(Biological Bomb) Offer to "remove" their crew with your bio-bomb.
(Fire Vulcan) Offer to burn their crew.
(Antipersonnel Laser) Offer to slice up their crew with your light laser.
(Assault Weapon) Offer to shoot their crew.
(Light Crystal Weapon) Offer to show their crew the strength of crystal weaponry.
(Light Combat Drone) Offer to release a light combat drone against them.
(Combat Repair Drone) Offer to release a combat repair drone against them
(Plasma Thrower) Offer to test a plasma weapon on them.
(Fire Artillery Beam) Offer to burn their crew.
(Reinforced Order Beam) Offer to burn their crew.
(Nemesis Fire Beam) Offer to burn their crew.
(Plasma Artillery) Offer to burn their crew.
(Breach Bomb Artillery) Offer to "remove" their crew.
(Small Slurm Queen) Offer to "remove" their crew.
(Breaching Artillery Beam) Offer to cut down and strangle their crew.
(Slug Artillery) Offer to cut up their crew with your artillery.
(Boarding Drone) Offer to seize control of their ship with your boarding drone.
(Prototype) Convince them that your unusual weapon can take care of this task.

event.name: QUEST_CREWDEAD_CONTINUE
event.text: They quickly scan your ship and say, "It appears you could help. A bandit has made off with some very important cargo, though I doubt they have any understanding of what it is they stole. We need you to capture the ship intact.
"Great, we'll relay their coordinates. Remember, do NOT destroy that ship! Remember, we'll be right behind you."
"We understand. Hopefully we can find a solution to this on our own." You prepare to jump.

event.name: QUEST_CREWDEAD
event.text: You find the ship that you were asked to capture intact. You're not sure why, but they stressed that it's of great importance that you kill the crew WITHOUT destroying the ship.

destroyed.text: The explosion rocks the pirate ship and a brilliant light begins to shine from the wreckage. Before you can react the ship is consumed in a massive chain of explosions that send you careening toward a nearby planet. You struggle to put out the fires and your pilot desperately tries to get the controls online before you're dragged down to the surface. Apparently when they said the ship should not be destroyed they had good reason...

deadCrew.text: You secure the ship and wait for the merchants to arrive. Upon arrival they message you, saying "Good job. We would prefer if you did not speak of this to anyone."

event.text: The group of armed ships, seeing your actions, decide to leave the beacon. Only one small ship remains, readying themselves to defend against your assault.
The group of armed ships, seeing your actions, fire a volley at you, after which they decide to leave the beacon. Only one small ship remains, readying themselves to defend against your assault.
The group of armed ships, seeing your actions, fire a volley at you, after which they decide to leave the beacon. Only one small ship remains, readying themselves to defend against your assault.

escape.text: Looks like the ship is trying to get away!

gotaway.text: The ship made an FTL jump...

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect all that survives the explosion.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead, you scour the ship's holds for everything of value.

event.name: QUEST_MANTIS_BIGHIVE
event.text: Upon arrival at the target beacon, you're met by the group of armed allied ships. After discussing the details of the operation, you rush into the attack on the Mantis encampment. Each of the ships in the group takes on one Mantis target. You hear a battle cry throughout the comms system — "These insects will pay for what they've done!!!"

destroyed.text: The target ship breaks apart, and you grab all that survives the explosion.

deadCrew.text: With the target's crew dead, you scour the ship's holds for everything of value.

event.text: You look around the battlefield and with horror you realize that your valiant squad is almost completely destroyed. Only a couple of surviving ships desperately try to escape. You fly away from the beacon, but the Mantis aren't far behind, and they somehow manage to teleport a group of their invaders aboard your ship.
You look around the battlefield and watch as the last of the Mantis ships explodes. Your squadron thanks you for your help to seal a true victory, and share what loot they've captured.
"Wait! We didn't understand each other! Maybe you'll take this?! We have absolutely nothing left at all!"
"Wait! We didn't understand each other! Maybe you'll take this?! We have absolutely nothing left at all!"
"Wait! If you take this and let us go, we'll tell our superiors that you left in another direction!"
The Rebels transmit false information about your location. Now the Fleet will briefly lose you.

textList.name: PIRATE_SURRENDER_TEXT
textList.text: "Alright, you win! Here's some equipment from our stores, leave us alone!"
The ship repeatedly hails you. It looks like they want to surrender.
"You are considerably more well-armed than I would have thought. We surrender."
They send you a message: "Your ship is surprisingly well equipped! Please take this and let us live."
"Please don't kill us. We will give you everything we have!"
They offer you some of their cargo if you let them live.
They offer to give you some of their goods if you don't destroy their ship.
You get a frantic message, "Take everything we have! Just don't kill us."
"You have clearly bested us. We merely request our lives."
"You have made your point, we are beaten. Take these and leave us to our shame."
"Take everything we have and let's both forget this happened."

event.name: PIRATE_SURRENDER_CIVILAN
event.text: The pirates must not have been fully committed to the assault; they have been charging their FTL. They jump away, presumably to repair their ship.

event.name: PIRATE_ESCAPE
event.text: The enemy ship appears to be powering up its FTL. It's trying to escape!

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_STUFF_MED
event.text: There are no more life-signs remaining on the ship. You manage to pick out some supplies.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_STANDARD_LOW
event.text: There are no more life-signs remaining on the ship. You manage to pick out some supplies.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_STANDARD_MED
event.text: There are no more life-signs remaining on the ship. You strip it of useful materials.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_STANDARD_RANDOM
event.text: There are no more life-signs remaining on the ship. You take out all materials that look useful.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_STANDARD_HIGH
event.text: There are no more life-signs remaining on the ship. You take out all materials that look useful.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_FUEL_MED
event.text: With the crew dead, you are able to take the remnants of fuel out of storage. You also take all the scrap you can manage.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_FUEL_HIGH
event.text: With the crew dead, you are able to take the fuel out of storage. You also take all the scrap you can manage.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_FUEL_RANDOM
event.text: With the crew dead, you are able to take the fuel out of storage. You also take all the scrap you can manage.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_CREW
event.text: Now that their ship has been emptied of hostiles, you search it. Eventually you find a prisoner who offers to join your crew.
The former prisoner embarks on their new duties.

choice.text: Drop them off at the next station.

event.text: As thanks for saving them, they give you everything of value that wasn't stolen from them.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_WEAPON_RANDOM
event.text: You find a weapon system on their ship. With no crew to stop you, you can install it on your own.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_DEFAULT_WEAPON_LOW
event.text: You find a weapon system on their ship. With no crew to stop you, you can install it on your own.
With the crew dead, you strip the ship of all available scrap.

textList.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_CHOICE
textList.text: You find a number of slaves in the cargo hold. They look at you questioningly and one asks if they're to be released. You could use more crew but you don't want to force them all to work for you instead...

choice.text: Invite the Mantis to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Rockman to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Engi to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Human to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Slug to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Zoltan to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Mantis to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Zoltan to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Slug to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Rockman to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Engi to join your crew and release the rest.
Invite the Human to join your crew and release the rest.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_CHOICE_MANTIS
event.text: The Mantis seems fine with the orders, saying "I'm on board if it means we get to kill some Rebels!" You drop the rest off at a nearby station.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_CHOICE_ROCK
event.text: The Rockman remains silent and you worry there might be trouble. However when you ask them to perform a task they act without complaint. Perhaps they won't be a problem.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_CHOICE_ENGI
event.text: "Verify primary object is to defeat Rebels, re-establish peace?" You nod and they respond, "Acceptable." You drop the rest off at a nearby station and strip the ship.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_CHOICE_HUMAN
event.text: The Human has supported the Federation for as long as they can remember, so it's no surprise when they say they'll go with you to the end.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_CHOICE_SLUG
event.text: The Slug doesn't show much enthusiasm when you invite them into your crew. In any case, you should keep an eye on them.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_CHOICE_ZOLTAN
event.text: The Zoltan begins to glow brightly when you invite them to your crew. You've already started to worry, but it seems that it was just a sign of welcome.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_CREW
event.text: It appears the slaves did not survive the fighting. You find their burnt bodies in the hold, but before you leave the ship you hear faint noises in the walls. You break off a latch and a slave falls out of a hidden compartment, coughing. Once recomposed the slave offers to join your crew.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_NOTHING
event.text: You scan the ship and detect no life signs. It appears the slaves died in the fight. You prepare to jump.

event.name: DESTROYED_DEFAULT_STUFF_LOW
event.text: The ship explodes, leaving behind a small amount of useful scrap material.

event.name: DESTROYED_DEFAULT_STANDARD_LOW
event.text: The ship explodes, leaving behind a small amount of useful scrap material.

event.name: DESTROYED_DEFAULT_STANDARD_MED
event.text: The ship explodes, leaving behind some amount of useful scrap material.

event.name: DESTROYED_DEFAULT_STANDARD_HIGH
event.text: The ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a small amount of useful scrap.

event.name: ASTEROID_DERELICT_SHIP
event.text: A strange ship devoid of signs of life forms within a nearby dense asteroid field is giving off the distress call. Shall we investigate? It could be dangerous.
Discretion is the better part of valor. Better not risk it.

choice.text: (Rock Armor Plating) Make a thorough search for the ship without fear of stray asteroids.

event.text: You find what appears to be pieces of a derelict ship coated with ice or crystal. Before you have a chance to dock, a few asteroids get past your shields and partially damage your engines. You'll have to pull out!
The abandoned ship is badly damaged, but there are still some supplies inside. You pick out all that looks useful before undocking your ship and moving on.

You find the decaying remains of some kind of ship coated with ice or crystal. You send some crew aboard to explore. Nearly everything is either destroyed or unidentifiable, but one of the weapons appears salvageable and there's a strange stasis pod that catches your eye.
It looks like a massive asteroid is in a direct collision course with the derelict ship! You have to pull your crew out but they want to grab what they can first. What do they take?

choice.text: Take the weapon and any spare scrap.

event.text: Your crew grabs what they can and returns to the ship before an asteroid hits.
Your crew drags the pod back to your ship before the asteroid smashes into the ship.
The pod appears to be functioning but you see nothing but shards of crystal inside. Perhaps someone else will know how to open it.

You find the decaying remains of some kind of ship coated with ice or crystal. You send some crew aboard to explore. Nearly everything is either destroyed or unidentifiable, but one of the weapons appears salvageable and there's a strange stasis pod that catches your eye.
It looks like a massive asteroid is in a direct collision course with the derelict ship! You have to pull your crew out but they want to grab what they can first. What do they take?

choice.text: Take the weapon and any spare scrap.

event.text: Your crew grabs what they can and returns to the ship before an asteroid hits.
Your crew drags the pod back to your ship before an asteroid smashes into the ship.
The pod appears to be functioning but you see nothing but shards of crystal inside. Perhaps someone else will know how to open it.

destroyed.text: The strange ship breaks apart, sending its shattered icy crystalline coating out into the depths of the asteroid field... you move in to scrap what little remains of the ship.

deadCrew.text: The crew is dead...

event.name: ZOLTAN_CREW_STUDY
event.text: You arrive at a Zoltan research facility. They say they are researching genetic distortion due to stasis sleep and prolonged FTL travel. They ask if your crew has the time to undergo a few scans.
"Alright. Fly safe." You prepare to leave.

choice.text: (Advanced Medbay) Give them your medical records.

event.text: "Thank you! We didn't expect to receive such a significant amount of data regarding your crew's health during FTL travel. Please, accept this for your trouble."

choice.text: (Damaged Stasis Pod) Ask if they can fix this.

event.text: "Interesting. I've never seen a cryogenic system like this. It appears to still be functioning..." They hook it up to their system and run a number of tests on it.

"Amazing! It has the ability to reconstruct the body if it was damaged during transit. Watch." They reactivate the pod and you watch as the hunks of crystal inside reform to build a humanoid structure. The pod slides open and the re-formed alien steps out.

It speaks slowly, "Greetings. I appear to be in your debt. My people isolated themselves a long time ago, but perhaps it's time to re-establish a connection. There's a hidden wormhole near the Rock home-worlds. Perhaps you can take me there so I can properly repay you?"

Your crew calmly lines up for the Zoltans to take their readings. After a short time, the process is done. They contact you, "Thank you for your participation in our study. Please accept these small cakes made from stiff dough as well as some scrap."

Your crew calmly lines up for the Zoltans to take their readings. After a short time, the process is done. They contact you, "Thank you for your participation in our study. Please accept these small cakes made from stiff dough as well as some scrap."
As soon as you dock, pirates burst on board and a hostile ship appears on the radar. You hear the Zoltans yell in the distance, "We're being held hostage!"

event.name: ROCK_CRYSTAL_BEACON
event.text: An ancient device is orbiting within the crystal rings of a nearby gas giant. You can't discern its nature or function, but it seems to have been deactivated for a very long time. Perhaps you can get some scrap from it.
Better not risk it. The Rock people are unlikely to respond well to vandalism.
Your Crystalline companion says, "It looks like we have found the abandoned link to the Crystal home worlds. I can reactivate it." They transmit some codes to the device and it immediately powers on.

Before you can react, the space around you distorts and a wormhole forms. You begin to sound the alarm, but your companion calms you and indicates that you should fly directly into the wormhole. You reluctantly do as they say.
You break it apart and take it for scrap. Who needs it?
As you start to break it apart a Rock military ship jumps nearby, "You think you can come into our sector and just steal whatever you please?! Prepare to die, vandals!"

event.name: DONOR_PLAGUE
event.text: You arrive near a damaged and dilapidated space station. It appears to be abandoned but you detect faint life signatures on board.

choice.text: Dock with the station and look for survivors.

event.text: While waiting for the FTL Drive to charge, you skirt around the edge of the station and collect some scrap.

choice.text: (Avatar Crew Member) Send your Avatar to explore the station.
(Lifeform Scanner) Carry out a complete scan of the station using the lifeform scanner.

event.text: All around you is the stench of death and decay. The life sign readings must have been malfunctioning because you really doubt anything could be alive in here. You send the rest of the crew to scrap what little remains.

Human corpses are scattered across the station. You find the source of the signal, a lone survivor that locked themselves in a storage closet. You quickly retreat with them in tow back to the ship, and hope they can recover enough to be of some use.

All around you is the stench of death and decay. Some sort of disease must have wiped out this station. Fortunately, the Avatar isn't afraid of the disease, but the station is empty. Disappointed, you figure it's time to leave this place.
All around you is the stench of death and decay. The life sign readings must have been malfunctioning because you really doubt anything could be alive in here. You quickly return to the ship.

Human corpses are scattered across the station. You find the source of the signal, a lone survivor that locked themselves in a storage closet. You quickly retreat with them in tow back to the ship, and hope they can recover enough to be of some use.

All around you is the stench of death and decay. Suddenly, one of your crew bends over and starts retching violently. Some sort of disease must have wiped out this station. You pull back to the ship, but it looks like your crew member is not going to make it.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: You stop your crew's clone from forming, knowing that the disease would follow into his next life.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Try to cure the disease.

event.text: Your advanced medical suite is able to isolate the cause of the problem and administer an antidote. That was a close one.
As soon as a fresh batch of pheromones enters their lungs, they become better. That was close.
The scanner indicates that the station has no survivors. You can send your crew to look for something useful, but who knows why the station's personnel perished?

choice.text: Send your crew to the station.
Don't risk it and just fly away from here.

event.text: The scanner shows that there is a living person on the station, so you send your team after them. Human corpses are scattered across the station. You find the source of the signal, a lone survivor that locked themselves in a storage closet. You quickly retreat with them in tow back to the ship, and hope they can recover enough to be of some use.
All around you is the stench of death and decay. You quickly grab some scrap and return to the ship.

All around you is the stench of death and decay. Suddenly, one of your crew bends over and starts retching violently. Some sort of disease must have wiped out this station. You pull back to the ship, but it looks like your crew member is not going to make it.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: You stop your crew's clone from forming, knowing that the disease would follow into his next life.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Try to cure the disease.

event.text: Your advanced medical suite is able to isolate the cause of the problem and administer an antidote. That was a close one.
As soon as a fresh batch of pheromones enters their lungs, they become better. That was close.

event.name: DONOR_BLACK_RAVEN
event.text: As you jump in, you immediately see an impressive Slug pirate ship with "The Black Raven" painted on one side. They hail you, "Greetingsss. I am the dreaded pirate, Captain Nights. You mussst be full of fear, no? You have heard of me... no?"
"Well I have heard of you and I must see if you are as dangerousss as they say. I challenge you!"
You agree to an honest duel and order your crew to prepare to fight.
"I sssee... However you have no choice in the matter!" They move in to attack.

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Engage in a duel of the mind.

event.text: "I sssee you are intelligent. Let's sssee if you are as brave as they ssay. I challenge you to a duel! And there isss a great place nearby for thisss. Shall we fly?!"
"You, my friend, are a coward, and I have only one conversssation with cowardsss..." — Nights starts charging up their weapons!
You follow Captain Nights straight to a red hot star. Approaching, you begin the duel.
You follow Captain Nights straight to a bright pulsar. Approaching, you begin the duel.
You follow Captain Nights right into a dense asteroid field. Approaching, you begin the duel.
