Your Slug crewman's eyes glaze over as the two telepaths concentrate. You can only wonder what is happening. After a short time your comrade grunts in pain and collapses onto the floor, stunned. Nights responds, "Hah! It'll take more than that to defeat me! Let the real battle begin!"
Your Slug crewman's eyes glaze over as the two telepaths concentrate. You are powerless to help, but after a short time your comrade shakes off the daze and appears victorious.
His face contorted with pain, Nights concedes his defeat: "If this is the caliber of subordinatesss you keep, there iss no way we can defeat you. Take thisss and let us leave in shame."

surrender.text: "I see the rumorsss are true. I yield, we are no match for you. Take this and let us leave in ssshame."

event.text: He transfers over the goods and starts to repair his ship.
"Wait! There is no need to be...." You cut off the transmission and prepare to fire.

destroyed.text: "The Black Raven" breaks apart and you salvage its remains.

deadCrew.text: The once-dreaded pirate Nights has been killed and you proceed to loot their ship.

event.name: DONOR_MANTIS_CHASE
event.text: You are immediately hailed by an impressive looking Mantis ship, "Your ship would make a mighty fine prize. Prepare for battle!"

escape.text: You pick up more chatter from the enemy ship, "You know what... Forget this. Prepare for retreat!" Looks like they're preparing to make a hasty get away!

gotaway.text: The ship made an emergency FTL jump, but it looks like they didn't mask their signatures. You could easily follow them if you want.

event.text: You input their coordinates into your map and prepare to follow.
They're not worth the trouble. You prepare to leave.

destroyed.text: Their ship breaks apart and you move in to scrap the remains.

deadCrew.text: With no more crew on board you are free to salvage what you can from the remains.

event.name: DONOR_MANTIS_CHASE2
event.text: You catch up with the Mantis ship that escaped before, only to see them transferring their crew into an even bigger ship!
"Not YOU again! Do you know how much these repairs are going to cost me? Time to take out the big guns."

escape.text: They appear to be trying to get away again. You doubt they'll forget to mask their jump signature this time.

gotaway.text: Looks like they got away. At least you're able to scrap their abandoned fighter.

surrender.text: "Look, you proved your point. We don't want to die... Take this and let us go. Please?"

event.text: "Thank you. But do you have any idea how much repairing TWO ships will set us back?..." What an odd Mantis. You prepare to leave.
"No! Hurry up, get us out of here! They're crazy!" You cut transmissions.

destroyed.text: Their ship breaks apart and you salvage the two ships.

deadCrew.text: You find an intact weapon on their now empty ship. You take as much scrap from the ships as possible.

event.name: ALISON_MANTIS_CREW
event.text: You arrive just in time to see an unusually well-armed Engi ship destroying a small pirate craft. A teleporter signal is detected...intruder on deck!

A young Mantis in a charred uniform has teleported onto the deck. He begs for sanctuary from the Engi, and offers to serve in exchange for your protection. The Engi have already traced the teleporter signal and are offering a deal in exchange for the prisoner.

choice.text: Side with the fugitive and fight the Engi ship.
Agree to offer up the Mantis in exchange for a bounty.
(Slug Crew Member) Have your Slug check their true intentions.
(Slug Crew Member) Have your Slug check their true intentions.

event.text: Your Slug advises against trusting this Mantis, and so, you offer them up to the Engi.
Your Slug says that the Mantis can be trusted, and you take them into your crew. They express their gratitude to you and say that they want to help in the fight against their persecutor.
Your Slug says that the Mantis can be trusted, and you take them into your crew. They express their gratitude to you and say that they want to help in the fight against their persecutor.
It was a trap! The Mantis sabotages your ship before teleporting away.
He expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer.
He expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer.
The Engi captain is delighted, and quickly arranges for the transfer of the prisoner.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis. He won't go easily, and causes serious damage before he can be captured.
The pursuing ship responds with a completely unintelligible message. The young Mantis jerks to attention and assumes a battle stance. It was a trap!

event.name: ALISON_DEFECTOR
event.text: A Rebel ship is patrolling this beacon, and immediately turns to engage. As your crew scramble to battle readiness, sensors detect a short-range teleporter signal. An intruder is on board!
A flushed and panicky rebel soldier has teleported aboard. The rebel, who appears unarmed, repeatedly declares his peaceful intentions. It seems the rebel life has lost its charm.

choice.text: Accept his proposal, and prepare to fight the Rebel ship.
Reject his offer. You can never trust these Rebels.
(Slug Crew Member) Let your Slug check his thoughts.
(Slug Crew Member) Let your Slug check his thoughts.
(Orchid Crew Member) Charm the human to keep him on our side for certain.

event.text: The rebel defector is stunned to see the Orchid. He's never seen any aliens other than the Mantis until today. Captivated by the Orchid's beauty, the human takes his post. A second later, the Rebel ship opens fire.
Your Slug says that he is lying, and immediately executes the Rebel with shot in the head. Now to deal with the ship.
Your Slug says that he is lying, and immediately executes the Rebel with shot in the head. Now to deal with the ship.
Your Slug says that he is lying, and immediately executes the Rebel with shot in the head. Now to deal with the ship.
It seems that this Rebel can be trusted. Released and happy, you receive a new crew member ready to work.
It seems that this Rebel can be trusted. Released and happy, you receive a new crew member ready to work.
It seems that this Rebel can be trusted. Released and happy, you receive a new crew member ready to work.
It seems that this Rebel can be trusted. Released and happy, you receive a new crew member ready to work.
It seems that this Rebel can be trusted. Released and happy, you receive a new crew member ready to work.
Your fearless crew easily overcome the intruder, but the Rebel ship still needs to be dealt with.
Attempting to deal with attacks from inside and out is never easy!
He offers to lead you to a secret cache of scrap nearby if you let him join your crew.

choice.text: Reluctantly accept his proposal and fight the Rebel ship.
Reject him outright and execute him on the spot.

event.text: The dishonorable Rebel has deceived you. He damages your engines and steals your flight data before teleporting away. The fleet will be able to track you with ease. If they can't kill you now that is!
Your new crew-member smiles, then reveals a small remote trigger in the palm of his hand. Explosions rocket around the ship as more intruders teleport aboard!
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
The Rebel makes to take his assigned station, then suddenly turns and eviscerates the nearest crew-member. Red Alert!
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The eviscerated crew member's clone launches out of the clone bay, eager to seek revenge.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
The dishonorable Rebel has deceived you. He damages your ship and steals ship information before teleporting away. The fleet will be able to track you with ease. If they can't kill you now, that is!
Your new crew-member smiles, then reveals a small remote trigger in the palm of his hand. Explosions rocket around the ship as more intruders teleport aboard!
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crew member gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
The Rebel makes to take his assigned station, then suddenly turns and eviscerates the nearest crew-member. Red Alert!
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The eviscerated crew member's clone launches out of the clone bay, eager to seek revenge.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
Arriving at the specified coordinates you find a sizable stash of useful materials.
Arriving at the specified coordinates you find a sizable stash of useful materials and a weapon.
You arrive at the location of the hoard, but discover that it was not quite as large as advertised.
Panic sets at the station when you unexpectedly strike a blow. In their haste they are unable to activate all their shield layers, but prepare for defense nevertheless.
Your rush into battle, no doubt that victory is at hand.
You try to approach the station stealthily, but the Rocks noticed you and are already preparing to fight.
You're too late to notice an anticipatory system of fire from the station and don't have time to react to a volley. The station, meanwhile, is preparing to defend themselves.

Your Rock goes to the station in order to convince them to give you a prototype. It is not known what they said, but after some time, they re-establish contact with you and ask where to install the prototype. They did it! Then the screen displays your Rock crew member and they say they want to stay at the station and engage in research with the other scientists. Well, that is their right, at least now you have a good weapon.

removeCrew.text: As a member of your team is still alive and working at the station, you do not break Federation law and do not create a clone to replace them.

event.text: Your Rock manages to convince them that the only way to keep the peace in their own sector is to help you in the fight against the Rebels. The Rocks start to dismantle the prototype to reinstall it onto your ship, and your Rock is called to help them. One of the steel cables responsible for lowering the prototype cannot withstand the load, and bursts letting the heavy cannon fall directly on your Rock crew member, crushing them into pebbles. The Rocks bring their condolences and finish setting up the prototype on your ship.

removeCrew.text: A clone of the deceased crewman appears from the cloning bay, glancing nervously at the Rocks' prototype.

event.text: Rock tells them that God himself brought your ship to their station, and only the power of the Rocks' prototype will be able to stop the Rebels and keep the peace in the Rock sectors. They seem to believe them and proclaim your Rock almost a prophet. They offer them to stay, but your crewman says the Rebels cannot manage to be defeated without their help. Taking the prototype, you leave the the station.
Your Rock crew member is unable to convince them. Furthermore, the station's captain is insulted by your crewman's language, and executes them on the spot. The Rocks are attacking you.

removeCrew.text: A clone of your deceased Rock crewman appears out of the cloning bay...

event.text: Your Rock is unable to convince them to send their prototype. What are your next instructions?
The Rock prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: You decide to quickly depart from here...

event.name: ROCK_PRO_EVENT
event.text: At some distance from the beacon is a Rock research station. It seems that the Rocks are developing a prototype of a new weapon: the huge cannon has just finished assembly and is preparing for trials. You have never seen such a formidable weapon before, and it would be nice to get it.

choice.text: Attack the station before they notice you.
Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: Who knows what they have in mind. You decide to quickly depart, before they begin testing their weapon on your ship.

choice.text: (Rock Crew Member) Send your Rock on negotiations.

event.text: The Rock silently begin charging the weapon — looks like its trial has already begun, with your ship as the chosen target!
The Rock are not eager to sell you their weapon, and you are advised to get out of their sight as soon as possible.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You are not going to give up so easily and get ready to attack. The Rock, meanwhile, are targeting their weapon on your ship.
You decide to follow their advice before they start testing the weapon on your ship.
They have another prototype, and they are willing to give you the working sample for 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Rock silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Rocks agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 60 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Rock silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.
Since this is the only working prototype at the station, they ask 120 scrap for it.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Rock silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Rocks agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Rock silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.

destroyed.text: The station destroyed, you pick up the prototype weapon they were developing.

deadCrew.text: Stripping the station, you pick up the prototype weapon they were developing.

event.text: Panic sets at the station when you unexpectedly strike a blow. In their haste they are unable to activate all their drones, but prepare for defense nevertheless.
You try to approach the station stealthily, but the Engi noticed you and are already preparing to fight.
You're too late to notice an anticipatory system of fire from the station and don't have time to react to a volley. The station, meanwhile, is preparing to defend themselves.

You send your Engi over to the station to persuade them to hand over the prototype weapon to you for your fight against the Rebels. It seems that the Engi also aren't too fond of them, since soon afterwards they contact you and ask where to install the weapon. However, your Engi wishes to stay at the station and engage in research with the other scientists, so you've no choice but to leave them there. You decide that this is a fair price to pay for such a powerful weapon.

removeCrew.text: As a member of your team is still alive and working at the station, you do not break Federation law and do not create a clone to replace them.

event.text: The Engi goes to the station, but is mistakenly sent to the deconstruction department, where old Engi are dismantled into parts. There they and the rest of the mechanical creatures that have become unusable are processed into scrap metal and drone parts. Upon learning of the error, the Engi send you their utmost apologies and send a prototype of their weapon as compensation.

removeCrew.text: The clone of the unlucky Engi comes out of the clonebay, and in the meantime you hurriedly give the order to jump, before the station suspects anything.

event.text: The Engi always come to the aid of their brethren, and after learning that you are fighting the Rebels, they pass on their prototype without too much discussion. Let's hope that this will be enough to reach the Federation headquarters without any problems.
Your Engi crew member is unable to convince them. Furthermore, they find malicious intentions in your Engi, and execute them on the spot. The Engi are attacking you.

removeCrew.text: A clone of your deceased Engi crewman appears out of the cloning bay...

event.text: Your Engi is unable to convince them to send their prototype. What are your next instructions?
The Engi prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: You decide to fly away from here as soon as possible...

event.name: CIRCLE_PRO_EVENT
event.text: In the distance you discover an Engi station on which something's happening. At first you think that some repair work is going on over there, but then you see how the Engi install a large ion beam weapon. Looks like this is some kind of new development — you've never seen anything with the likes of it before. It'd be very useful in the fight against the Rebels.

choice.text: Attack the station before they notice you.
Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: Who knows what they have in mind. You decide to quickly depart, before they begin testing their weapon on your ship.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Send your Engi on negotiations.

event.text: The Engi silently begin charging the weapon — looks like its trial has already begun, with your ship as the chosen target!
The Engi are not eager to sell you their weapon, and you are advised to get out of their sight as soon as possible.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You are not going to give up so easily and get ready to attack. The Engi, meanwhile, are targeting their weapon on your ship.
You decide to follow their advice before they start testing the weapon on your ship.
They have another prototype, and they are willing to give you the working sample for 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Engi silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Engi agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 60 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Engi silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.
Since this is the only working prototype at the station, they ask 120 scrap for it.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Engi silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Engi agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Engi silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.

destroyed.text: After destroying the station and collecting its debris, you pick up the prototype of the weapon that were developing.

deadCrew.text: After cleaning out the station, you pick up the prototype of the weapon they were developing.

event.text: Panic sets at the station when you unexpectedly strike a blow. In their haste they are unable to activate all their drones, but prepare for defense nevertheless.
You try to approach the station stealthily, but the Zoltan noticed you and are already preparing to fight.
You're too late to notice an anticipatory system of fire from the station and don't have time to react to a volley. The station, meanwhile, is preparing to defend themselves.

You send your Zoltan to negotiate with the station's local authorities. After a while they contact you via video: "They realized that the only way to preserve our territories in the Galaxy is to help us in the fight against the Rebels. The prototype of the weapon is already being prepared for loading onto the ship. Unfortunately, I cannot return to you; I need to stay here." You look at them with astonishment, but you understand everything when you notice a pretty Zoltan behind them, listening in on your conversation with interest.

removeCrew.text: As a member of your team is still alive and working at the station, you do not break Federation law and do not create a clone to replace them.

event.text: You decide to send your Zoltan to learn more about what's happening at the station. The station's employees cordially welcome them and conduct a short tour, showing them their achievements in the field of creating new types of weaponry. Soon a Zoltan scientist contacts you and says that during inspection of a new combat drone, a failure occurred in the drone's software, and it shot your crew member, mistakingly taking them for an enemy. The station's scientists feel very guilty and as compensation offer to install the prototype of their weapon. You've no choice but to agree.

removeCrew.text: The clone of the deceased crewman safely exits the clonebay, and you quickly prepare to jump, before the Zoltans realized that they had been fooled.

event.text: The Zoltan goes to negotiate with the station. Having learned that you have information regarding the vulnerability of the Rebel army, the Zoltans agree to help you bring this information to the Federation headquarters. These rascals have committed too many crimes to leave them unpunished. They give you their prototype, and you gratefully accept their help.

Your Zoltan is unable to convince them to give you their prototype. They accidently let slip that you've violated several parts of the Great Zoltan War Code, so then they're executed on the spot. The Zoltans are attacking you.

removeCrew.text: A clone of your deceased Zoltan crewman appears out of the cloning bay...

event.text: Your Zoltan is unable to convince them to send their prototype. What are your next instructions?
The Zoltan prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: You decide to fly away from here as soon as possible...

event.name: ZOLTAN_PRO_EVENT
event.text: Jumping to this beacon, in the distance you spot a Zoltan station. It seems the Zoltans are busy doing something and don't notice you. After a while, the doors of one of the bays open, and you're surprised to see the Zoltans pull out and install a prototype of some unknown weapon. It seems that this is some kind of ion weapon, although you're not really sure. You consider your next move.

choice.text: Attack the station before they notice you.
Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: Who knows what they have in mind. You decide to quickly depart, before they begin testing their weapon on your ship.

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew Member) Send your Zoltan on negotiations.

event.text: The Zoltan silently begin charging the weapon — looks like its trial has already begun, with your ship as the chosen target!
The Zoltan are not eager to sell you their weapon, and you are advised to get out of their sight as soon as possible.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You are not going to give up so easily and get ready to attack. The Zoltan, meanwhile, are targeting their weapon on your ship.
You decide to follow their advice before they start testing the weapon on your ship.
They have another prototype, and they are willing to give you the working sample for 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Zoltan silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Zoltan agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 60 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Zoltan silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.
Since this is the only working prototype at the station, they ask 120 scrap for it.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Zoltan silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Zoltan agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Zoltan silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.

destroyed.text: After destroying the station and collecting its debris, you pick up the prototype of the weapon that were developing.

deadCrew.text: After cleaning out the station, you pick up the prototype of the weapon they were developing.

event.text: Panic sets at the station when you unexpectedly strike a blow. In their haste they are unable to activate their cloaking system, but prepare for defense nevertheless.
You try to approach the station stealthily, but the Slugs noticed you and are already preparing to fight.
You're too late to notice an anticipatory system of fire from the station and don't have time to react to a volley. The station, meanwhile, is preparing to defend themselves.

The Slug is called on to go to the station to negotiate the purchase of their weapon. Negotiations last quite a long time, but seem to end successfully. Their engineers load a prototype of their weapon into your cargo bay, and your Slug transmits a message that you'll now have to pay them 500 scrap! Well this is too much, and you decide to fly away before they take all your scrap. Unfortunately, this also means leaving your Slug to the mercy of fate, but that's a price you'll have to pay considering what the station might do.

removeCrew.text: Since your Slug is still alive and at the station, you cannot clone them.

event.text: The Slug is called on to go to the station to negotiate the puchase of their weapon. Well, more precisely, so you thought. In fact, they just got a local teleportation device from somewhere and threw the prototype into your hold, along with the piece of platform the weapon was attached to. Unfortunately, they themselves did not get the chance to return — the Slugs noticed the theft and used bio-beams to burn a dozen holes into the thief's body. It's time to make like a chicken and get out of here.

removeCrew.text: The Slug's clone comes out of the clonebay with a grin and goes to their station.

event.text: The Slug is called on to go to the station to negotiate the puchase of their weapon. Well, more precisely, so you thought. In fact, they just got a local teleportation device from somewhere and threw the prototype into your hold, along with the piece of platform the weapon was attached to. While the Slugs were busy realizing what happened, your Slug was already gone. You charge the drive and, as soon as your Slug's on board, make a jump.
Your Slug is unable to convince them to send their prototype. They are convicted of attempted deception and are executed on the spot. The Slugs are attacking you.

removeCrew.text: A clone of your deceased Slug crewman appears out of the cloning bay...

event.text: Your Slug is unable to convince them to send their prototype. What are your next instructions?
The Slugs prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: You decide to fly away from here as soon as possible...

event.name: NEBULA_JELLY_PRO_EVENT
event.text: You notice a Slug station in orbit of a moon near the beacon. You try not to attract their attention, as it seems that they're not in the mood for outside observers. Looks like you've arrived right when they're busy installing some unknown weapon. You've never seen anything like it before, and you reckon it must be powerful. You are considering how to get it.

choice.text: Attack the station before they notice you.
Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: Who knows what they have in mind. You decide to quickly depart, before they begin testing their weapon on your ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Send your Slug on negotiations.

event.text: The Slugs silently begin charging the weapon — looks like its trial has already begun, with your ship as the chosen target!
The Slugs are not eager to sell you their weapon, and you are advised to get out of their sight as soon as possible.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You are not going to give up so easily and get ready to attack. The Slugs, meanwhile, are targeting their weapon on your ship.
You decide to follow their advice before they start testing the weapon on your ship.
They have another prototype, and they are willing to give you the working sample for 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Slugs silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Slugs sneer at your attempts to manipulate their consciousness and go on the attack.
Since this is the only working prototype at the station, they ask 120 scrap for it.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Slugs silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Slugs sneer at your attempts to manipulate their consciousness and go on the attack.

destroyed.text: After destroying the station and collecting its debris, you pick up the prototype of the weapon that were developing.

deadCrew.text: After cleaning out the station, you pick up the prototype of the weapon they were developing.

event.text: Panic sets at the station when you unexpectedly strike a blow. In their haste they are unable to activate their medbay, but prepare for defense nevertheless.
Your rush into battle, no doubt that victory is at hand.
You're unable to get to them stealthily; the Mantis noticed you and are already preparing to fight.
You're too late to notice an anticipatory system of fire from the station and don't have time to react to a volley. The station, meanwhile, is preparing to defend themselves.

The Mantis goes to members of their own kind at the station. The station agrees to give up the gun if they defeat the local champion KhetssNaaga in claw-to-claw fighting. Your Mantis wins with ease, and for good reason, having won so many battles, helping you to fulfill your mission. The Mantis prototype is delivered to you, but the new champion must stay with them until someone defeats them in the next battle. These are the laws of these creatures, and you don't risk breaking them.

removeCrew.text: Since your Mantis is still alive and at the station, you cannot clone them.

event.text: The Mantis goes to the station to get you the unknown weapon. Once there, they say that they were sent by KazaaakplethKilik, who learned about the new weaponry and wishes to install it on his ship. It seems that they believed them and were afraid of the possible anger of the legendary Mantis thief. The transport drone unloads the prototype into your hold, and meanwhile your Mantis settles the last formalitites when suddenly they suspect something's amiss. They ask for video communications with Kazaaak, for which you have no response. The execution of your Mantis was fast and fierce. It's time to fly away from here as soon as possible.

removeCrew.text: The clonebay opens, and out of it comes a clone of the dead Mantis. Without even the slightest emotion, they go to their station.

event.text: The Mantis is summoned to go to the station to get you the unknown weapon. Once there, they say that they were sent by KazaaakplethKilik, who learned about the new weaponry and wishes to install it on his ship. It seems that they believed them and were afraid of the possible anger of the legendary Mantis thief. Be that as it may, the prototype of the Mantis weapon is delivered onto your ship, and you warm up the engines before the Mantis have the chance to uncover the deception.
Your Mantis cannot persuade them to give you the prototype. The audacity of your crew member leads to them being executed on the spot. The Mantis are attacking you.

removeCrew.text: A clone of your deceased Mantis crewman appears out of the cloning bay...

event.text: Your Mantis is unable to convince them to send their prototype. What are your next instructions?
The Mantis prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: You decide to fly away from here as soon as possible...

event.name: MANTIS_PRO_EVENT
event.text: Looking around the beacon, you notice a Mantis station in the distance. Trying to leave a small FTL trail, you slowly and quietly sneak closer. The Mantis at the station seem excited, rather interested in something. Applying maximum power to sensors, you see the following picture: a group of Mantis are dragging some kind of weapon, burst-like in appearance, and they are beginning to install it. You've never seen such weaponry before, but could the Mantis even create such new weaponry? Or is it a trophy from somewhere? Thinking about this, you decide what you'll do next.

choice.text: Attack the station before they notice you.
Try to negotiate to buy their weapon.

event.text: You don't risk contacting the Mantis and decide to quickly depart, before they begin testing their weapon on your ship.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew Member) Send your Mantis on negotiations.

event.text: The Mantis silently begin charging the weapon — looks like its trial has already begun, with your ship as the chosen target!
The Mantis are not eager to sell you their weapon, and you are advised to get out of their sight as soon as possible.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You are not going to give up so easily and get ready to attack. The Mantis, meanwhile, are targeting their weapon on your ship.
You decide to follow their advice before they start testing the weapon on your ship.
They have another prototype, and they are willing to give you the working sample for 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Mantis silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Mantis agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 50 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Mantis silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.
Since this is the only working prototype at the station, they ask 120 scrap for it.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Mantis silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Mantis agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the prototype on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the prototype for free. The Mantis silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.

destroyed.text: After destroying the station and collecting its debris, you pick up the prototype of the weapon that were developing.

deadCrew.text: After cleaning out the station, you pick up the prototype of the weapon they were developing.

event.name: CRYST_LOB
event.text: You reach the beacon. Looks like there is nothing at all except emptiness. Staring into the depths of the blackness, you notice some object nearby. Scanners indicate it's an unusual ship. Its engines and weapon systems are disconnected. Nevertheless, you pick up biological activity aboard the vessel.

The captain of the ship appears on the screen. They are a representative of the ancient Crystal race. With an irritated voice, the captain speaks first: "Say what you want, and quickly at that. We're a little busy here..."

choice.text: Greet them and ask what they're doing in this sector.
Apologize and say that you are mistaken.

event.text: You quickly warm up the engines and prepare to jump before the Crystals manage to detain you.
Once you aim your weapons at the strange ship, it turns on its FTL Drive and charges its weapons.
The ship gives you vague fears, and you decide not to tempt fate. The engines warm up and you prepare to jump.
"It's none of your business. Turn around and fly away while you have the chance."

choice.text: Is that so? Prepare to fight!

event.text: "Well, you asked for it." The Crystalline beings point their weapons at your ship.

choice.text: Apologize for troubling them and turn on the FTL Drive.
(Crystal Crew Member) Let your Crystal negotiate.

event.text: Seeing their kinsman, the Crystals ask to be left alone. After the end of the negotiations, your Crystal tells you that they're being taken to see the execution of a local criminal, but they'll give them to you for the right amount of scrap.
You transfer the required scrap, and they give you a Crystal with huge hands.

choice.text: Don't do it, just leave from here.

event.text: Crystals don't take no for an answer and are getting ready to attack.
"We are carrying out an ancient ritual before the execution of the famous criminal Diamond Brow. If you do not wish to follow them into oblivion, turn around and fly away."

choice.text: Ask why they condemned Diamond Brow.

event.text: "Well, if you, Captain, like to poke your nose into other people's business, why don't we tell you this little story. Diamond Brow got wind of the not quite, eh... honest deeds of our esteemed ruler and defender of the 7 systems of the Crystalline Nano Lattice. You know how it happens, in the universe, not everything is just. When they were arrested, they had the nerve to resist! Straight up split the skulls of five guardsmen. We had to fly to another system, away from our native lands and prying eyes, to finish this business nice and clean... and then you appear with your questions. In general, we've been delayed. By the way, we'll have to execute you for your long nose. Charge the weapons!"

choice.text: Follow their advice and fly away.

event.text: You say, "No, thank you. We're too early to meet oblivion. Have a pleasant execution, gentlemen, we're leaving." — and then you hastily jump to the next beacon.

Right when you're almost done charging the engines, a voice is heard from the intercom. Turning on the screen, you see another Crystal with huge hands, and behind them on the floor is the decapitated captain of the ship. "They want to execute me! And it is unfair! If you help me, I will serve on your ship faithfully and truthfully."

choice.text: Help them and attack the Crystal ship.

event.text: Without a captain, the Crystals shouldn't be too difficult to deal with, and so you aim your weapons at them.

choice.text: Let them understand it's none of your business.

event.text: Who knows what's on the mind of this killer. You quickly make a jump away from this beacon.
Without any complications, you jump to the next beacon, still surprised at the unexpected meeting.

escape.text: Looks like they don't want to fight and are trying to escape.

destroyed.text: After the battle, you collect all the useful things left of the Crystal ship. Among the debris you notice a broken escape pod. Inside — a dead Crystal with huge hands.

choice.text: (Improved Clonebay) Quickly rush the body into the clonebay.

event.text: Your improved clonebay properly does its job, and the cloned Crystal joins your crew.

choice.text: There's nothing you can do for them.

event.text: You leave this place with strange mixed feelings.

deadCrew.text: After killing the crew, you collect all the scrap from the ship. In the control room, your attention is drawn to a dead Crystal with huge hands.

choice.text: (Improved Clonebay) Quickly rush the body into the clonebay.

event.text: Your improved clonebay properly does its job, and the cloned Crystal joins your crew.

choice.text: There's nothing you can do for them.

event.text: You leave this place with strange mixed feelings.

event.name: MARADERS1_EVENT
event.text: You encounter a heavily damaged Federation cruiser, drifting dismally in space. Behind it flies a small freighter with a couple of weapons. Upon closer inspection, you see that the crew of the cargo ship is taking valuables from the cruiser and is loading them aboard their own ship.

choice.text: Hail them to try and establish communications.

event.text: The cargo ship immediately answers your hail: "Greetings, Captain. As you can see, here we decided to make some profit. The dead crew no longer need these goods. By the way, we're not going to share, and as soon as we're finished, we're going to go for your holds." Then they shut off communications.

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Let your Slug crew member use their hypnotic ability to convince the marauders and to give you some of their loot.

event.text: Your Slug crew member closes their eyes and places their hands on their temples, staying motionless in concentration. Shortly thereafter, the captain of the marauders hails you again to report that they have unloaded some of the valuables onto your ship. You quickly fly away before they come to their senses.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Use mind control to convince the marauders to give you some of their loot.

event.text: The captain of the marauders hails you again to report that they have unloaded some of the valuables onto your ship. You quickly fly away before they come to their senses.
You start warming up your weapons.
You start to warm up your weapons. The marauders immediately raise their shields in response and you move in to intercept.

choice.text: Wait for the FTL Drive to charge and hope that no one will notice.

event.text: While you were charging the drive, the marauders finished their work and left, never noticing you. The ship they robbed doesn't look very stable at all: it looks like it will soon completely fall apart. Is it really worth searching?

choice.text: Don't be like the marauders and leave this place.

event.text: You get ready to jump.

choice.text: Send the crew to the dilapidated cruiser.
(Improved Sensors) Check the stability of the damaged cruiser's reactor.

event.text: You charge up your engines and get ready to jump.

While your crew in searching the damaged Federation cruiser, in one of the compartments suddenly there is an explosion. Unfortunately, it did not happen without a casualty. You quickly withdraw your crew before the cruiser's hold collapses completely.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: You take a hopeful trip to the Clone Bay, and to your relief a clone is already prepared for the lost crew member.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser. You get ready to jump.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser, but in a far corner of the hold, you notice a damaged weapon. Perhaps you'll find someone who can fix it.
You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it.

You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it. However, in a compartment in the furthest depths of the cruiser hides a surviving member of the crew. They gladly join your crew.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.

event.name: MARADERS1_EVENT_CRUISER_DANGER_CREW_DEATH
event.text: While your crew in searching the damaged Federation cruiser, in one of the compartments suddenly there is an explosion. Unfortunately, it did not happen without a casualty. You quickly withdraw your crew before the cruiser's hold collapses completely.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: You take a hopeful trip to the Clone Bay, and to your relief a clone is already prepared for the lost crew member.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser. You get ready to jump.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser, but in a far corner of the hold, you notice a damaged weapon. Perhaps you'll find someone who can fix it.
You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it.

You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it. However, in a compartment in the furthest depths of the cruiser hides a surviving member of the crew. They gladly join your crew.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser. You get ready to jump.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser, but in a far corner of the hold, you notice a damaged weapon. Perhaps you'll find someone who can fix it.
You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it.

You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it. However, in a compartment in the furthest depths of the cruiser hides a surviving member of the crew. They gladly join your crew.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.
The cruiser's reactor is disabled and does not pose any danger. You send your crew to explore the ship.
The cruiser's reactor is in serious condition. You cannot determine how long the ship will last before it explodes.

choice.text: Send the crew to the cruiser.
Leave as it's not worth the risk.

event.text: The cruiser's reactor is in critical condition. Surely this ship will explode soon, but there is a chance to make some profit.

choice.text: Quickly send the crew to the cruiser.
Leave as it's not worth the risk.

event.text: The cruiser's reactor is disabled and does not pose any danger. You send your crew to explore the ship.
The cruiser's reactor is in serious condition. You cannot determine how long the ship will last before it explodes.

choice.text: Send the crew to the cruiser.
Leave as it's not worth the risk.

event.text: The cruiser's reactor is in critical condition. Surely this ship will explode soon, but there is a chance to make some profit.

choice.text: Quickly send the crew to the cruiser.
Leave as it's not worth the risk.

event.text: Well, you don't have the time to send anyone because the cruiser's reactor suddenly explodes! A chunk of debris from the collapsed cruiser crashes right into your ship.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser. You get ready to jump.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser, but in a far corner of the hold, you notice a damaged weapon. Perhaps you'll find someone who can fix it.
You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it.

You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it. However, in a compartment in the furthest depths of the cruiser hides a surviving member of the crew. They gladly join your crew.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.

event.name: MARADERS777_EVENT_CRUISER_DANGER_CRASH
event.text: It's good that you did not have time to send anybody, because the cruiser's reactor suddenly explodes! A pile of debris from the collapsed ship crashes into your ship.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser. You get ready to jump.
It seems that the marauders already carried away everything of value from the cruiser, but in a far corner of the hold, you notice a damaged weapon. Perhaps you'll find someone who can fix it.
You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it.

You don't find that much here after the marauders have gone through it. However, in a compartment in the furthest depths of the cruiser hides a surviving member of the crew. They gladly join your crew.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.
The marauders carried away almost everything off the cruiser. However, you still manage to find some rubbish in the cruiser.

escape.text: It seems they don't want to fight and are trying to escape.

gotaway.text: The marauders are gone, so you can explore the deserted cruiser.

choice.text: Don't be like the marauders and leave this place.

event.text: You get ready to jump.

choice.text: Send a crew to the dilapidated cruiser.
(Improved Sensors) Check the stability of the damaged cruiser's reactor.

destroyed.text: The marauders' ship breaks apart. While you collect all the useful things that remained after the battle, the corpse of one of the marauders hits the observation windows of your ship. You can also explore the cruiser. All the same, you'll need to send someone out into space to erase the remains from the glass.

choice.text: Don't be like the marauders and leave this place.

event.text: You get ready to jump.

choice.text: Send a crew to the dilapidated cruiser.
(Improved Sensors) Check the stability of the damaged cruiser's reactor.

deadCrew.text: You collect everything of value from the marauder ship. It is also possible to investigate the decaying cruiser.

choice.text: Don't be like the marauders and leave this place.

event.text: You get ready to jump.

choice.text: Send a crew to the dilapidated cruiser.
(Improved Sensors) Check the stability of the damaged cruiser's reactor.

event.name: BLACK_ZOLTAN_1
event.text: This beacon was built to be located near the space station. No one welcomes your ship. You cannot see any movement around the station.

choice.text: Fly up close and try to contact the station.
Fire a vollley at the station from all your weapons.

event.text: You discharge your weapons on the station. The shots hardly damage it, but you notice some movement. At the center of the station a hangar door opens, and out flies a huge humanoid ship. A space-bot slowly turns towards you and charges its own weapons.
The station looks suspicious, certainly it's a trap. You get ready to jump.

You fly up to the station and switch between the comms channels, trying to hear a response. However, the transmission remains silent. Suddenly, the station opens a hangar door and out flies a huge humanoid drone ship.

You fly up to the station and switch between the comms channels, trying to hear a response. However, the transmission remains silent. Scanners show that within it there is an enormous object. Apparently, it's a spaceship.

choice.text: Perform a more accurate scan of the spacecraft from inside the station.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Perform a more accurate scan of the spacecraft inside the station with your improved scanners.

event.text: You scan the station and the object inside it with your long-ranged scanners. It is a huge spaceship of humanoid form. You hack into the database of the ship and learn that it was manufactured at a secret research station. This ship is the result of joint work between Zoltan and Engi scientists. Unfortunately, the location of the scientific base is hidden, but the last coordinates of the ship that visited the station along with robot are given. You copy them to your star map.

choice.text: Don't risk it and leave the station.

event.text: The station looks suspicious, certainly it's a trap. You get ready to jump.

You carefully scan station and the object within it. It was a huge spaceship humanoid form. Unfortunately, your scanning has somehow angered this colossus. The space-bot surprisingly quickly flies out of the station hangar and directs its weapons at you.

You scan the station and the object inside it. It is a huge spaceship of humanoid form. You hack into the database of the ship and learn that it was manufactured at a secret research station. This ship is the result of joint work between Zoltan and Engi scientists. Unfortunately, the location of the scientific base is hidden, but the last coordinates of the ship that visited the station along with robot are given. You copy them to your star map.

destroyed.text: The space-bot explodes and shatters into small pieces, showering them onto your ship. Oddly enough, its head remains almost completely intact.

choice.text: Send the crew to explore the head.

event.text: You send the crew for exploration. What do you want your team to search for?

choice.text: Collect as much scrap as possible.

event.text: Your crew goes to the head of the spaceport in search of scrap. There's a good bulk of it, and they carry out as much as possible. Seems it was a good idea to stick around.

choice.text: Look for any information about this ship.

event.text: You send the crew to study the head of the cosmic giant. After some time, the team returns with the space-bot's memory database. It turns out that the ship was made at a secret research station, the result of joint work between Zoltan and Engi scientists. Unfortunately, the location of the scientific base is hidden, but the last coordinates of the ship that visited the station along with robot are given. You copy them to your star map.
You are ready to jump, not wanting to take more risks. Who knows what other surprises this thing can give.

event.name: BLACK_ZOLTAN_2
event.text: You arrive at the specified coordinates of the ship, which visited the station along with the space-bot. This ship is a strange-looking Rebel drone. Apparently, its purpose is for repair and the transportation of spare parts. Scanners indicate the presence of an oxygen on it and biological activity aboard. The drone itself hangs motionless in space.

choice.text: Attack the drone before it notices you.

event.text: You fire a volley at the drone, partially damaging its systems. The drone activates and targets your ship.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi hack into the ship's control systems.

event.text: The Engi uses the database stolen from the space-bot to figure out the access codes to the drone. After some time, they succeed: now the drone's under your control.

The drone starts counting down to self-destruction, and after a few minutes an explosion is heard. You're in the process of collecting the little scrap that remains from the drone, when you notice the body of a dead Zoltan among the debris: looks like they were a prisoner aboard this drone. It seems to you that you made an irreparable mistake, but there's nothing to be done.
While the engine charges, you silently look into the black darkness of the cosmos, reflecting on what the unfortunate Zoltan was doing aboard the unmanned Rebel ship.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Quickly rush them into the clonebay.

event.text: You quickly collect the body of the Zoltan and place it in the clonebay. Unfortunately, they stayed in the next world for too long, and their clone turns up with a complete lack of memory. Well, at least they can take a spot managing systems.

choice.text: (Improved Clonebay) Quickly rush them into the clonebay.

event.text: You quickly collect the body of the Zoltan and place it in your improved clonebay. It works just as expected, and soon a clone of the deceased appears before you. They don't even seem to comprehend that they had just died.

choice.text: Try to establish surveillance over the room in which biological activity was detected.

event.text: A Zoltan figure appears on the screen. Undoubtedly, they are a prisoner locked in a small cargo bay of the ship. The Zoltan appears quite healthy and slowly paces around the room, unaware that they are being watched.

destroyed.text: After the explosion, you start collecting the little scrap that remains from the drone, when you notice the body of a dead Zoltan among the debris: looks like they were a prisoner aboard this drone. It seems to you that you made an irreparable mistake, but there's nothing to be done.

event.text: While the engine charges, you silently look into the black darkness of the cosmos, reflecting on what the unfortunate Zoltan was doing aboard the unmanned Rebel ship.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Quickly rush them into the clonebay.

event.text: You quickly collect the body of the Zoltan and place it in the clonebay. Unfortunately, they stayed in the next world for too long, and their clone turns up with a complete lack of memory. Well, at least they can take a spot managing systems.

choice.text: (Improved Clonebay) Quickly rush them into the clonebay.

event.text: You quickly collect the body of the Zoltan and place it in your improved clonebay. It works just as expected, and soon a clone of the deceased appears before you. They don't even seem to comprehend that they had just died.
You silently look at each other.

You introduce yourself and greet the captive. the Zoltan isn't very surprised by your appearance and politely greets you in response: "Greetings, Captain. My name is Morgan. As you managed to notice, I was locked in the cargo hold. To my happiness, the drone ran out of fuel. The drone was headed to the research station on which I work."

choice.text: Ask them about the space-bot and the station on which it was designed.

event.text: Morgan says that he sneaked onto one of the ships bound for the space station, hoping to destroy the central processor of the huge robot. According to him, the robot possessed an advanced artificial intelligence and a self-reproduction module. The existence of such a system could endanger the existence of all living things, so Morgan decided to disable the space-bot. The Zoltan only managed to destroy the self-reproduction module before they were discovered. The space-bot locked them in one of the cargo bays of one of the repair units and sent the Zoltan back to the research station to be interrogated, and then most likely killed or sent to lifelong exile in uranium mines. Morgan suggests that you take them on board as an engineer.

choice.text: Agree, provided that they will inform you of the coordinates of the research station and go to it with you.

event.text: Morgan gladly accepts your terms.

event.name: BLACK_ZOLTAN_3
event.text: The jump takes you to a beacon located at a safe distance from a newly formed black hole. The view is amazing, and your entire crew doesn't look away from the portholes, enjoying the spectacle. Scanners discover the station, which was mentioned in the archives of the huge space-bot. Morgan confirms that it was here that they worked.

You're greeted by the manager of the research station 'Nemesis'. "My name is Professor Lebedinsky. If you would, tell me who you are, and explain just what you are doing here. This is private property, so don't play any games with me."

choice.text: Introduce yourself and say that you're flying on a very important mission, and are just passing through.

event.text: "Well then, fly on and don't bother our exploration of this remarkable black hole." The manager shuts off the screen, indicating that he no longer intends to talk to you about anything. You start charging up the engines.

choice.text: Greet the manager and ask him about the space-bot.

event.text: "Really now, you know more than you should, captain. Yes, indeed we developed a super-ship, but the financing of this project was discontinued, and all developments were frozen. When the Rebels learned of this, they certainly wanted to get a space-bot to fight the Federation. This ship has a special advanced artificial intelligence, gravitational engines, the principle of which... But, you still don't understand..."

choice.text: Agree. You're in fact not really strong in the principles of operating engines.

event.text: "So, the Rebels promised us funding, protection from pirates, regular supplies of food and necessary equipment. In return, we had to finish work on the ship for them. Of course, we agreed. After all, now we were able to complete the project, which we have been working on for many years. Unfortunately, or fortunately, we didn't manage to put the unique Zoltan shield technology on it, since the Rebels hastened us very much and set strict deadlines for completing all the work."

At this point, the manager notices Morgan behind you. "Well, well, well, now who do we have there? Hello, Morgan. Are you still set on destroying our wonderful project? And what did you tell the captain?"
"Professor. You have not said anything about the self-reproduction module. Don't you think that it is quite a dangerous machine, especially in the hands of the Rebels?"
"No, I don't think so, Captain! You just don't understand! It's a masterpiece! A scientific miracle! And moreover, who are you to judge how the machine will behave?"

choice.text: "Why not for me to judge? In the end, my mission is to deliver important information to the Federation's base, on which the outcome of the war with the Rebels depends and the future of all the peoples of the Galaxy."

event.text: "You are too arrogant and stupid, Captain! And you also have a fugitive on board. We will destroy them along with your ship. Open fire!"

choice.text: "Maybe not for me to judge. But you seem to forget about the three laws of robotics! And this is the first thing to remember when creating a robot!"

event.text: "You are right, Captain. My grandfather, Phil Farnsworth, always said that scientists are separated from insanity only by the primary laws. If you did not destroy the robot, then I will do so myself! Fortunately, I'm not so mad as to forget about the mandatory installation of a self-destruct module. Thank you for unveiling my eyes, allow me, in gratitude, to install a Zoltan shield on your ship."

choice.text: Thank the professor and start docking with the station.

event.text: While the Zoltan shield is being installed, you and the crew skip a glass at a local bar, admiring the incredible spectacle of a black hole slowly devouring several bright stars. Soon you return to the ship and prepare to continue the journey.
"You're just an insane old fool, Lebedinsky! This machine shouldn't exist! Otherwise, we all will pay for such a 'wonderful project'!"
"You're just an incredible fool, Morgan, and not worthy of the title of scientist. Besides, you are now a runaway criminal, so I will destroy both you and your new friends! Open fire!"
As soon as you start charging your weapons, the station immediately raises its shields and fires up its weapons systems.

destroyed.text: The station 'Nemesis' breaks apart into pieces. While the FTL Drive charges, you wonder if it all could have ended peacefully. In the background, a black hole continues to slowly devour several bright stars.

deadCrew.text: The crew of the station 'Nemesis' is dead. While the FTL Drive charges, you wonder if it all could have ended peacefully. In the background, a black hole continues to slowly devour several bright stars.

event.name: LOTEREYA
event.text: After jumping to the beacon, you find a Mantis ship nearby. You have already prepared for battle but you notice that the ship does not have any weapons installed. Meanwhile, an old Mantis contacts you — the owner of the ship. He trades commerce on this beacon and invites you to look at his products. Even more, he asks you to buy the "charity" lottery for just 15 scrap.

choice.text: Buy the lottery and see the goods.

event.text: The old man hands you a ticket. "Just erase the protective field and get a reward. The odds of winning — 1 in 2!"
"As you wish". The old man shows you his shop.
[}] [}] [15] You win 15 missiles! You collect the reward and go to the store.
[}] [}] [20] You win 20 missiles! You collect the reward and go to the store.
[}] [}] [25] You win 25 missiles! You collect the reward and go to the store.
[}] [{] [xx] You lose! "Damn swindler!" You swear as you go to look at the goods.
[}] [|] [xx] You lose! "Damn swindler!" You swear as you go to look at the goods.
[{] [}] [xx] You lose! "Damn swindler!" You swear as you go to look at the goods.
[{] [{] [9] You win 9 fuel! You collect the reward and go to the store.
[{] [{] [12] You win 12 fuel! You collect the reward and go to the store.
[{] [{] [15] You win 15 fuel! You collect the reward and go to the store.
[{] [|] [xx] You lose! "Damn swindler!" You swear as you go to look at the goods.
[|] [}] [xx] You lose! "Damn swindler!" You swear as you go to look at the goods.
[|] [{] [xx] You lose! "Damn swindler!" You swear as you go to look at the goods.
[|] [|] [10] You win 10 drone parts! You collect the reward and go to the store.
[|] [|] [15] You win 15 drone parts! You collect the reward and go to the store.
[|] [|] [20] You win 20 drone parts! You collect the reward and go to the store.

event.name: ROCK_PIRAT_QUEST
event.text: You meet a rock pirate ship. Unexpectedly, a message comes from them: "Help. I am being held hostage on this ship!" You don't have time to ponder the message, as the pirates notice you and go on the offensive. You should leave their ship whole if you want to help the hostage, whoever they are.

destroyed.text: The pirates' ship explodes, all of its passengers are dying. Collecting debris, you think about the unenviable fate of their hostage.

deadCrew.text: All the pirates are dead, so you rummage through the compartments for a hostage. Finally, you find a locked room in which there is a hostage who sent you a message. The Rock goes by the name 'Steve'. According to him, he wanted to stop piracy, but his former comrades did not allow him to leave just like that. They locked Steve in this room and headed for their hidden base to hand over the traitor to their leader. The former pirate asks to join your crew.

choice.text: Take him on the condition that he shows the way to the pirate base.

event.text: He agrees and tells you the coordinates of their base. He also warns that the base is hidden in a large piece of the asteroid, so that weapons cannot reach it.

event.name: ROCK_PIRAT_BASE_QUEST
event.text: You find the pirate base in the asteroid belt near this beacon. As expected, it is hidden in a huge asteroid, and your weapons are useless here. However, no one is attacking you, so you can just wait for the FTL Drive to charge and fly away.

destroyed.text: The pirate base breaks apart, and you collect a little scrap left from it.

deadCrew.text: All the pirates are killed, so you can calmly look around the base. In addition to scrap, your attention is drawn to the base's plating, which absorbs asteroid impacts. You remove and install this protective system onto your ship.

event.name: PLANETA_ENGI
event.text: The distress signal is coming from an Engi rescue ship. They were attacked by pirates, and now they themselves need help. Some pirates have boarded the Engi ship, others are on their nearby cruiser.
You attack the pirate ship. Let's hope that the Engi can fight off the pirates on their ship.

choice.text: Help the Engi crew fight off the boarders.

event.text: The pirate ship nearby doesn't allow you to dock with the Engi ship, and the other pirates take control of the rescue craft. In addition, it starts firing at you from afar! It seems that you did not make the best choice.
You decide not to interfere in the affairs of others. You have your own goal, which should not be rejected.

destroyed.text: The pirate ship is destroyed, and you quickly gather useful supplies from it. Unfortunately, while you were fighting, the pirates captured the Engi rescue craft and jumped to another beacon. You can try to catch up with them.

event.text: You head towards the alleged location of the pirates.
You decide that you should not be distracted from your main goal. The Rebels are getting ever closer, you need to hurry.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Scan the surrounding beacons to find out the exact location of escaped invaders.

event.text: Your long-ranged scanners detect a distinct trace of the FTL Drive. Now you know exactly where to look for the pirates.

deadCrew.text: The pirate crew is dead, and you quickly collect useful supplies from their ship. The Engi craft is still in the vicinity, but nobody answers your hails.

event.text: You give the order to dock the ships. There is a chance to find survivors.
You decide not to risk it, and prepare to jump to the next beacon. In the end, your mission is different.

destroyed.text: The Engi ship explodes with all who were on board. The other pirates attacking you get away, not wanting to wait around for you to get the better of them. Heaps of debris fly everywhere.

choice.text: Gather scrap and fly away from here.

event.text: You collect the remains of the ship and prepare to jump. Perhaps this could've been better if it went another way...

choice.text: (Improved Clonebay) Try to find the Engi remains and create a clone from them.

event.text: You look around the battlefield, trying to find the bodies of the dead Engi, and collect scrap at the same time.

deadCrew.text: The pirates that captured the rescue craft are dead, and their companions, having seen such an outcome choose to quickly disappear. You inspect the Engi craft.

event.text: You don't find a single body. It looks like the explosion scattered everything into tiny parts. There's nothing more to do here, so you fly away.

You notice a corpse of an Engi floating about in space and quickly drag it into the clonebay. Fortunately, you make it in time, and the clone of the dead Engi soon appears before you. They say that they were sent to the aid of their brethren who got lost in a snowstorm on a planet they were conducting research on, but pirates interrupted their rescue operation by attacking their ship. The Engi joins your crew and reports the coordinates of the planet to which they were sent. You promise to help them if possible.
The ship's empty, except for the corpses of the pirates and the hapless Engi crew, which are seen all throughout.

choice.text: Return to your ship and fly away.

event.text: You collect some supplies from the rescue craft: they'll no longer be of any use to them. You then prepare to jump away.

choice.text: (Improved Clonebay) Try to clone of the Engi crew.

event.text: You drag a corpse of an Engi into the clonebay. After a while, their clone comes out to you safe and sound. They say that they were sent to the aid of their brethren who got lost in a snowstorm on a planet they were conducting research on, but pirates interrupted their rescue operation by attacking their ship. The Engi joins your crew and reports the coordinates of the planet to which they were sent. You promise to help them if possible.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi have a look at the rescue ship's logbook.

event.text: Judging by the entries in the log, the ship was flying towards a distress signal from a planet where some Engi were conducting their research. The group of Engi got lost in a blizzard, and a rescue ship almost reached the target when they were attacked by pirates. You record the coordinates of the planet and leave the ship after collecting some supplies from it.

You find a single Engi survivor. They say that they were sent to the aid of their brethren who got lost in a snowstorm on a planet they were conducting research on, but pirates interrupted their rescue operation by attacking their ship. The Engi joins your crew and reports the coordinates of the planet to which they were sent. You promise to help them if possible.
The beacon's empty. Evidently the pirates chose a different direction. You've no choice but to continue your mission.
Just as you thought, the pirates flew in this direction. Their ship notices you and turns in your direction, so you start charging your weapons, and the pirates do the same.
The captured ship's traces lead you to this beacon. The ship itself is nearby and is already turning around towards you, preparing to fight.

destroyed.text: The Engi rescue craft breaks apart. You avenged the death of the Engi. After collecting the ship's wreckage, you prepare to jump.

deadCrew.text: The pirates are dead, so you inspect the ship. There are no corpses of the Engi, apparently, the pirates managed to throw them into space.

choice.text: Return to your ship and fly away.

event.text: You collect some supplies from the rescue ship, for the ship will no longer need them. You prepare to make a jump to the next beacon.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi have a look at the rescue ship's logbook.

event.text: Judging by the entries in the log, the ship was flying towards a distress signal from a planet where some Engi were conducting their research. The group of Engi got lost in a blizzard, and a rescue ship almost reached the target when they were attacked by pirates. You record the coordinates of the planet and leave the ship after collecting some supplies from it.

event.name: PLANET_ENGE_QUEST
event.text: You arrive at the orbit of the planet as specified per the Engi rescue ship's logbook. Almost all of it is covered by water — only a small island can be seen near the equator, and the mainland at the north pole is covered with snow.

choice.text: Explore the mainland to the north.

event.text: Most likely the distress signal was sent from the north of the continent, so the search should start from there.

choice.text: Land on the island near the equator.

event.text: The island seems more attractive for research, so you direct your ship to it.
You land on the mainland. All around a terrible blizzard is raging; the visibility is not more than a couple of meters.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Use the scanners to search for the missing group.

event.text: You activate the scanners, which quickly reveal signs of life a couple of kilometers away from you. Wasting no time, you send a team in search, and after a while they bring on board one Engi. This is the sole survivor from their camp. They put out the distress signal when their camp got covered by a blizzard. In gratitude for saving them they join your crew. You go back into orbit. You can also explore the island at the equator, but by then the Rebels will have certainly caught up.
You decide what is worth exploring and the island. The Rebels, meanwhile, significantly reduce the distance between you and them.

choice.text: Don't waste your time and fly away from this planet.

event.text: You can not afford to spend precious time for every planet you encounter. The Rebels are getting closer, and you have an important mission.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) Use the scanner to search for the missing group..

event.text: You activate the scanner, which quickly reveals signs of life a couple of kilometers away from you. Wasting no time, you send a team in search, and after a while they bring on board one Engi. This is the sole survivor from their camp. They put out the distress signal when their camp got covered by a blizzard. In gratitude for saving them they join your crew. You go back into orbit. You can also explore the island at the equator, but by then the Rebels will have certainly caught up.
