You decide what is worth exploring and the island. The Rebels, meanwhile, significantly reduce the distance between you and them.

choice.text: Don't waste your time and fly away from this planet.

event.text: You can not afford to spend precious time for every planet you encounter. The Rebels are getting closer, and you have an important mission.

You have no idea how anyone can be found here. Having spent several hours unsuccessfully searching, you return to the ship. You can also explore the island at the equator, but by then the Rebels will have certainly caught up.
You decide that it's worth exploring the island, so that you didn't fly here in vain. Meanwhile, the Rebels significantly reduce the distance between them and you.

choice.text: Don't waste your time and fly away from this planet.

event.text: You can not afford to spend precious time for every planet you encounter. The Rebels are getting closer, and you have an important mission.

You land on the mainland. All around a terrible blizzard is raging; the visibility is not more than a couple of meters. You cannot imagine how you can find anybody. Unexpectedly, hardly a few steps away from the ship you find an Engi camp covered in snow, which, apparently, sent the distress signal for a rescue ship. You just miraculously landed on this camp! You find the body of one Engi: there is barely a glimmer of life within him.

choice.text: (Advanced Medbay) Urgently move them into the Medbay.

event.text: You quickly drag the Engi into your advanced Medbay. Soon they appear alive and well in front of you, and thanks you for the rescue. You take him into your crew and go into orbit. You can also explore the island at the equator, but by then the Rebels will have certainly caught up.
You decide what is worth exploring and the island. The Rebels, meanwhile, significantly reduce the distance between you and them.

choice.text: Don't waste your time and fly away from this planet.

event.text: You can not afford to spend precious time for every planet you encounter. The Rebels are getting closer, and you have an important mission.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Urgently move them into the Medbay.

event.text: You quickly drag the Engi into your advanced Medbay. Soon they appear alive and well in front of you, and thanks you for the rescue. You take him into your crew and go into orbit. You can also explore the island at the equator, but by then the Rebels will have certainly caught up.
You decide what is worth exploring and the island. The Rebels, meanwhile, significantly reduce the distance between you and them.

choice.text: Don't waste your time and fly away from this planet.

event.text: You can not afford to spend precious time for every planet you encounter. The Rebels are getting closer, and you have an important mission.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Wait for their death, and then clone them.

event.text: You drag the icy corpse of the Engi into the clonebay. A few minutes later, they come out and thank you for saving them. You take them into your crew and go into orbit. You can also explore the island at the equator, but by then the Rebels will have certainly caught up.
You decide what is worth exploring and the island. The Rebels, meanwhile, significantly reduce the distance between you and them.

choice.text: Don't waste your time and fly away from this planet.

event.text: You can not afford to spend precious time for every planet you encounter. The Rebels are getting closer, and you have an important mission.

The Engi stayed in the cold for too long, and the Medbay cannot help him. With regrets, you go back into orbit. You can also explore the island at the equator, but by then the Rebels will have certainly caught up.
You decide what is worth exploring and the island. The Rebels, meanwhile, significantly reduce the distance between you and them.

choice.text: Don't waste your time and fly away from this planet.

event.text: You can not afford to spend precious time for every planet you encounter. The Rebels are getting closer, and you have an important mission.

choice.text: Leave them. There's nothing we can do.

event.text: It's over, the Engi died, help came too late. With regrets, you go back into orbit. You can also explore the island at the equator, but by then the Rebels will have certainly caught up.
You decide what is worth exploring and the island. The Rebels, meanwhile, significantly reduce the distance between you and them.

choice.text: Don't waste your time and fly away from this planet.

event.text: You can not afford to spend precious time for every planet you encounter. The Rebels are getting closer, and you have an important mission.

event.name: PLANET_ENGE_OSTROV
event.text: You land on the island at the equator. Apparently, the island was inhabited for some time, but now it looks abandoned. At its center is a great black lake, which seems to be of natural origin. To the north lie the ruins of a mine, and to the south one can see the ruins of the underground bunker. You don't want to lose an eternity on this planet, so choose only one subject to search.
The lake turns out to actually be natural, and it looked black because it's not filled with water, but with clean fuel! You fill all the empty tanks on the ship and prepare to leave the planet.

You go to explore the mine. Once you get there, it turns out that the metal ore was mined, and several containers are already filled and ready for processing. You take everything and return to the ship with scrap.
You go to the entrance to the bunker. It is partially collapsed, and the design looks dangerous and unreliable. You wonder whether to climb back.

choice.text: Don't risk it and go to the lake instead.

event.text: The lake turns out to actually be natural, and it looked black because it's not filled with water, but with clean fuel! You fill all the empty tanks on the ship and prepare to leave the planet.

choice.text: Don't risk it and explore the mine instead.

event.text: You go to explore the mine. Once you get there, it turns out that the metal ore was mined, and several containers are already filled and ready for processing. You take everything and return to the ship with scrap.

choice.text: Take a chance and explore the ruins of the bunker.

event.text: It doesn't make sense to retreat when you are so close to the target.

You send your crew to investigate the bunker. Some of the passages are sealed off, some end with doors locked from the inside. Suddenly, the earth trembles, and the ceiling of the corridor, along which your crew was heading, collapses! One of them gets buried in stones, and the rest hurriedly leave the bunker. You regret your order, but there's nothing you can do about it. You return to orbit and prepare to fly away.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The deceased crewman's clone appears out of the clonebay.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

You send your crew to investigate the bunker. Some of the passages are sealed off, some end with doors locked from the inside. Finally, one of the doors gives in and they enter a spacious room. It mainly looks like a laboratory or some sort of assembly shop. Everywhere there are unknown mechanisms; everything is covered with a thick layer of dust and probably doesn't work. Your attention is drawn to one device still in working condition. The instructions say that it allows you to upgrade any missile weapon installed on the ship, so that it will no longer need ammunition! That sounds like a very appealing offer.

You send your crew to investigate the bunker. Some of the passages are sealed off, some end with doors locked from the inside. Soon it becomes clear that getting into any room just doesn't work out that way. You can try to detonate some door with the help of missile ammunition or not risk it and go back to the ship.
You plant a charge of a single warhead underneath one of the doors.

You plant a charge of five warheads underneath one of the doors. An explosion is heard, and the steel door flies off like a piece of cardboard. Once the dust settles, your crew cautiously enters the spacious room. It mainly looks like a laboratory or some sort of assembly shop. Everywhere there are unknown mechanisms; everything is covered with a thick layer of dust and probably doesn't work. Your attention is drawn to one device still in working condition. The instructions say that it allows you to upgrade any missile weapon installed on the ship, so that it will no longer need ammunition! That sounds like a very appealing offer.

You plant a powerful charge of ten warheads underneath one of the doors. There is a deafening explosion, and a part of the corridor near the door collapses! One of your crew members is buried alive. It seems that you overdid it with the power of the charge...
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The deceased crewman's clone appears out of the clonebay.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

It looks as if this place is ready to collapse at any moment, with not enough time or structural integrity to arrange an explosion. You decide not to risk the crew and give the order to return to the ship. Soon the engines warm up, and you're ready to make another jump.

You lay the single missile shell underneath the door. An explosion is heard and a lot of dust rises into the air. When it dissipates, you see that the steel door didn't even bend! You don't risk setting another charge — who knows how many of these walls will stand before collapsing? The crew returns to the ship, and you give the order to jump.

You lay the single missile shell underneath the door. An explosion is heard and a lot of dust rises into the air. When it dissipates, you see that the steel door is blown out by the explosion: it lies around the entrance to a spacious room. Your crew goes inside. It mainly looks like a laboratory or some sort of assembly shop. Everywhere there are unknown mechanisms; everything is covered with a thick layer of dust and probably doesn't work. Your attention is drawn to one device still in working condition. The instructions say that it allows you to upgrade any missile weapon installed on the ship, so that it will no longer need ammunition! That sounds like a very appealing offer.

textList.name: PLANET_ENGE_UPGRADE_TEXT
textList.text: You start the mechanism on your weapon. It's busy tinkering with it and making the necessary adjustments...

textList.name: PLANET_ENGE_UPGRADE_TEXT_2
textList.text: ...and finally it finishes upgrading your weapon. Now ammunition will not end when shooting from it! You're one step closer to accomplishing your mission, and now it's time to prepare for the jump.

event.text: The charge is enough for only one weapon, so you'll have to choose between them.

choice.text: (Hull Missiles Mark I) Upgrade this weapon.
(Hull Missiles Mark I €) Upgrade this weapon.
(Hull Missiles Mark I ‡) Upgrade this weapon.
(Hull Missiles Mark I √) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark I) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark I €) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark I ‡) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark I †) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark I √) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark II) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark II €) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark II ‡) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark II †) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark II √) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark III) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark III €) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark III ‡) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark III †) Upgrade this weapon.
(Missile Flak Mark III √) Upgrade this weapon.
(Hull Missiles Mark II) Upgrade this weapon.
(Hull Missiles Mark II €) Upgrade this weapon.
(Hull Missiles Mark II ‡) Upgrade this weapon.
(Hull Missiles Mark II †) Upgrade this weapon.
(Hull Missiles Mark II √) Upgrade this weapon.
(The Hand of Death) Upgrade this weapon.
(The Hand of Death ‰) Upgrade this weapon.
(The Hand of Death €) Upgrade this weapon.
(The Hand of Death ‡) Upgrade this weapon.
(The Hand of Death †) Upgrade this weapon.
(The Hand of Death √) Upgrade this weapon.

event.text: After spending a lot of time, you understand that the device cannot upgrade this type of weapon... You take the mechanism apart and leave the planet.

choice.text: Dismantle the installation into drone parts.

event.text: You don't have a suitable missile weapon, so you disassemble the device for drones. It's time to get ready for the next jump — you've already spent enough time here.

event.name: ANAEROBIC_PRO_EVENT
event.text: Among the blackness of the cosmos you come across a Lanius station. These scavengers are, as always, busy absorbing scrap metal and don't pay attention to your ship. However, your attention is drawn to the unusual weapons installed at the station; in no sector have you come across any of its kind. If you can get them, it will help your mission.

choice.text: Attack the station while they are busy absorbing scrap.

event.text: You hail the station, but in response you hear only the gnashing of metal. After that, the weapons on the station are activated and aimed at your ship! There is no choice but to take the fight.
You decide not to take any risks and just charge the engines for the jump, so that the Lanius have no reason to attack you.

choice.text: (Lanius Crew Member) Send your Lanius to negotiate.

event.text: You decide to strike the first blow, while the Lanius station doesn't notice you. However, a defense system activates at the station, and then makes a volley over at your ship! You don't have any time to react, and the ship gets damaged.

You decide to strike the first blow, while the Lanius station doesn't notice you. The first volley from your weapons disables the station's weapons system, making it now only operate at half of its full capacity.
They are preparing for a retaliatory attack.

The Lanius from your ship communicates with members of their own kind at the station. They explain to them that you are interested in their armament and want to acquire it. The Lanius are ready to do anything for the sake of metal, and agree to give you the weapon for 90 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the weapon on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the weapon for free. The Lanius silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Lanius agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 60 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the weapon on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the weapon for free. The Lanius silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.

The Lanius from your ship communicates with members of their own kind at the station. Your Lanius explains to them that you're interested in their armament and want to acquire it. The Lanius are ready to do anything for the sake of metal, and agree to give you the weapon for 60 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the weapon on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that this is too high a price, and that it's much easier to get the weapon for free. The Lanius silently prepare their defenses.
You decide that this is too high a price, and warm up the engines, preparing to jump.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a discount.

event.text: The Lanius agree that the price is unreasonably inflated, and voice the new price — 40 scrap.
You send them the scrap, and they set up the weapon on your ship.

choice.text: Attack them to possess a weapon of power.

event.text: You decide that it's much easier to get the weapon for free. The Lanius silently prepare their defenses.
You are tired of bargaining, so you warm up your engines, and prepare to jump.

destroyed.text: After the explosion, you find one of the prototype weapons installed at the station. Unfortunately, the second one got destroyed in the battle.

deadCrew.text: Killing off the enemy crew, you find one of the prototype weapons installed at the station. Unfortunately, the second one got badly damaged in the battle.

choice.text: Collect scrap from the station and fly away.

event.text: You collect all the scrap from the station you can manage, and prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi have a look at the damaged weapon.

event.text: The Engi's able to solve the problem with the second weapon. After collecting debris drifting nearby, you give the order to jump.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Let your Morph have a look at the damaged weapon.

event.text: The Morph's able to solve the problem with the second weapon. After collecting debris drifting nearby, you give the order to jump.

event.name: REBEL_DREDNOUT_QUEST
event.text: This beacon seems the same as any other until a Rebel dreadnought emerges from the nearby nebula, equipped with the most powerful weaponry that you have ever seen! It immediately goes on the offensive; this fight will clearly not be easy.

destroyed.text: The Rebel dreadnought is destroyed, and you inspect its wreckage. One of the weapons remains in working condition — it's a prototype of a missile weapon, possessing locking properties, similar to the Crystalline bombs. Perhaps someday you'll find out how it got into the hands of the Rebels. Now it's time to return to your mission.

deadCrew.text: You killed the dreadnought's crew and give the order to carefully inspect the entire ship. In one of the distant compartments you find a Crystal, obviously not trained for battle. They say that their ship, on which they were returning to their home sector from an expedition, crashed in an asteroid field.The Crystal had to enter a stasis-dream and hope that they would be wakened by one of their own. Unfortunately, they were first discovered by the Rebels and were forced to work on weapons for the new Flagship, so this prototype was created. You install it on your ship, rejoicing that this weapon type didn't have time to be installed on the Rebel Flagship. The Crystalline being joins your crew.

event.name: ODIN_PIRAT_QUEST
event.text: You jump to the distress signal, but it turns out to be a trap! A lone pirate hails: "Haha! I didn't think it'd be so easy to engage in piracy. The first victim appeared here as soon as I sent this distress signal. Get ready to say goodbye to your ship!"

surrender.text: "Enough, stop it! I realized my mistake: I should've checked my ammunition stocks before dealing in piracy. If you leave me alive, I'll give you the coordinates of our secret station."

event.text: You turn off your weapon, and the pirate gives you the coordinates of the pirate station. After collecting a bit of scrap, left after the battle, you prepare to jump.

choice.text: Piracy is a crime punishable by death. Fire!

destroyed.text: The ship of the unlucky pirate explodes, and you collect what scrap remains of it.

deadCrew.text: Killing the unlucky pirate, you take everything of value from their ship.

event.name: PIRAT_BASE_QUEST
event.text: The pirate didn't lie — before you is their secret station... It's time to avenge all those they've robbed and killed.

destroyed.text: The pirate base is destroyed. From its wreckage you can collect one augment for your ship.

event.text: You collect the augment from the debris, and then prepare to make the jump.
You collect the augment from the debris, and then prepare to make the jump.
You collect the augment from the debris, and then prepare to make the jump.

deadCrew.text: All the pirates are dead, and you can collect one augment from the remaining station for your ship.

event.text: You collect the augment from the station, and then prepare to make the jump.
You collect the augment from the station, and then prepare to make the jump.
You collect the augment from the station, and then prepare to make the jump.

event.name: ELITE_AUTOMATED_EVENT
event.text: As soon as you appear at the beacon, an elite drone flies at you! It's too late to retreat; prepare to fight!

destroyed.text: The drone is destroyed, and among its wreckage you find one surviving weapon.

deadCrew.text: Glitchy glitchy glitcho glitchiness.

event.name: SKUP
event.text: There is a material trader settled at this beacon who is willing to buy your supplies at basic prices, or just sell stuff if you're not interested in selling them.

choice.text: Sell excess supplies and see the goods.

event.text: You review the number of supplies in the ship.
Not wanting to sell your supplies, you just have look at their goods.

event.name: SKUP_START
event.text: Want to sell fuel?
How many?
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.

event.name: SKUP_2
event.text: Want to sell missiles?
How many?
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.

event.name: SKUP_3
event.text: Want to sell drone parts?
How many?
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.

event.name: SKUP_END
event.text: You finish exchanging goods and check what the material trader's store has to offer.

event.name: ZOLTAN_SCI_QUEST
event.text: The distress signal is coming from a small Zoltan vessel. When they see you, they hail: "Please, you must help us. We were testing a powerful new energy weapon capable of piercing all shields. The tests were successful, but our leader seems to have gone mad after that! Our leader and their friends took over the lab and threaten to destroy the entire sector! We barely managed to escape, it was terrible... "
The Zoltans send you the coordinates of the lab. "Take this Advanced FTL Navigation module. If you are successful in helping us, we will thank you generously." You promise to do everything you can.

choice.text: Let them understand that this is none of your business and not your problem.

event.text: The poor scientists did not expect such a turn of events, and you are already charging your weapons.

event.name: ZOLTAN_SCI_LAB
event.text: You make your way to the mad scientist's laboratory indicated by the coordinates. None of your hails are answered, instead, a huge barreled energy weapon turns in your direction. Your crew freezes in horror at the sight of the weapon...

destroyed.text: The laboratory is destroyed, and you collect debris. Their huge cannon, unfortunately, did not survive...

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Find the location of the Zoltan scientists.

event.text: You find new coordinates of scientists and go ahead for the reward.
Without improved FTL navigation you cannot find the new coordinates of the scientists. Time to move on.

deadCrew.text: The mad scientist's crew is dead. You take everything of value, except their huge cannon, which unfortunately didn't survive...

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Find the location of the Zoltan scientists.

event.text: You find new coordinates of scientists and go ahead for the reward.
Without improved FTL navigation you cannot find the new coordinates of the scientists. Time to move on.

event.name: ZOLTAN_SCI_3A
event.text: You find a ship of scientists. The Zoltans already know about your victory and are ready to fulfill their promise. Choose what you want to receive.
You request the installation of a cloaking system. After a while everything is ready. Checking the operation of the new system, you thank the scientists and move on.
You request an augment. After a while everything is ready. Thanking the scientists, you move on.
You choose a heavy weapon. Certainly, it will always come in handy. Thanking the scientists, you get ready to jump.

event.name: ZOLTAN_SCI_3B
event.text: You find a ship of scientists. The Zoltans already know about your victory and are ready to fulfill their promise. Choose what you want to receive.
You request the installation of a teleporter. After a while everything is ready. Checking the operation of the new system, you thank the scientists and move on.
You request an augment. After a while everything is ready. Thanking the scientists, you move on.
You choose a heavy weapon. Certainly, it will always come in handy. Thanking the scientists, you get ready to jump.

event.name: ZOLTAN_SCI_3C
event.text: You find a ship of scientists. The Zoltans already know about your victory and are ready to fulfill their promise. Choose what you want to receive.
You request the installation of a hacking system. After a while everything is ready. Checking the operation of the new system, you thank the scientists and move on.
You request an augment. After a while everything is ready. Thanking the scientists, you move on.
You choose a heavy weapon. Certainly, it will always come in handy. Thanking the scientists, you get ready to jump.

event.name: NEBULA_AVATAR_PRO_EVENT
event.text: Directly in front of you among the nebula is a slowly drifting Avatar station. The station has an unidentified type of weapon, but so far everything looks quiet. Communication with avatars is useless, they are not able to communicate in a language accessible to living beings.
The station immediately activates in response to your aggression.
Not daring to communicate with the avatars, you give the order to jump.

choice.text: (Avatar Crew Member) Allow your Avatar to sabotage the station.

event.text: Avatar, taking advantage of being mistaken as one of them, sneaks into the drone bay. They manage to disable half of it before the other Avatars intervene and vaporize it into molecules. The station is preparing for battle.

removeCrew.text: Your Avatar comes out of the cloning bay ready to take their place in the battle.

destroyed.text: Explosions disperse debris from the station in all directions. However, a prototype weapon flies by your ship, and as it seems, still works.

deadCrew.text: All the Avatars are destroyed. One of the prototypes looks intact, but the second is strongly buried in rubble, and can hardly be repaired.

choice.text: Collect scrap from the station and fly away.

event.text: You collect all the scrap remaining at the station and prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi take a look at the debris.

event.text: Your Engi is able to solve the problem with the second weapon. After collecting debris flying nearby, you give the order to jump.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Let your Morph take a look at the debris.

event.text: Your Morph is able to solve the problem with the second weapon. After collecting debris flying nearby, you give the order to jump.

event.name: ASTEROID_DREDNOUT
event.text: Upon arriving at the beacon, you find a strange blue glow emanating from a nearby lone asteroid.

choice.text: Send one of your crew members to the asteroid in an escape pod.
Charge up the FTL Drive and fly away from here.

event.text: Your mission is too important to be distracted by every asteroid. Charging up your drive, you prepare to fly away.
The scan reveals a high content of cobalt, powerful radiation fields and absolutely nothing that might help in your mission.

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Get closer and start a deep analysis of the structure of the asteroid via resonance pulses.

event.text: During the analysis of the asteroid, it begins to glow brighter and brighter, until it finally explodes, fragments hitting your ship... and in place of the asteroid there is a huge Lanius ship that is clearly hostile!

choice.text: (Lanius Crew Member) Ask your Lanius about the nature of this asteroid.

event.text: The crewman flies to the asteroid, mines a decent amount of useful materials and safely returns with them. You then fly away.
Coming up to the asteroid, the crewman mines a few useful materials and safely returns with them. You then fly away.
The crewman flies to the asteroid, mines a small amount of useful materials and safely returns with them. You then fly away.
Once the capsule gets near to the asteroid, its controls suddenly refuse to respond, and it crashes on the surface of the asteroid, blown to bits.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The clone of your astronaut staggers around and rubs their eyes before going to their place.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
Once the capsule gets near to the asteroid, its controls suddenly refuse to respond, and it crashes on the surface of the asteroid, blown to bits.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The clone turns out to be unviable and in constant pain, they die at the opening of the clone bay. Strong radiation from the asteroid must have irreversibly damaged their DNA. You don't dare in continuing to try and revive them...

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
While you're busy deciding who'll risk their life, a huge Lanius ship slides out of a cleft in the asteroid. Looks like it won't leave without a fight.
Your shots leave visible traces on the asteroid, but nothing happens.
You don't risk to continue shooting and fly away from here.
Shots knock off a few fragments. You collect them and fly away.
Shots knock off a few shards. You collect them and fly away.
Shots knock off a large pile of debris. You collect them and fly on.
Shooting at the asteroid leads to a devastating explosion. Debris flies every which way, hurting your ship for quite a bit of damage.
Shooting at the asteroid causes it to explode. Debris flies every which way, hurting your ship, and in place of the asteroid there is a hostile Lanius ship!
Shooting at the asteroid leads to a devastating explosion. Debris flies every which way, hurting your ship for quite a bit of damage.
Shooting at the asteroid causes it to explode. Debris flies every which way, hurting your ship, and in place of the asteroid there is a hostile Lanius ship!
You don't manage to achieve any coherent response from the Lanius. Apparently, your crew member is not the most intelligent representative of their kind...

choice.text: Send one of your crew members to the asteroid in an escape pod.
Charge up the FTL Drive and fly away from here.

event.text: Your mission is too important to be distracted by every asteroid. Charging up your drive, you prepare to fly away.
The scan reveals a high content of cobalt, powerful radiation fields and absolutely nothing that might help in your mission.

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Get closer and start a deep analysis of the structure of the asteroid via resonance pulses.

event.text: During the analysis of the asteroid, it begins to glow brighter and brighter, until it finally explodes, fragments hitting your ship... and in place of the asteroid there is a huge Lanius ship that is clearly hostile!
Through the grinding sounds of their speech you sort out the following words: "Asteroid... ship... light... get... metal."

choice.text: Try switching comms channels in search of an answer.

event.text: A Lanius dreadnought slides out of the asteroid and slowly approaches you.

choice.text: Let the Lanius communicate with their fellow kind.
(Slug Crew Member) Let the slug talk to the captain of the dreadnought through your Lanius's consciousness.

event.text: The Slug takes an order for the transportation of rare weaponry from them. Of course, you can keep it for yourself.
Through the grinding sounds of their speech, you manage to understand that inside the asteroid is a ship mining ore.

choice.text: Try switching comms channels in search of an answer.

event.text: A Lanius dreadnought slides out of the asteroid and slowly approaches you.

choice.text: Let the Lanius communicate with their fellow kind.
(Slug Crew Member) Let the slug talk to the captain of the dreadnought through your Lanius's consciousness.

event.text: The Slug takes an order for the transportation of rare weaponry from them. Of course, you can keep it for yourself.

choice.text: Send an explosive to the asteroid.

event.text: Hooking a few warheads together, you send them forward. The explosion breaks down the asteroid and significantly damages the engines of the ship located insde the asteroid. Prepare to fight.
Your Lanius manages to get some materials for your mission.

choice.text: Too few. Clearly, there must be more in their vaults. Charge up the weapons!

event.text: You rush into battle without a doubt that you'll emerge victorious.

choice.text: Thank them and hit the road.

event.text: The metal screech of both Lanius becomes sharper and sharper, and then the connection is cut off by shots in your direction...

destroyed.text: The ship's destroyed. You collect everything of use left of it.

deadCrew.text: You killed the ship's crew. On board, you find useful materials and bio-logs for the creation of a single Lanius. Quickly restoring the cloning machine, you use it and get a new member for your crew.

event.text: Unfortunately, none of the dreadnought's weapons survived the battle. You move on.
One of the dreadnought's weapons is undamaged, and you take it for yourself.

event.name: MANTIS_HUNTER_PIRATE_EVENT
event.text: In front of you is a Mantis ship, but you don't see any weaponry.

"How dare you fly into my sector?! I, KtsahkterKaatts — cousin of KazaaakplethKilik, will now gut everyone aboard your ship for such impudence!" As you ponder over their words, the ship teleports over a slave strapped with an explosive charge! There is an explosion, and in the heat of battle you notice oxygen masks on the faces of the attacking Mantises.

choice.text: Get out of here, it's a trap for sure.
(Mantis Crew Member) Introduce your Mantis as captain of a slave ship.

event.text: The captain of their ship clicks their teeth and urges you to sell them one of your slaves.

choice.text: (Order Human Crew Member) Sell your Order Human.

event.name: RAB_TRADE_NEXT
event.text: Who will we sell?

choice.text: (молодой машрум Crew Member) Sell your машрума.
(зрелого машрум Crew Member) Sell your машрума.
(старого машрум Crew Member) Sell your машрума.
(слаг в панцире Crew Member) Sell your слага в панцире.
(Mantis Crew Member) Say that you don't want to sell anyone.

event.text: Their captain is furious. They send over a suicide bomber strapped with explosives to your ship. A batch of boarders is already preparing to teleport. To your surprise, they appear in oxygen masks!

event.name: RAB_TRADE_DONE
event.text: Satisfied with the transaction, their captain invites you to take a look at their wares.
The Mantis ship remains motionless, and you quiety charge the engines...
No one stops you, and you calmly make a jump.
The Mantis realize that their ambush failed and are sent to the chase!
The Mantis were ready for that, and one of them immediately teleports aboard your ship! And the others are getting ready for another teleporter intrusion! Prepare to fight back!
The Mantis are already preparing to teleport over. Prepare to fight back!
Strangely enough, the ship doesn't make any attempt to escape.

destroyed.text: The ship is destroyed. You collect all that looks useful from its remains.

deadCrew.text: You killed all the Mantis, and the contents of the ship's holds are yours. Also you manage to find a living prisoner, and they joing your team. When you charge the drive, you think that the red spots on the outside of the ship's hull cannot be paint at all...

textList.name: RAB_TRADE_SELLCREW_TEXT
textList.text: Your crew member will be missed.
You give your crew member, realizing that the valuable scrap is of utmost importance now. Or at least that's what you tell yourself to justify what you've just done...
You give your crew member, knowing that you can replace them.
With tears in your eyes, you give your crew member... War forces you to do terrible things...
You give your crew member without much pity... They weren't that useful anyway.

event.text: Just when you're about to leave, you notice another pile of scrap left from the battle and don't think it should go to waste.
Just when you're about to leave, you notice another pile of scrap left from the battle and don't think it should go to waste.

event.name: CONFUSED_ENGI
event.text: You are surprised to see the wild mixture of an Engi and Mantis ship found at this beacon. This ship is clearly a single unit, though at first it looked to you that these two ships collided with each other.

choice.text: Get out of here without attracting their attention.

event.text: Apparently, you manage to go unnoticed, and you leave this place without problems.

You decide to leave as soon as possible, but you've already been noticed. A boarding drone flies in your direction, but instead of breaching the hull, it explodes next to your ship! Looks like they don't have everything in order over there. But still, it's better not to take any unnecessary risks, so you take the wreckage of the drone and prepare to jump away from this strange place.
Your attack heavily damaged their engines! However, they're still able to fight.
They are preparing a retaliatory attack.
Your attack heavily damaged their engines! However, they're still able to fight.
They are preparing a retaliatory attack.
With a powerful volley, you punch up their shields. They immediately respond to your aggression.
They are preparing a retaliatory attack.
Their ship's autopilot deftly evades your shots, and they prepare a retaliatory salvo.
Their ship's autopilot deftly evades your shots, but you don't have time to react to the return volley.
Their ship's autopilot deftly evades your shots, but you don't have time to react to the return volley.
At the last moment, their pilot pulls the steering wheel to the side and moves to attack. To your surprise, you're being boarded by the Engi ship!
You fire a volley, and your shots severely damage their weapons system, but at that very same moment you discover Engi troops aboard your ship!
The battle begins.
Your attack heavily damaged their engines! However, they're still able to fight.
They are preparing a retaliatory attack.
With a powerful volley, you punch up their shields. They immediately respond to your aggression.
The battle begins.
Their ship's autopilot deftly evades your shots, and they prepare a retaliatory salvo.
The Engi says that you don't understand Mantises at all, and that now you'll pay for your impudence.
Shocked at the image of your Mantis, they take off their bandana and ask you to wait, leaving the pilot's cockpit.

choice.text: Excellent! They are distracted. Open fire!
Wait patiently. The Rebel Fleet is still far away.
We don't have time to wait; just leave.

event.text: An Engi wearing a black bandana for unknown reasons responds to your hail. They stutter while talking but you're able to grasp their words, "Foolish Meatsack! You stand no chance against us; surrender your goods if you want to live."

choice.text: Fulfill their demands; we have almost nothing anyways.

event.text: You surrender the contents of your hold. This is a reasonable price for your lives.
The Engi instantly react to your actions.

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Interfere with the Engi's consciousness through hypnosis.

event.text: Your Slug tells them that you are sending them your stores, but in fact it is they that send you their stuff! It's time to cut and run before they come to their senses.

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Interfere with the Engi's consciousness through hypnosis.

event.text: Your Slug tells them that you are sending them your stores, but in fact it is they that send you their stuff! It's time to cut and run before they come to their senses.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Interfere with the Engi's consciousness through hypnosis.

event.text: One of their crew teleports over to you to fight on your side. The rest of the pirates notice and are eager to fight.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew Member) Show the pirate what a real Mantis looks like.
(Hacking) Connect to their on-board computer and reprogram the crew.

event.text: After your intervention, the Engi twitch and jerk even more, but now they're ready to cooperate.

choice.text: We need information about the sector.

event.text: They upload information to your database, after which their ship's captain short-circuits and they cut off communications.
The hacked Engi sends the transport drones, but because of their botched navigation system, it scratches your ship's hull.
The Engi send you their engineers and install the augmentation on your ship, but their processors overheat and two of them burn down, damaging your ship.
Time passes by, and there's no signal from the Engi ship... Meanwhile, the Rebels are approaching.

choice.text: Destroy them! This is the only way to benefit from your meeting.

event.text: With some delay, they respond to your attack.
The battle begins.

choice.text: We're not in a hurry. Wait on.
Set back off on the journey. Evidently they're completely stuck.

event.text: Time passes by, and there's no signal from the Engi ship...

choice.text: Destroy them! This is the only way to benefit from your meeting.

event.text: With some delay, they respond to your attack.
The battle begins.

choice.text: We're not in a hurry. Wait on.
Set back off on the journey. Evidently they're completely stuck.

event.text: The Engi comes to the display and apologizes to you for the delay. They say that their crew captured a Mantis ship but a powerful flash from a nearby pulsar damaged their pseudo-circuits. Thereafter the Engi began to consider themselves Mantises and embarked on the path of piracy. Thanks to you, they have realized the truth and are now ready to help.

choice.text: Allow them to send useful materials into your holds by disabling your security system.

event.text: A small transport gives you a combat drone schematic.
That's not all! In the second flight, they bring something else.

choice.text: We don't fall for bait. Refuse.

event.text: Insulted, the Engi interrupts the connection.

The Engi comes to the display and apologizes to you for the delay. They say that their crew captured a Mantis ship but a powerful flash from a nearby pulsar damaged their pseudo-circuits. Thereafter the Engi began to consider themselves Mantises and embarked on the path of piracy. Thanks to you, they have realized the truth and are now ready to help.

choice.text: Allow them to send useful materials into your holds by disabling your security system.

event.text: A small transport gives you a combat drone schematic.
That's not all! In the second flight, they bring something else.

choice.text: We don't fall for bait. Refuse.

event.text: Insulted, the Engi interrupts the connection.

destroyed.text: This ship is destroyed, and you collect its debris. Among the wreckage, you find several ruined drone schematics.

deadCrew.text: You destroy all the Engi and clear out the ship's holds. Inside you also find a drone schematic which you transfer to your ship.

event.name: ALIENS
event.text: Here lie the remains of a Federation bomber. The armor plating is covered with bloodstains. You try to establish communications, but no one answers.

choice.text: Open the ship's airlocks and inspect its contents.

event.text: Inside you find traces of a bloodbath and a lot of dead people.

choice.text: Just collect everything at the entrance, and quickly leave.

event.text: It's not worth the risk, and your crew understand.

choice.text: (Mantis Pheromones) Use the pheromones to quickly collect as many supplies as possible.

event.text: The crew quickly transfers all that is useful into your hold. Now you need to fly away.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.
This looks suspicious. Better to fly away from here.
(Lifeform Scanner) Check the presence of lifeforms with your scanner.
(Slug Crew Member) Let the Slug check for life on the ship.

event.name: ALIEN_CLONNING
event.text: Around there are only dead bodies...

choice.text: There's nothing you can do; time to fly away.

event.text: Before leaving, you decide whether or not to destroy the remains of the bomber.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.
(Clonebay) Bring some biological material to the clone chamber.
(Improved Clonebay) Bring some biological material to the clone chamber.
(Advanced Clonebay) Bring some biological material to the clone chamber.

event.text: From the remains of a dead person, you manage to clone a new crew member. They tell you that terrible creatures with twin sets of teeth and acidic blood wound up on their ship. Their whole crew died, and the creatures are probably still aboard the ship. Before you fly, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: From the remains of a dead person, you manage to clone a new crew member. You ask them what happened aboard their ship, but they can't remember anything. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: From the remains of a dead person, you manage to clone a new crew member. They tell you that terrible creatures with twin sets of teeth and acidic blood wound up on their ship. Their whole crew died, and the creatures are probably still aboard the ship. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: During inspection of the ship, you're attacked by a bizarre black creature with acid for blood. It quickly chews up one of your crew. Hastily retreating, you return to the ship and from a distance fire at the bomber until it's completely destroyed. You manage to collect something of use.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The clonebay resurrects them, and they frightenedly ask you to fly away from here.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
There are no signs of life on the ship. You calmly collect everything of value.
You manage to find some supplies scattered among the ship's rooms. You don't run the risk of staying around here longer than necessary.

With the help of surgical instruments, your medbay successfully cuts the alien parasite from the infected person's chest. Unfortunately, it happened too late, and the patient dies on the operating table. It's sad, but you need to move on. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.name: ALIEN_MED_2_CHECK_CARGO
event.text: You manage to cut the parasite out of their chest, and the person joins your crew.

choice.text: Ask them what happened on the ship.

event.text: In gratitude they tell of a secret Federation mission for the seizure and transport of biological weapons from a remote planet. This "weapon" escaped and killed their ship's entire crew. They invite you to capture one of the other strange beings to complete their mission.

choice.text: Don't get involved in this, the space here is already much too dangerous.
Send your crew off to hunt it.
(Boarding Drone) Send out a boarding drone to hunt it.
Ask them if there's anything useful on the ship.

event.text: In gratitude, they tell of backup fuel in secret storage. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.name: ALIEN_FIND_MAN
event.text: In the ventilation system you find a barely living coughing person. They just barely have the chance to say that there's something alive in their chest...

choice.text: What horror! Gather the supplies lying around and leave them to die.

event.text: You want to think that you're doing the right thing. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.
Take them along with some nearby supplies to your ship.

event.text: The person comes back to their original self and begins to work on the ship. Suddenly, their chest rips open, and something black and slippery falls out of it. A terrible creature pounces on a member of your crew, flooding them with acid and burning the ship's hull... At the last moment someone manages to push the terrifying monster and your burned crew member into an airlock, jettisoning the two of them into depths of space.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The clonebay resurrects them, and they frightenedly ask you to fly away from here.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

choice.text: (Medbay) Bring him on board to the medbay.

event.text: You bring the patient on board and put them into a medical unit. Suddenly, the person inside starts to thrash in agony, and a black and slimy creature oozes out of their chest. It starts splashing acid secretions inside the medbay, which burn large holes in the floor. After a few moments, the strange being and the deceased man are jettisoned away into the depths of space. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the ship's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.
(Improved Medbay) Bring him on board to the medbay.
(Advanced Medbay) Bring him on board to the medbay.

event.name: ALIEN_MED_3
event.text: You manage to cut the parasite out of their chest, and the person joins your crew.

choice.text: Ask them what happened on the ship.
Ask them if there's anything useful on the ship.

event.text: In gratitude, they tell of backup fuel in secret storage. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.name: ALIEN_MED_3_CHECK_CARGO
event.text: In gratitude they tell of a secret Federation mission for the seizure and transport of biological weapons from a remote planet. This "weapon" escaped and killed their ship's entire crew. They invite you to capture one of the other strange beings to complete their mission.

choice.text: Don't get involved in this, the space here is already much too dangerous.
Send your crew off to hunt it.
(Boarding Drone) Send out a boarding drone to hunt it.

event.name: ALIEN_FIND_MAN_SCAN
event.text: On the ship there's a still living person, but within their body lives a parasite. Without special medical equipment, helping them is impossible.

choice.text: Sick people are of no use to us; just gather nearby supplies and leave them to die.

event.text: You want to think that you're doing the right thing...

choice.text: Take them along with some nearby supplies to your ship.

event.text: The person comes back to their original self and begins to work on the ship. Suddenly, their chest rips open, and something black and slippery falls out of it. A terrible creature pounces on a member of your crew, flooding them with acid and burning the ship's hull... At the last moment someone manages to push the terrifying monster and your burned crew member into an airlock, jettisoning the two of them into depths of space.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The clonebay resurrects them, and they frightenedly ask you to fly away from here.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

choice.text: (Medbay) Bring him on board to the medbay.

event.text: You bring the patient on board and put them into a medical unit. Suddenly, the person inside starts to thrash in agony, and a black and slimy creature oozes out of their chest. It starts splashing acid secretions inside the medbay, which burn large holes in the floor. After a few moments, the strange being and the deceased man are jettisoned away into the depths of space. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the ship's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.
(Improved Medbay) Bring him on board to the medbay.
(Advanced Medbay) Bring him on board to the medbay.

event.text: There are no signs of life on the ship. You calmly collect everything of value.

There's no one alive on the ship, but you find an abandoned weapon. After washing the blood from it, you install it on your ship. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the bomber's remains.

event.text: The entire ship is packed with predatory alien creatures. Good thing you didn't open any of its doors...
The drone isn't quick enough, and the strange beings tear it apart. We need to get out of here. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: The drone moves about the ship, but as soon as it finds something, the connection breaks off. We need to get out of here. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: The drone manages to catch one of the creatures in acid-resistant netting and brings it to the ship. The survivor gives you the coordinates of the secret Federation center. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: The drone manages to catch one of the creatures in acid-resistant netting and brings it to the ship. The survivor gives you the coordinates of the secret Federation center. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: Your crew is neither morally nor physically ready for such an operation. In the confusion of battle, one of them disappears. We need to get out of here.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The clonebay resurrects them, and they frightenedly ask you to fly away from here.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

Your crew manage to tie one of the creatures down and drag it onto the ship, and the survivor gives you the coordinates of the secret Federation center. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: From the remains it's possible to clone a new crew member, but, alas, they remember nothing about the events on the ship. You've spent too much time at this beacon, and it's time to fly away. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: Your attempts at cloning are unsuccessful, and it's time to fly away. Before you fly away, you consider whether or not to destroy the bomber's remains.

choice.text: Fire a volley at the ship's remains.

event.text: You fire at the ship with all your weapons. A bit of scrap is all that's left of it.
Your shots turn the ship into a tremendous pile of scrap. Nothing prevents you from taking it aboard.
Your shots blow up the ship's reactor, and from the resulting explosion, shards pierce your ship's hull. Despite the explosion, you manage to find something of value from the debris.
You find the secret Federation base and give it the captured creature. The staff thank you with the few materials they have.
You find the secret Federation base and give it the captured creature. The staff thank you with a weapon they created.
You find the secret Federation base and give it the captured creature. The staff thank you with a drone they created.
You find the secret Federation base and give it the captured creature. The staff thank you and send some materials.
You find the secret Federation base and give it the captured creature. The staff thank you with a weapon they created.
You find the secret Federation base and give it the captured creature. The staff thank you with a drone they created.

event.name: PIRATE_CHICKEN
event.text: Before you is a pirate ship with an almost charged jump drive. They don't look like they're in a hurry to fight.

choice.text: Attack! They can't get away from us!

event.text: You start charging your weapons — you need to quickly destroy the engines.

choice.text: They're not bothering us, just charge the FTL Drive.

event.name: PIRATE_CHICKEN_AWAY_2
event.text: The same pirate ship! They flew into an asteroid field to lose you!

choice.text: Attack! They can't get away a second time!

event.text: The pirate maneuvers, trying to shake you off their tail.
The beacon's empty. Evidently the pirates must've chosen a different course.

event.name: PIRATE_CHICKEN_AWAY_3
event.text: There they are again! Now near a pulsar!

choice.text: Attack! Surely they can't get away a third time!

event.text: The pirate maneuvers, trying to shake you off their tail.
The beacon's empty. Evidently the pirates must've chosen a different course.
The beacon's empty. Evidently the pirates must've chosen a different course.

event.name: PIRATE_CHICKEN_BASE
event.text: The nearest planet opens fire on you, and a pirate ship beside you hails: "Now that's what you get for coming here!"

escape.text: They're almost ready to get away!

gotaway.text: A bright flash, and it disappears in an unknown direction.

event.text: You mark on the map the supposed place of the ship's jump.

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Track the direction of their jump.

event.text: You enter the jump point on the on-board computer.

surrender.text: "Cease fire! Take our goods, just let us live!"

event.text: They send you what they promised.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect the scrap. Among the debris there's a black box in which you find some coordinates. Just in case, it's worth writing them into the navigation system.

deadCrew.text: You killed all the pirates, so you can collect everything of use from their ship. In the on-board computer you find some strange coordinates.

escape.text: They're running away again!

gotaway.text: The pirate disappeared again...

event.text: You mark on the map the supposed place of the ship's jump.
You mark the end point of their jump.

surrender.text: "Cease fire! Take our goods, just let us live!"

event.text: They send you the promised goods.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect the scrap. Among the debris there's a black box in which you find some coordinates. Just in case, it's worth writing them into the navigation system.

deadCrew.text: You killed all the pirates, so you can collect everything of use from their ship. In the on-board computer you find some strange coordinates.

escape.text: They're ready to slip away again!

gotaway.text: They disappeared again.

event.text: You mark on the map the supposed place of the ship's jump.
You mark the point on the map.

surrender.text: "Cease fire! Take our goods, just let us live!"

event.text: They unload their goods and send them to you.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect the scrap. Among the debris there's a black box in which you find some coordinates. Just in case, it's worth writing them into the navigation system.

deadCrew.text: You killed all the pirates, so you can collect everything of use from their ship. In the on-board computer you find some strange coordinates.

surrender.text: "Cease fire! Take our goods, just let us live!"

event.text: They unload their goods and send them to you.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect scrap, dodging fire from the planet.

deadCrew.text: With all the pirates dead, you clean out their ship and find a weapon in their hold.

event.name: SUN_RIDDIK_EVENT
event.text: The beacon is located some distance away from a very active binary star system. With the planet in low orbit someone sends a distress signal: "Get me out of here! My ship crashed when I... Damn! It's starting again!.."

choice.text: Our ship is not designed for such conditions. Fly away.
(Improved Piloting) Let the navigation system calculate the period of the solar flares.
(Advanced Piloting) Let the navigation system calculate the period of the solar flares.
(Zoltan Shield) Go to the planet under the protection of the Zoltan Shield.
(Rock Armor Plating) Go to the planet under the protection of the Rock plating.
(Fire Suppression) Activate the system and go to the planet.

event.text: You head straight into the inferno to save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off, you're overtaken by a solar flare! It burns up the ship's hull and carries the unlucky soul far out into open space! We need to get out of here as soon as possible.

You head right into the scorching heat and save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off a solar flare catches up to you and sets fire throughout the ship's hull. We need to get out of here as soon as possible.

You head right into the scorching heat and save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off a solar flare catches up to you and sets fire throughout the ship's hull. We need to get out of here as soon as possible.

You wait for the moment between the flashes and go to save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off, plasma streams burn a hole in the ship, and carry away the unlucky soul far out into open space. We need to get out of here as soon as possible.
You wait for the moment between the flashes and save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off, plasma streams burn your ship. We need to get out of here as soon as possible.
You wait for the moment between the flashes and save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off, plasma streams burn your ship. We need to get out of here as soon as possible.

You wait for the moment between the flashes and go to save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off, plasma streams burn a hole in the ship, and carry away the unlucky soul far out into open space. We need to get out of here as soon as possible.

You wait for the moment between the flashes and save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off, plasma streams are already starting to burn your ship. We need to get out of here as soon as possible.

You wait for the moment between the flashes and save the Rock stuck on an incredibly hot planet. Upon lift-off, plasma streams are already starting to burn your ship. We need to get out of here as soon as possible.

Plasma flows all about and around your ship, and you rush to save the Rock stuck on this planet. Before you can even land, a powerful flash carries the unlucky soul far out into open space... Time to get out of here while the shield's still intact.
Streams of plasma and radiation flow around your ship, and you save the Rock stuck on this planet. Time to get out of here while the shield's still intact.
Streams of plasma and radiation flow around your ship, and you save the Rock stuck on this planet. Time to get out of here while the shield's still intact.

The Rock plating heats up to really high temperatures, but reliably protects your ship. You rush in to save the Rock stuck on this planet. Before you can even land, a powerful flash carries the unlucky soul far out into open space... Time to get out of here.
The Rock plating heats up to really high temperatures, but reliably protects your ship. You save the Rock stuck on this planet. Time to get out of here.
The Rock plating heats up to really high temperatures, but reliably protects your ship. You save the Rock stuck on this planet. Time to get out of here.

You rush in to save the Rock that's stuck on this planet, despite the constant fires on board. Before you can even land, a powerful flash carries the unlucky Rock far out into open space... Time to move on.
You pick up the Rock, despite the constant fires on board. Time to move on.
You pick up the Rock, despite the constant fires on board. Time to move on.

event.name: ZOLTAN_FLEET
event.text: You complete the jump right before the main Zoltan fleet. They scan your ship and hail: "Some of the equipment aboard your ship is prohibited in our sectors; how do you explain this?"

choice.text: Apologize and offer to pay for a license to fly with the equipment.

event.text: The Zoltans are satisfied with your payment, and you move on.

choice.text: We don't have to explain anything to anyone! This is our business and ours alone.

event.text: "Violation of Zoltan law is punishable by death." The ship closest to you moves in to attack, and another fires a missile salvo in your direction.

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Influence their commanders via hypnosis.
(Slug Crew Member) Influence their commanders via hypnosis.
(Zoltan Crew Member) Let the Zoltan confer with their brethren.

event.text: Although you squeeze everything out of your engines to escape, their ships catch up and hurt you with weapon fire.
You manage to tear yourself away from the main fleet, but one of the ships sits tightly on your tail.
You manage to tear yourself away from the main fleet, but one of the ships sits tightly on your tail and manages to get a hit in on you.
The Zoltan fleet doesn't even try to persecute you... They probably have more important things to do...
Several ships rush into the chase, but soon turn back. Along the way, you stumble upon the wreckage of some long-forgotten satellite.
Several ships rush into the chase, but soon turn back. Along the way, you come across a whole pile of scrap metal, once, apparently, a former ship.
Your Slug convinces them that you have a license. You're able to pass.
Your Slug inspires an irresistible desire to help you within them, and the Zoltans promise to stop the fleet in every way possible.
Your Slug inspires an irresistible desire to help you within them, and the Zoltans promise to stop the fleet in every way possible.
Your Slug inspires an irresistible urge to help you within them, and the Zoltans supply you with useful materials.
Your Slug inspires an irresistible urge to help you within them, and the Zoltans supply you with useful supplies.
The abilities of your Slug were weak, and the attempt at deception is discovered. The Zoltans attack!
Your Zoltan enthusiastically chats with their comrades on a variety of topics and, ultimately, beg for a license to fly, a sector map and one weapon.

Your Zoltan appeals to clause 155.17.8 of the absolute code of the Zoltan Union about critical wartime situations. The fleet commanders reluctantly agree with them and, according to instruction 155.17.8b, send you 5 fuel cells.

Your Zoltan appeals to clause 155.17.8 of the absolute code of the Zoltan Union about critical wartime situations. However, one of their commanders recalls the amendment 155.17.8d on unauthorized FTL-jumps and gives the fleet a signal for sweeping.

Your Zoltan appeals to clause 155.17.8 of the absolute code of the Zoltan Union about critical wartime situations. To this the Zoltans answer that your Zoltan didn't take into account the corrective list of permitted technologies 155.17.8a and open fire for trying to doubt the competence of the fleet council.
Your Zoltan tells them about your mission. The fleet expresses its understanding of the situation and promises to delay the Rebels.
Scaring an entire armada of ships of you, of course, is impossible... An advanced Zoltan ship moves in to assert this fact.
The Zoltans calculate that the attack on your ship may be costly. They are no longer trying to detain you.
The Zoltans decide that losing a few of their ships for one's sake is a bad idea, and they leave you alone. Meanwhile, you find nearby the remains of a Mantis ship and search them.
The Zoltans decide that losing a few of their ships for one's sake is a bad idea, and they leave you alone. Meanwhile, you find nearby the remains of a Rock ship and search them.

destroyed.text: The advanced ship is destroyed. You quickly collect some of its wreckage and prepare to jump while the other ships are far away.

deadCrew.text: You killed off the Zoltan crew, so you quickly collect everything you can find on board, then prepare to jump while the other ships are far away.

event.name: RADAR_REBEL
event.text: According to the onboard computer, the planet to which you appeared next to is an advanced Rebel radar station. You don't dare doing an open attack — the entire fleet which you're trying to hide from will immediately show up.

choice.text: Send a landing capsule with a crew member inside to the station.
Don't attract their attention. Disable all active systems except the FTL Drive and prepare to jump away.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.
(Advanced Teleporter) Teleport the contents of a random room on the station onto your ship.

event.name: RADAR_REBEL_SELECT_THE_HERO
event.text: The exact layout of the radar station is unknown, and there may be well-armed personnel inside.

choice.text: (Order Human Crew Member) Send your человека.
(слаг в панцире Crew Member) Send your слага в панцире.

event.text: The radar station couldn't pinpoint your ship's location.
The radar station couldn't pinpoint your ship's location.
The radar station couldn't pinpoint your ship's location.
A moment before you jump you register the Rebels transmitting your coordinates to the Fleet.
A moment before you jump you register the Rebels transmitting your coordinates to the Fleet.
You register the Rebels transmitting your coordinates to the Fleet, and one of their ships from the next beacon over jumps straight to you!
Surprisingly, you guessed the coordinates of one of their equipment depots.

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: The amount of furniture and clothes lockers in your teleporter have significantly increased.

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: There's a crowd of surprised Rebels in your teleporter. Oh, how awkward this must be...

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's remaining personnel discover the loss of crew.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: A frightened person appears in the teleporter. They say that they worked at the station as a janitor, and that they disliked their work very much, so they'll be happy to join you.

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: A frightened person appears in the teleporter. They say that they worked at the station as a dispatcher, and remember the whole map of the sector by heart. They're ready to serve you, if you don't kill them.

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: Rebel stocks of provisions appear in your teleporter. Hunger no longer threatens your crew.

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: A mountain of computer equipment and supplies appear in your teleporter.

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: It looks like you were lucky enough to stumble upon an ammunition depot.

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: It looks like you were lucky enough to stumble across a drone parts depot.

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: It looks like the room you chose was a fuel depot. But something's wrong — you captured the fuel directly in liquid form. It floods the entire teleporter bay, flowing into electrical wiring — before you know it a huge fire breaks out!

choice.text: Fly away before the radar station's staff realize what happened.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.name: RADAR_REBEL_RETURN
event.text: We've got to leave this place before the entire Rebel fleet shows up.

choice.text: Prepare the engines for a jump.
(Cloaking) Cloak your ship and prepare to jump away.

event.text: Your Human secretly makes their way into the analytical center and sends the fleet false coordinates of your location. This will delay them.
Your Human secretly downloads a sector map and comes back.
Your Human finds a warehouse containing a weapon, but can't carry it back.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Place a teleporter beacon and send a signal back to the ship.

event.text: Your agent appears in the ship's teleporter with the new weapon.
Your Human finds an equipment depot, picks up the cargo and quietly returns.
Your Human finds an equipment depot, picks up the cargo and quietly returns.
Your Human finds an equipment depot, but can't take any of its stuff without being seen.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Place a teleporter beacon and send a signal back to the ship.

event.text: Your agent appears in the ship's teleporter with a bunch of materials.
Your crew member was discovered and imprisoned by guards!
There's nothing you can do, you'll just have to leave them.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Teleport them back to the ship and fly away.

event.text: Your Human disguises themselves as a Rebel, but puts the uniform on backwards. They're noticed by a guard and apprehended!
There's nothing you can do, you'll just have to leave them.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Teleport them back to the ship and fly away.

event.text: Человек скрытно пробирается в аналитический центр и отправляет флоту ложные координаты вашего расположения. Это их задержит.
Человек скрытно скачивает карту сектора и возвращается обратно.
Человек находит склад с оружием, но незаметно вынести ничего не может.

choice.text: Вернуться на корабль с пустыми руками.
(Телепортер) Подцепить телепортационный маячок и подать сигнал на корабль.

event.text: Ваш агент появляется в телепортере корабля с новым орудием.
Человек находит склад с оборудованием, забирает груз и незаметно возвращается.
Человек находит склад с оборудованием, забирает груз и незаметно возвращается.
Человек находит склад с оборудованием, но незаметно вынести его не сможет.

choice.text: Вернуться на корабль с пустыми руками.
(Телепортер) Подцепить телепортационный маячок и подать сигнал на корабль.

event.text: Ваш агент появляется в телепортере корабля с кучей материалов.
Вашего члена экипажа обнаружила и связала охрана!
Ничего не поделаешь, придётся его оставить.

choice.text: (Телепортер) Вернуть его на корабль и улететь.

event.text: Человек переодевается в форму повстанцев, но надевает её задом наперёд. Это замечают, и охрана его связывает!
Ничего не поделаешь, придётся его оставить.

choice.text: (Телепортер) Вернуть его на корабль и улететь.

event.text: Your Engi secretly makes their way to the analytical center and sends the fleet false coordinates of your location. This will delay them.
Your Engi secretly downloads the sector map and comes back.
Your Engi finds a warehouse with a weapon, but can't carry it back.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Place a teleporter beacon and send a signal back to the ship.

event.text: Your agent appears in the ship's teleporter with the new weapon.
Your Engi finds a warehouse with a drone schematic, takes it with them and quietly returns.
Your Engi finds a warehouse with a drone schematic, takes it with them and quietly returns.
Your Engi finds a warehouse with a drone schematic, but can't take it out quietly.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Place a teleporter beacon and send a signal back to the ship.

event.text: Your agent appears in the teleporter with a brand new drone.
Your Engi tries to connect themselves to a terminal, but picks up a tracker virus from the system and gets caught by the Rebels.
There's nothing you can do, you'll just have to leave them.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Teleport them back to the ship and fly away.

event.text: Your Engi quietly makes their way to a warehouse but accidentally trips a security alarm and gets caught by guards.
There's nothing you can do, you'll just have to leave them.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Teleport them back to the ship and fly away.

event.text: Морф скрытно пробирается в аналитический центр и отправляет флоту ложные координаты вашего расположения. Это их задержит.
Морф скрытно скачивает карту сектора и возвращается обратно.
Морф находит склад с оружием, но незаметно вынести ничего не может.

choice.text: Вернуться на корабль с пустыми руками.
(Телепортер) Подцепить телепортационный маячок и подать сигнал на корабль.

event.text: Ваш агент появляется в телепортере корабля с новым орудием.
Морф находит склад с дронами, забирает груз и незаметно возвращается.
Морф находит склад с дронами, забирает груз и незаметно возвращается.
Морф находит склад с дронами, но незаметно вынести их не может.

choice.text: Вернуться на корабль с пустыми руками.
(Телепортер) Подцепить телепортационный маячок и подать сигнал на корабль.

event.text: Ваш агент появляется в телепортере с новеньким дроном.
Морф пытается подключиться к терминалу, но подхватывает вирус из системы повстанцев и зависает.
Ничего не поделаешь, придётся его оставить.

choice.text: (Телепортер) Вернуть его на корабль и улететь.

event.text: Морф, тихо пробираясь к складам, случайно задевает лучи охранной сигнализации, и его ловит охрана.
Ничего не поделаешь, придётся его оставить.

choice.text: (Телепортер) Вернуть его на корабль и улететь.

event.text: Your Zoltan secretly makes their way to the analytical center and sends the fleet false coordinates of your location. This will delay them.
Your Zoltan secretly downloads the sector map and comes back.
Your Zoltan finds a warehouse with a weapon, but can't take it out quietly.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Place a teleporter beacon and send a signal back to the ship.

event.text: Your agent appears in the ship's teleporter with the new weapon.
Your Zoltan finds a cell with a prisoner and returns with them on board.
Your Zoltan finds a cell with a prisoner and returns with them on board.
Your Zoltan finds a cell with a prisoner and releases them.

choice.text: The landing capsule only has enough space for one occupant...

event.text: The prisoner understands and thanks you before running off...

choice.text: (Teleporter) Return both of them back to the ship.

event.text: Your agent appears in the teleporter with a new crew member.
Your Zoltan's aura shines too brightly and gets noticed by guards.
There's nothing you can do, you'll just have to leave them.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Teleport them back to the ship and fly away.

event.text: Your Zoltan's aura accidentally causes a power fluctuation in a nearby generator. An alarm's raised, and they're caught within seconds.
There's nothing you can do, you'll just have to leave them.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Teleport them back to the ship and fly away.

event.text: Золтонец скрытно пробирается в аналитический центр и отправляет флоту ложные координаты вашего расположения. Это их задержит.
Золтонец скрытно скачивает карту сектора и возвращается обратно.
