[000000]-[Request received. Sending the coordinates]-[Critical error]. The device exploded right in the hands of your crew member!
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the Clonebay can resurrect your crew-member.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

textList.name: RETRANSLATOR_EMPTY
textList.text: Empty beacon. Apparently, the relay did not work as intended.

event.text: Near the beacon is a closed container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside is a kit that repairs some hull.
Near the beacon you find a tank of fuel with pirate insignia.
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside are missiles.
Near the beacon you find a tank of fuel with pirate insignia.
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside are drone parts.
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside are missiles.
At the beacon is a pirate ship waiting to ambush you!
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — nothing inside. Is this a joke?
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — nothing inside. Is this a joke?
Near the beacon is a closed container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside is a kit that repairs some hull.
Near the beacon you find a container filled with valuable scrap.
Near the beacon you find a tank of fuel with pirate insignia.
Near the beacon is a closed container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside is a kit that repairs some hull.
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside are drone parts.

You find a container labeled with pirate insignia at this beacon. You deliver it back on board and give the order to open it. Suddenly a terrible explosion rocks the ship — the container was booby-trapped!
Near the beacon is a closed container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside is a kit that repairs some hull.
Near the beacon you find a container filled with valuable scrap.
You find a container with a heap of supplies inside. You are surprised that the pirates did not rig it with some dirty trick.
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. Inside it are useful materials.
Near the beacon you find a tank of fuel with pirate insignia.
Holy crap! A container with a weapon is just drifting in space!
Near the beacon you see an uncovered pirate ship and a civilian ship enters communications: "Do you want to buy a brand new weapon?"
The civilian ship notices your hostility.

choice.text: Great price! We will take one.

event.text: Civilians are shipping weapons; their captain with a satisfied smile lights up a cigar.

choice.text: No thanks. We have other objectives.

event.text: "It is a shame, because you will not find this product cheaper elsewhere.

escape.text: You catch the transmission: "I think they know something, get out of here!"

gotaway.text: The civilian ship jumps away, leaving you empty-handed.

destroyed.text: The ship falls apart, and you collect the scrap. The weapon that the civilians were selling is now hopelessly broken.

deadCrew.text: The ship is captured, and you clear out its hold.

event.text: At the beacon a pirate is waiting for you in ambush and a nearby planet opens fire!
Near the beacon is a sealed container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside is a laser weapon.
Yeah, baby, it's a vulcan! You mentally thank the pirates and pick up the gift they left for you.
Near the beacon, you see an opened pirate container and a civilian vessel that hails you: "Would you like to buy a brand new weapon?"
The civilian ship notices your hostility.
The civilians dump the goods into your hold, and their captain lights up a cigar with a satisfied smile.

choice.text: No thanks. We have other things to do.

event.text: "In vain; you will not find this product cheaper anywhere else."

escape.text: You intercept a transmission: "...I think they understand everything, get out of here!"

gotaway.text: The civilian ship jumps away, leaving you empty-handed.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you scrap its remains. The weapon that the civilians wanted to sell to you is hopelessly broken.

deadCrew.text: With the ship captured, you take what's rightfully yours.

event.text: Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside are missiles.
You find a container with a heap of materials inside. You are surprised that the pirates did not rig it with some dirty trick.
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside are drone parts.
At the beacon a pirate is waiting for you in ambush and a nearby planet opens fire!
Near the beacon you find a container filled with valuable scrap.
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside are drone parts.
At the beacon hangs an escape pod. Inside is a human who says that pirates dismantled their ship to pieces, and that they barely managed to escape in a capsule. You take them into your crew.
The relay brings you here, and you are suprised to find a hull repair burst left by someone near the beacon.
Near the beacon you find a container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — inside are missiles.
Near the beacon you find a sealed container with pirate insignia. A crewman reveals it — a working drone.
Near the beacon hangs an escape pod. It is damaged as its locking mechanism is jammed. Perhaps someone can help you open it.
Near the beacon you find a container filled with valuable scrap.
At the beacon a pirate is waiting for you in ambush and a nearby planet opens fire!
At the beacon a pirate is waiting for you in ambush and a nearby planet opens fire!
Upon arrival, you are contacted by a hidden pirate station. "We have received your signal — dock now before anybody spots us." They refill your fuel tanks for free in the back of their store.
The signal relay brings you to this beacon. Here you find a container in which there are a little supplies and an augmentation for your ship.
At the beacon a pirate is waiting for you in ambush and a nearby planet opens fire!

event.name: CRYSTAL_DREDNOUT_PROTOTYPE
event.text: In orbit of the planet, near to which the beacon's located, is a Crystal Dreadnought. The huge ship looks impressive, and its unidentified weapons hint that it isn't worth joking around with the Crystals. They immediately establish communications with you: "What is your technically outdated vessel doing in our sector?"

choice.text: Don't answer the question and fly away as soon as possible.

event.text: The Dreadnought fires a volley in your direction and punches a huge hole in the engines!

choice.text: Tell them about your mission and ask for help.
Show them just how "outdated" your ship is! Attack!

event.text: The Dreadnought's captain instantly reacts to your actions.
Your weapons haven't even fully protruded when the first volley of the Dreadnought's weapons flies into your side. Do they have a pre-igniter?!
"So you're the one that brought hostile ships into our sector! You have violated our age-old peaceful existence and will be destroyed for this!"
The Crystals treat the situation with understanding and send you a useful amount of scrap. In addition, they give you a map of their sector so that you can quickly reach your destination.

destroyed.text: The Dreadnought breaks apart, and you collect its wreckage. Among its debris you notice a weapon that survived the battle.

deadCrew.text: The Crystal Dreadnought's crew is dead, allowing you to clear it of useful materials. One of its weapons still function, so you bring it aboard.

textList.name: DEPRESSER_TEXT_LOL
textList.text: Nearby is a hostile Slug ship, and all your ship's equipment suddenly starts to go haywire. On board their ship you see a huge disrupter dish — it must the source of the interference. And your crew seems to be going crazy — they're hearing sounds that shouldn't be there! A crewman complains of hallucinations and asks to release everyone from this ship.

Nearby is a hostile Slug ship, and all your ship's equipment suddenly starts to go haywire. On board their ship you see a huge disrupter dish — it must the source of the interference. And your crew seems to be going crazy — they're hearing sounds that shouldn't be there! A crewman says that it's stuffy and asks to open ship's doors.

Nearby is a hostile Slug ship, and all your ship's equipment suddenly starts to go haywire. On board their ship you see a huge disrupter dish — it must the source of the interference. And your crew seems to be going crazy — they're hearing sounds that shouldn't be there! A crewman starts beating their head, trying to pass through the wall between the rooms.

Nearby is a hostile Slug ship, and all your ship's equipment suddenly starts to go haywire. On board their ship you see a huge disrupter dish — it must the source of the interference. And your crew seems to be going crazy — they're hearing sounds that shouldn't be there! A crewman nervously walks around the compartment, muttering something unintelligible and wiping foam at their mouth.

Nearby is a hostile Slug ship, and all your ship's equipment suddenly starts to go haywire. On board their ship you see a huge disrupter dish — it must the source of the interference. And your crew seems to be going crazy — they're hearing sounds that shouldn't be there! A crewman closes themselves in the cargo hold with the request not to bother anyone anymore today.

Nearby is a hostile Slug ship, and all your ship's equipment suddenly starts to go haywire. On board their ship you see a huge disrupter dish — it must the source of the interference. And your crew seems to be going crazy — they're hearing sounds that shouldn't be there! A crewman announces to everyone that they're going on vacation and spreads out a mattress in their room.

event.text: You divert the last remnants of power to the engines, and they remain operational.
The Slugs are charging up their weapons, and you are also getting ready to fight.

choice.text: (Defense Scrambler) Use your defense scrambler to disable their system disrupter.

event.text: The Slugs didn't expect that their disrupter dish wouldn't work, but nevertheless go on the attack.

choice.text: (Hacking) Restore the operation of one of your systems before the battle.

event.text: Which system to restore?
Hacking fully restores the ship's reactor.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Which system to restore?
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Which system to restore?
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking will function at full power.

choice.text: (Sensors) Restore the operation of the sensors.

event.text: Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
Hacking restores the selected system.
You decide against using your Hacking system's capabilities. A crewman silently moves their hand over their face.

destroyed.text: The ship collapses, and you take away a surviving part of the suppression device — the defense scrambler, and also some supplies. Meanwhile, your systems return back to normal.

deadCrew.text: With all the Slugs killed off, you clean out their hold and turn off the disruptor dish. You can't completely remove the suppression device, however, you take one of its constituent parts — the defense scrambler.

event.name: PIRATE_STATION_ASTEROID
event.text: In the middle of an asteroid field, you notice a pirate station, but they haven't yet detected you.

choice.text: Get in touch with the pirates.

event.text: The pirate station raises an alert and gets ready to defend. You are surprised to see their unusual weapons.

choice.text: Hide behind the nearest asteroid and charge the FTL Drive.

event.text: The pirates didn't even notice you were ever there.

choice.text: (Human Crew Member) Your subordinate seems to recognize this station.

event.text: You contact the station. Your human was once a pirate, and this station was their home. In memory of the old days, the pirates send you a small gift and let you browse their wares. [Do not close the store window, it will not open again]

choice.text: (Order Human Crew Member) Your subordinate seems to recognize this station.

event.text: You contact the station. Your human was once a pirate, and this station was their home. In memory of the old days, the pirates send you a small gift and let you browse their wares. [Do not close the store window, it will not open again]

As soon as you open communications, the pirates intercept you and begin charging their weapons, reminiscent of... You don't have time to think about it — an asteroid fragment flies dangerously close to your ship's hull!

As soon as you open communications, the pirates intercept you and begin charging their weapons, reminiscent of... You don't have time to think about it — an asteroid chip blows a hole in your ship's hull!

As soon as you open communications, the pirates intercept you and begin charging their weapons, reminiscent of... You don't have time to think about it — an asteroid chip blows a hole in your ship's hull!
You contact the station. Unexpectedly, it turns out that someone on your crew is a former pirate! In memory of the old days, the pirates send you a small gift and let you browse their wares.
You contact the station. Unexpectedly, it turns out that someone on your crew is a former pirate! In memory of the old days, the pirates send you a small gift and let you browse their wares.
You contact the station. Unexpectedly, it turns out that someone on your crew is a former pirate! In memory of the old days, the pirates send you a small gift and let you browse their wares.

destroyed.text: The station breaks apart, and you collect its fragments. None of the strange pirate weapons survived.

deadCrew.text: With the station's crew killed, you search their ship. Unfortunately, all of the weapons installed on board are too worn out to transfer.

event.name: RUHLAD
event.text: On your way, you come across a junk ship that offers you, for a small fee, to dig into a pile of old laser guns in its hold. It's possible that this could give you something useful.

choice.text: Agree that sometimes even in a pile of trash you can find interesting things!

event.text: The junk dealer takes your scrap and directs you to his hold.

choice.text: We don't have excess scrap, nor desire to delve into this pile of garbage — get out of here!

event.text: After breaking the huge pile of broken equipment, you are still unable to find a single working weapon. It's time to get out of here. You grab a bigger gun and break it down for scrap.
After breaking the huge pile of broken equipment, you are still unable to find a single working weapon. It's time to get out of here. You grab a bigger gun and break it down for scrap.
After breaking the huge pile of broken equipment, you are still unable to find a single working weapon. It's time to get out of here. You grab a bigger gun and break it down for scrap.

event.name: RUHLAD_BUY_RUHLAD
event.text: From all this mountain of junk you manage to find one good weapon which you take with you as you leave.

event.name: RUHLAD_BUY_DVA
event.text: After digging into the pile of trash, you find two good weapons. Pick only one.
You pick up your weapon and prepare to depart.
You pick up your weapon and prepare to depart.

event.name: RUHLAD_BUY_WIN
event.text: Luck is on your side today! You find an excellent copy of a laser weapon and you bring it aboard the ship.

event.name: ENGI_STATION_MEDCLONE
event.text: You see an Engi station being attacked by pirates. Having seen your ship, they send you a message: "Don't approach unless you want problems."
The pirates change their course and try to get behind you, while the station helplessly patches their holes.
The pirate ship pretty quickly deals with the station. Meanwhile, you prepare to fly away.

escape.text: The pirates are charging their FTL engines.

gotaway.text: The pirates fly away in an unknown direction. Meanwhile, the Engi station opens a channel: "Gratitude for saving Engi: great. Replacement of clonebay with medbay or vice versa, possible. Consent?"

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

destroyed.text: The pirates are destroyed. Meanwhile, the Engi station opens a channel: "Gratitude for saving Engi: great. Replacement of clonebay with medbay or vice versa, possible. Consent?"

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

deadCrew.text: The pirates are dead. Meanwhile, the Engi station opens a channel: "Gratitude for saving Engi: great. Replacement of clonebay with medbay or vice versa, possible. Consent?"

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Medbay) Replace the medbay with a clonebay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Replace the clonebay with a medbay.

event.text: The Engi quickly install the replacement system and then resume station repairs.
One of their masters wished to remain on your ship as a crew member.

event.name: WHERE_IS_MY_ENGINES_DUDE
event.text: As soon as your jump ends, you find an automated rebel drone rushing towards you at full speed. The distance between their ship and yours is too small — a collision is imminent!

choice.text: (Engines) Apply full power to the engines to break away.
(Improved Engines) Apply full power to the engines to break away.
(Advanced Engines) Apply full power to the engines to break away.
(Weapon Pre-Igniter) Sharply turn around and open fire.

event.text: You give full power to the engines, and leave the drone behind you.
You prepare to strike back.
You decide that now is not the best time for a battle.
You give full power to the engines, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
You give full power to the engines, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
You give full power to the engines, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
You give full power to the engines, and leave the drone behind you.
You prepare to strike back.
You decide that now is not the best time for a battle.
You give full power to the engines, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
You give full power to the engines, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
You give full power to the engines, and leave the drone behind you.
You prepare to strike back.
You decide that now is not the best time for a battle.
You give full power to the engines, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
Your pilot makes a sharp jerk to the side, and with a great speed the drone flies forward into the emptiness of the cosmos. After a few moments, it's already turning around to attack.
Your pilot makes a sharp jerk to the side, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
Your pilot makes a sharp jerk to the side, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
Your pilot makes a sharp jerk to the side, and with a great speed the drone flies forward into the emptiness of the cosmos. After a few moments, it's already turning around to attack.
Your pilot makes a sharp jerk to the side, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!
Your pilot makes a sharp turn of the ship, and a volley from your weapons knocks down the drone. You collect what's left of it.
Your pilot makes a sharp turn of the ship, but suddenly there is a rumble, and the drone clings to your engines, every second gnawing at them more and more!

event.name: WHAT_CAN_I_DO
event.text: While the drone gnaws through your engines, you quickly decide what to do about it.

choice.text: Detonate missiles in the engines room.

event.text: The explosion rips apart the drone. Incidentally, the engines suffered little damage.
You collect the scattered wreckage around the ship.

choice.text: Ignite fuel in the engines room.

event.text: The explosion rips apart the drone. Incidentally, the engines suffered little damage.
You collect scattered wreckage around the ship.

choice.text: Wait until the drone finishes its program, and then restore the engines.

event.text: The drone eats through your engines and then explodes. You gather its wreckage.
The drone eats through your engines and then explodes. You gather its wreckage.
The drone eats through your engines and then explodes. You gather its wreckage.

event.name: ZOLTAN_ARTILLERY_MEETING
event.text: This beacon is patrolled by one of the Zoltan artillery support ships. They ask you for your permit, but take the charging of your weapons as a negative answer.

destroyed.text: After inspecting the ship's remains, you collect everything of value you manage to find.

deadCrew.text: After inspecting the ship's holds, you collect everything of value you manage to find.

event.text: You manage to find a surviving beam weapon! What luck!

event.name: AUTO_ORDER
event.text: You nearly meet with an unusual Rebel drone: its wings follow the contours of the shield surrounding the ship. Looks like they add extra power to the shield system.

destroyed.text: You collect everything of value that remains, and are surprised to find that one of the wings of the destroyed drone can be used to improve your shield system.

deadCrew.text: You collect everything of value that remains, and are surprised to find that one of the wings of the destroyed drone can be used to improve your shield system.

event.name: REBEL_FRIENDLY_CARGO
event.text: Arriving at the beacon, you notice a small Rebel freighter flying from the surface of the nearby planet towards you. Its captain claims they stole this "tub" to help the Federation and give you stolen resources. Meanwhile, the planet's opened fire — on both ships!

choice.text: Attack them before they can get close.
Quickly charge up the engines and fly away from here.

event.text: You start charging up the engines, but an ASB shell from the planet slams into you!
You manage to charge up the FTL Drive before the situation gets out of control.
You start charging your weapons, and, seeing this, the cargo ship does the same. The Rebels can't be trusted...
The cargo ship quickly drops a couple of containers beside you and plots a course to a long-range beacon.
While approaching you, the ship fires a volley directly towards your engines! Meanwhile, its captain laughs through the communicator, marveling at your naivety.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you quickly collect some wreckage.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off the freighter's crew, you clean out their holds.

event.name: SLUG_VS_LANIUS_FOTON
event.text: A Slug ship hails you. They claim that they scanned a Lanius ship nearby and spotted a curious weapon on board. The Slugs offer you its coordinates, if you share the captured loot.
"Thankssss, you will not regret your decision."
Everyone has known for a long time that it's pointless to negotiate with Slugs. You prepare to attack.

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Destroy the Slugs and then read the data from their navigation system.

event.text: You should leave their ship intact in order to find out information about the location of that Lanius ship.
The Slugs decide that your ship can be sold for a profitable sum of scrap, and fire a volley at you. Looks like fighting can't be avoided.
The Slugs inform you that you just made "an economically unprofitable decision" and go on the attack.
The Slugs break off the connection; meanwhile you prepare to jump.
The Slugs break off the connection; meanwhile you prepare to jump.

event.name: SLUG_VS_LANIUS_FOTON_QUEST_1
event.text: Arriving at the coordinates indicated by the Slugs, you find the target — the Lanius ship, clearly angered and ready to rush at anything that contains metal.

escape.text: Looks like they don't want to fight anymore and are trying to escape.

gotaway.text: The Slugs jumped away in an unknown direction.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly collect its wreckage.

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Search for reconnaissance data in their logbook.

event.text: You overdid it a bit and completely destroyed the logbook during the fight. It was necessary to leave their ship whole...

deadCrew.text: Having killed off the crew, you quickly clean out their holds.

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Search their ship's log for information about the scans of the Lanius ship.

event.text: Your advanced FTL navigation system reads it and records the coordinates on your map.

destroyed.text: Right when the ship breaks apart, the Slugs immediately arrive. They offer to draw matches to determine which of you gets to choose between picking up the surviving weapon or collecting the ship's wreckage.

deadCrew.text: As soon as you've killed the last of the crew, the Slugs immediately arrive. You offer to flip a coin to determine which of you gets to choose between picking up the surviving weapon or collecting the ship's wreckage.

event.text: You guessed right, so you get to choose.
You bring the weapon into your hold.
You collect all the scrap.
You guessed right, so you get to choose.
You bring the weapon into your hold.
You collect all the scrap.
You didn't guess correctly, and the Slugs grab the weapon, leaving you with the scrap.
You didn't guess correctly, and the Slugs grab the scrap, leaving you with the weapon.
You guessed right, so you get to choose.
You bring the weapon into your hold.
You collect all the scrap.
You guessed right, so you get to choose.
You bring the weapon into your hold.
You collect all the scrap.
You didn't guess correctly, and the Slugs grab the weapon, leaving you with the scrap.
You didn't guess correctly, and the Slugs grab the scrap, leaving you with the weapon.

event.name: SLUG_VS_LANIUS_FOTON_QUEST_2
event.text: Arriving at the right coordinates, you find the target — the Lanius ship, clearly angered and ready to rush at anything that contains metal.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and among the wreckage you find a surviving ancient Lanius weapon.

deadCrew.text: All the Lanius are dead, and you find a surviving ancient Lanius weapon in their hold.

event.name: REBEL_WITH_SCANNERS
event.text: Some distance away from the beacon lies a Rebel freighter. It looks very strange, but it seems they have an extra room off their starboard side! You're not yet in range of their radar.

destroyed.text: The Rebel ship scatters into pieces, and you collect all that looks useful from the battlefield.

deadCrew.text: The Rebel crew's dead, and you inspect their ship for useful materials.

event.text: In the additional room, you find equipment that can improve a sensors subsystem. Unfortunately, you don't have that subsystem...
In the additional room, you find equipment that can improve your sensors subsystem.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_STEAL_PIRATE_EVENT
event.text: Before you are two ships docked together — Slugs and pirates. The Slugs have hypnotized the pirates and are carrying containers from their ship to their own. When they finish loading, the hail: "You didn't see anything... Take this and fly away from here."

choice.text: Accept their bribe to look the other way.

event.text: You take the bribe and move on. Helping pirates isn't in our rules.
The Slugs notice your aggression and quickly undock from the pirates.

escape.text: They immediately start charging the FTL Drive.

gotaway.text: The Slugs jumped away in an unknown direction. The waking pirates thank you and set a meeting at some specified coordinates.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly collect its wreckage. The waking pirates thank you and set a meeting at some specified coordinates.

deadCrew.text: You kill off the last of their crew and quickly clean out the ship's holds. The waking pirates thank you and set a meeting at some specified coordinates.

event.text: Near the beacon you meet the very same pirate you saved from the Slugs. They give you supplies they "extracted" from someone.
Near the beacon you meet the very same pirate you saved from the Slugs. They transfer over a weapon that they "obtained".
Near the beacon you meet the very same pirate you saved from the Slugs. They apologize that they couldn't find anything for you...
Near the beacon you meet the very same pirate you saved from the Slugs. They give you a slave that they "obtained". Perhaps you shouldn't ask where they got them from...
Near the beacon you meet that pirate again, and they give you some equipment to upgrade your ship's engines.
You arrive at the coordinates of the pirate you rescued, but there's absolutely no one here...

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly collect its wreckage.

deadCrew.text: You kill off the last of their crew and quickly clean out the ship's holds.

event.name: SHIPS_MANTIS_PRO_FIGHTSTATION_EVENT
event.text: At the edge of your vision, you notice a drifting Mantis station. They must have poor long-range sensors as you still remain unnoticed.
The Mantis hail you.

choice.text: Attack them now when they least expect it.

event.text: The Mantis don't have time to put together an assault boarding party, but try to defend themselves nonetheless.
The Mantis, seeing your crew on the communicator, decide to attack with all their strength.

The Mantis greet their kinsman on your ship. At this station, fights among Mantis are to the death. Your Mantis can participate and win a valuable prize, but for this they need to defeat 5 other Mantis in the "every man for himself" fight.

choice.text: Agree and risk the life of your fighter.
Out of courtesy, go to the arena as a spectator but don't risk your Mantis's life.
Try to steal from the stupid insects.
Refuse to have your Mantis participate.

event.text: The Mantis call you weaklings and you're kicked out.

choice.text: Just charge the engines and fly away.

event.text: Your Mantis cuts off one of the opponents' heads, but suddenly someone pushes them under a metal press.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, a clone of your Mantis is ready.

event.text: Your Mantis kills opponents one after the other, but the last survivor rudely shoots them in the back of the head with a blaster.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, a clone of your Mantis is ready.

event.text: Your Mantis mercilessly kills two opponents, but, after receiving a fatal wound, dies of blood loss.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, a clone of your Mantis is ready.

event.text: Your Mantis kills three opponents, but the two remaining ones conspire together and tear your Mantis into pieces.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, a clone of your Mantis is ready.

event.text: Your Mantis dies first in this deadly battle; they were too young and weak...

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, a clone of your Mantis is ready.

event.text: Your Mantis deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You collect the reward, and your Mantis raves in delight.
Also, your fighter is given a symbolic gift in the form of a "useless" drone.
Your Mantis deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You collect the reward, and your Mantis raves in delight.
Also, your fighter is given a symbolic gift in the form of a "useless" drone.
Your Mantis deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You collect the reward, and your Mantis raves in delight.
Also, your fighter is given a symbolic gift in the form of a "useless" drone.
The Mantis are so interested in the competition that they don't notice how you clean out their prize pool and fly away.
The guards notice your attempt, and a mob of maddened Mantis chase you onto the ship, and the station targets its weapons at you.
The guards notice your attempt, and some maddened Mantis chase you onto the ship, and the station targets its weapons at you.

event.name: SHIPS_MANTIS_PRO_FIGHTSTATION_STAVKA
event.text: You are offered to bet on one of the fighters.
You place the bet.
You place the bet.
You place the bet.
The Mantis are famous for their mastery at killing, and you enjoy the spectacle. And when only one remains alive, the audience cheers — a new champion has been determined.
The Mantis you bet on cuts off one of the opponents' heads, but suddenly someone pushes them under a metal press.
The Mantis you bet on kills their opponents one after the other, but the last survivor rudely shoots them in the back of the head with a blaster.
The Mantis you bet on mercilessly kills two opponents, but, after receiving a fatal wound, dies of blood loss.
The Mantis you bet on kills three opponents, but the two remaining ones conspire together and tear your Mantis into pieces.
The Mantis you bet on dies first in this deadly battle; they were too young and weak...
The Mantis you bet on deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You win the bet, and the Mantis raves in delight.
The Mantis you bet on deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You win the bet, and the Mantis raves in delight.
The Mantis you bet on deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You win the bet, and the Mantis raves in delight.

The Mantis you bet on deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You win the bet, and the Mantis raves in delight.
The Mantis you bet on deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You win the bet, and the Mantis raves in delight.
The Mantis you bet on deftly cuts down all the opponents one after the other and wins. You win the bet, and the Mantis raves in delight.

destroyed.text: The Mantis station breaks apart, and you collect its wreckage.

deadCrew.text: You killed off the crew of the Mantis station, free to collect everything of use from it.

event.text: In one of the Mantis station's prison cells, you find a prisoner who is happy to serve you.

event.name: MANTIS_QUEST_HUNT_ENGI_EVENT
event.text: A Mantis ship hangs around beside you. They're clearly scanning your ship...
The Mantis say that they urgently need Engi slaves to repair their flotilla. If you can grab a few for them, then you'll receive a reward.
The Mantis quickly give you the target's coordinates.

choice.text: The Engi have always helped the Federation — attack the vile Mantis!

event.text: They shut off their comms and are about to board you.
The Mantis get very excited when they see the Engi on your ship, and soon their intentions become apparent.
The Mantis get ready to defend themselves and aren't going to run away.

choice.text: Just charge up the engines and fly away.

event.text: The Mantis don't show even the slightest bit of interest in your ship.

choice.text: Just charge up the engines and fly away.

event.text: The Mantis get very excited when they see the Engi on your ship, and soon their intentions become apparent.

destroyed.text: The Mantis ship breaks apart, and you collect its wreckage.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead, you're free to collect everything of use from it.

event.name: MANTIS_QUEST_HUNT_ENGI_EVENT_TARGET
event.text: The Engi target is right in front of you. Obviously, you need to capture them alive.
The Engi didn't expect an attack from a Federation vessel, but prepare to defend themselves nonetheless.

choice.text: Inform the Engi that they are being hunted.

event.text: The Engi thank you for the information and give you a large set of drone parts.

destroyed.text: The Engi ship breaks apart, and you collect its wreckage. You didn't manage to capture any Engi prisoners, which means you cannot see the Mantis reward.

deadCrew.text: You defeated the crew so you take everything of use from the ship. You manage to tie up a surviving Engi. Now you need to decide what to do with them.

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Your Slug knows what the Mantis will give you for the prisoner.
(Slug Crew Member) Your Slug knows what the Mantis will give you for the prisoner.

event.text: The Engi unquestioningly enters your crew — the prospect of repairing Mantis ships to the end of their days doesn't sound all that good to them.
The Mantis give you the promised reward.
The Mantis give you the promised reward.
The Mantis give you the promised reward.
The Mantis give you the promised reward.

event.name: NEBULA_DRONEQUEEN_EVENT
event.text: The silhouette of an unusual drone appears from the dust cloud. They don't have any weapons, but a swarm of drones. Oh, it seems to have noticed your presence!

escape.text: Looks like this drone is trying to jump away.

gotaway.text: The drone disappears into the nebula. You manage to collect the remains of its drones.

destroyed.text: The drone breaks apart, and you collect everything of value, including a surviving drone.

deadCrew.text: You defeated the crew of the drone. How the hell is this possible??? Have a drone for that! Looool :D

event.name: ORDEN_STATION_EVENT
event.text: You see how an orbital Order station is burning out the nearby planet with rays. The local people are firing back with their batteries, but could use some help. Meanwhile, the station is deploying its weapons in your direction.

destroyed.text: The Order station breaks apart, and you take away a surviving weapon.

deadCrew.text: You defeated the crew of the station and take away a surviving weapon.

event.text: It looks like the weapon is badly damaged. Well, it's better than nothing...
The weapon wasn't damaged in the battle. Seems that luck is on your side.
The weapon wasn't damaged in the battle. Seems that luck is on your side.

event.name: MANTIS_FED_TRANSPORT_FREON
event.text: A Federation ship located nearby is rapidly approaching you and opening up a hailing frequency...
"...Oh, no, no, it seems we've mistaken you for someone else, nevermind, just continue flying on."

choice.text: (Mantis Crew Member) A Mantis on your crew encourages you to attack, despite the ship belonging to the Federation.

event.text: You decide that you can't neglect the opportunity.
"...We do production here and we urgently need a courier to deliver this container to the base... So will you help us?"
You transfer the container into the hold, and from the Federation ship you receive a message: "Alpha-Gamma-Beta".
After flying some distance away, you believe that you can open the container and take its contents for yourself.

choice.text: Don't open it and deliver the goods to the original recipient.

event.text: You enter the destination's coordinates and prepare to jump.
You transfer the container into the hold, and from the Federation ship you receive a message: "Gamma-Gamma-Alpha".
After flying some distance away, you believe that you can open the container and take its contents for yourself.

choice.text: Don't open it and deliver the goods to the original recipient.

event.text: You enter the destination's coordinates and prepare to jump.
You transfer the container into the hold, and from the Federation ship you receive a message: "Beta-Alpha-Gamma".
After flying some distance away, you believe that you can open the container and take its contents for yourself.

choice.text: Don't open it and deliver the goods to the original recipient.

event.text: You enter the destination's coordinates and prepare to jump.
You transfer the container into the hold, and from the Federation ship you receive a message: "Beta-Alpha-Beta".
After flying some distance away, you believe that you can open the container and take its contents for yourself.

choice.text: Don't open it and deliver the goods to the original recipient.

event.text: You enter the destination's coordinates and prepare to jump.
You transfer the container into the hold, and from the Federation ship you receive a message: "Gamma-Alpha-Beta".
After flying some distance away, you believe that you can open the container and take its contents for yourself.

choice.text: Don't open it and deliver the goods to the original recipient.

event.text: You enter the destination's coordinates and prepare to jump.

escape.text: They immediately begin to prepare to jump away.

gotaway.text: The ship jumped away in an unknown direction.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you collect what's left of it. Also... your equipment records traces of some substance in the debris.

deadCrew.text: You've killed off all the ship's crew and proceed to take everything of use. In the hold, you find a container with a code panel.

event.text: You don't need to take any extra risks, so you prepare to jump after leaving the container in the drifting Federation ship.

choice.text: Let a crew member enter a random code.

event.text: Quite naturally, your crew member enters the wrong code, which triggers a defense mechanism that tightly seals the container. Well, it could be worse...

=Gamma=Gamma=Gamma= - The lock closes tightly since an invalid code was entered. The base owner kicks you out.

event.name: MANTIS_BOSS_FIRST
event.text: You come out of the jump right next to an enormous Mantis ship.
Their captain hails: "I am KaatzplethKhatsky, owner of this sector. I'm very pleased you yourself have come to me. Now your ship will be excellent as my prey. ATTACK!!!"

choice.text: (Mantis Crew Members) Perform a mass welcoming dance of Mantises in front of the vid-screen.

event.text: Their captain hails and appears to be KaatzpletthKhatsky, the owner of this sector. They ask you about your mission and, after having learned everything, give you one of their weapons, and also order several of their ships to delay the Rebels.

escape.text: Your register a very fast energy transfer coming from their ship's FTL Drive.

gotaway.text: Tracking the direction of the jump from such a large vessel is not a problem. You try to decide if it's worth it anyways.

choice.text: Track them while collecting small debris left from the battle.

event.text: While the crew collects debris, you mark the target.

choice.text: Don't pursue them, just collect the debris.

event.text: Your crew collects the debris, and you prepare to jump.

destroyed.text: You inspect the wreckage, and collect everything of value. Among other things, there is an interesting Mantis augmentation.

deadCrew.text: You manage to kill off KaatzplethKhatsky's entire crew, and collect everything of value from their ship. Among other things, there is an interesting Mantis augmentation.

event.name: MANTIS_BOSS_SECOND
event.text: Before you is the very same Mantis ship. It looks like it has rearmed and recovered, now flying out to you from its planet. KaatzplethKhatsky hails: "You managed to hurt us, but now my comrades from the planet will protect me! Prepare to die!"

destroyed.text: You inspect the wreckage, and collect everything of value while under fire from the planetary artillery. Among other things, there is an interesting Mantis augmentation.

deadCrew.text: You manage to kill off KaatzplethKhatsky's entire crew, and collect everything of value from their ship while under fire from the planetary artillery. Among other things, there is an interesting Mantis augmentation.

event.name: MANTIS_X20_ON_ENGI_SHIP
event.text: In front of you is a small Engi craft. They don't respond to your hails, but they don't attack either. It's strange... what are they doing in this dangerous sector?..
In response to your aggression, the ship immediately comes to life...

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) Check for the presence of crew aboard the ship.
(Slug Crew Member) Check for the presence of crew aboard the ship.

event.name: MANTIS_X20_SCAN
event.text: To your surprise, it turns out that the ship is infested with Mantises! Perhaps this time it's better not to approach them.
In response to your aggression, the ship immediately comes to life.

choice.text: Don't risk it, our mission takes top priority.

destroyed.text: You inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: You somehow miraculously manage to kill off the ship's entire crew, and collect everything of value from it.

event.name: DONOR_PONY
event.text: Scanners find signs of life on a nearby planet.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) Refine the location of life on the planet and then go down in the shuttle.

event.text: You ignore the evidence of the scanners and get ready to move on.

You go down to the surface in a small shuttle, but don't find any signs of life. After spending a couple of hours looking for them, you return to the ship. It seems the scanners gave a false alarm. Meanwhile, the Rebel Fleet approaches.
The Lifeform Scanner shows that the planet is completely empty. It seems that it was a false alarm. You give the order to charge the FTL Drive.
You land a small shuttle in an enormous field, whose only occupants are small, brightly colored, six-legged, horse-like animals. Could they be what your scans picked up?

choice.text: Bring some of the creatures on board to sell.

event.text: This isn't the time for exobiology. You head back to the ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) Attempt to communicate telepathically.

event.text: After a moment, your Slug tells you that these are simple beings, who enjoy a peaceful life. However, this isn't the first time a ship has landed here. They inform you of a nearby crash site.

You follow their directions and discover an ancient Engi ship. You find a deactivated Engi inside and reroute power from your shuttle to resuscitate it. After a while it reboots, rebuilds itself, and offers to join your crew.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew Member) Soothe the animals to lure them into the hold for sale.

event.text: Your crew easily herds the six-legged creatures into the hold, thanks to your Orchid's chemical signals. You sell the animals to an exotic restaurant on the nearest planet.

None of your attempts to communicate seem to work: they just stare at you silently. As you prepare to leave, one of the creatures canters forward and forcefully nudges you away from the ship. He seems to want you to follow him. Eventually, they guide you to an old Engi ship's crash site. Inside you are able to find and reactivate an Engi!
You try to communicate in every possible way you can but they just stand there, silently judging you with their large, expressionless eyes. You prepare to leave.

The seemingly docile creatures quickly turn violent when you reveal your hostile intentions. Their well-organized stampede forces you to draw weapons and make a rushed and shambolic retreat to the shuttle.

The seemingly docile creatures quickly turn violent when you show your hostile intentions. They stampede with terrifying force, trampling one of your crew before you have time to react. You fight your way back to the shuttle and prepare to jump.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The trampled crewmate's clone is already ready when you get back to your ship.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

The seemingly docile creatures quickly turn violent when you show your hostile intentions. They stampede with terrifying force, trampling one of your crew before you have time to react. You fight your way back to the shuttle and prepare to jump.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: The trampled crewmate's clone is already ready when you get back to your ship.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
You take a few creatures on board and they don't even try to resist. You manage to exchange them profitably for resources from a merchant near the beacon.
You take a few creatures on board and they don't even try to resist. You manage to exchange them profitably for resources from a merchant near the beacon.
You take a few creatures on board and they don't even try to resist. You manage to exchange them for resources from a merchant near the beacon.
A small shuttle lands on the planet near a bog. Here is a dying man — it looks like he has serious foot gangrene.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Take him to the Medbay.
(Advanced Medbay) Take him to the Medbay.

event.text: Once in the superior Medbay, he gets better. He says that lived quietly in the marshes for many years, until one day he was eaten by a giant frog. He does not want to remember how he got out, but since then he had problems with his leg. You accept this strange man into your crew.

choice.text: We can not help him. Don't touch the infected.

event.text: You can not risk it, your mission is too important. You go back to the ship, leaving him to die.

choice.text: He does not have much time left. Put the poor fellow out of his misery.

event.text: The man begs you not to do this, but a shot in his head breaks off his words. It will be better this way.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Replace his foot with a prosthesis.

event.text: Your Engi skillfully carries out the operation using their internal surgical database.

The man gets better. He says that he lived quietly in the marshes for many years, until one day he was eaten by a giant frog. He does not want to remember how he got out, but since then he had problems with his leg. You accept this strange man into your crew.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Replace his foot with a prosthesis.

event.text: Your Morph skillfully carries out the operation using their internal surgical database.

The man gets better. He says that he lived quietly in the marshes for many years, until one day he was eaten by a giant frog. He does not want to remember how he got out, but since then he had problems with his leg. You accept this strange man into your crew.
You try to cure him, but all in vain. The disease is too advanced, and the poor guy dies.

Once in the superior Medbay, he gets better. He says that lived quietly in the marshes for many years, until one day he was eaten by a giant frog. He does not want to remember how he got out, but since then he had problems with his leg. You accept this strange man into your crew.
You try to cure him, but all in vain. The disease is too advanced, and the poor guy dies.
You try to cure him, but all in vain. The disease is too advanced, and the poor guy dies.
You try to cure him, but all in vain. The disease is too advanced, and the poor guy dies.

The man gets better. He says that lived quietly in the marshes for many years, until one day he was eaten by a giant frog. He does not want to remember how he got out, but since then he had problems with his leg. You accept this strange man into your crew.

event.name: DONOR_PONY_3
event.text: You disembark on the planet near some ancient pyramids. An archaeologist runs up to you and asks if you can help pull his friend out from underneath the rubble inside.

choice.text: Send someone from your crew into the pyramid.

event.text: You don't want to risk the crew and return to the ship.

choice.text: (Anti-Personnel Drone) Send an Anti-Personnel drone into the pyramid.
(Boarding Drone) Send a Boarding drone into the pyramid.
(System Repair Drone) Send a System Repair drone into the pyramid.

event.text: You find the archaeologist unconscious and pull him out of the pyramid. When he wakes up, he joins your crew.
When your crew member gets inside, a severe earthquake begins and fills up the entire pyramid to their death.
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: A clone of your crew member is ready to continue the journey when you return to the ship.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
Your drone finds the archaeologist unconscious and pulls him out of the pyramid. When he wakes up, he joins your crew.
When your drone gets inside, a severe earthquake begins and fills up the entire pyramid. It seems that the archaeologist cannot be helped.
Your drone finds the archaeologist unconscious and pulls him out of the pyramid. When he wakes up, he joins your crew.

Once your drone gets inside, the strongest earthquake erupts, and the drone gets buried under rubble. Fortunately, the repair drone is able to make it out of the blockage and continues the search. Soon after it finds the archaeologist and brings them to you on board.

You go down to the surface of the planet and find there the ruins of a small settlement. A dirty one-legged man crawls out towards you from one of the best preserved buildings. His condition causes great concern, and evidently, he has not had anything to eat for a while.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Bring him to your medbay.
(Advanced Medbay) Bring him to your medbay.

event.text: Fortunately, your advanced medbay promptly brings him to a stable state. You bring him some food, and he tells his story.

choice.text: We cannot help him without medical equipment.

event.text: The poor guy dies right before your eyes.

choice.text: He does not have much time left. Shoot the poor fellow.

event.text: The man begs you not to do this, but a shot in the head breaks off his words. It will be better this way.
Unfortunately, you found him too late for you to be able to do anything for him, so the stranger dies.
Fortunately, your improved medbay promptly brings him to a stable state. You bring him some food, and he tells his story.
Unfortunately, you found him too late for you to be able to do anything for him, so the stranger dies.
Unfortunately, you found him too late for you to be able to do anything for him, so the stranger dies.
Unfortunately, you found him too late for you to be able to do anything for him, so the stranger dies.
Fortunately, your medbay quickly brings him to a stable state. You bring him some food, and he tells his story.

event.name: REWEDS
event.text: He is a settler by the name of Reweds. He and other colonists crashed on this planet and were forced for several years to build a spaceship to leave this place. Unfortunately, the new ship could not accommodate all the survivors, so two people had to be left on the planet. One of them was footless Reweds, and the second, Abaddon, not wanting to languish, ended his life in an unequal battle with the local predatory life forms.

choice.text: You take Reweds to the nearest station. Without a foot, he cannot help us.

event.text: All throughout the journey he scatters gratitude for his salvation. You are pretty tired of him, and you disembark him with pleasure on the first manned station.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Make him a metal prosthesis.

event.text: Your Engi skillfully carries out the operation using their internal surgical database.
In gratitude, the man joins your crew.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Make him a metal prosthesis.

event.text: Your Morph skillfully carries out the operation using their internal surgical database.
In gratitude, the man joins your crew.

event.name: DONOR_PONY_5
event.text: You descend to the surface of the planet and find a man there near a huge glacier. The man says that for many years after arriving on this planet he worked as a fauna researcher, and when he finished work and returned to the ship, he found it frozen in a glacier...

choice.text: Open fire on the glacier to extract the ship.
Open fire on the glacier to extract the ship.
Open fire on the glacier to extract the ship.
(Fire Beam) Melt the glacier with your fire beam.

event.text: You turn the beam on full power and it melts the glacier, releasing the ship. The man in gratitude gives you everything of value that was stored on his ship, except for a couple of fuel cells for the road.

choice.text: Persuade him to join your crew.
Don't interfere in this matter. Fly away from the planet.

event.text: You explain to the researcher the predicament the Federation finds itself in, and with that he joins your crew, deciding that he will finish his research later.
You explain to the researcher the predicament the Federation finds itself in. However, he is devoted to his work and, not wanting to leave his ship, remains on the planet.

You explain to the researcher the predicament the Federation finds itself in. After carefully listening to you, he refuses to join the crew, but gives you a couple of cans of pate and wishes you good luck in the mission of saving the entire quadrant.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The researcher, realizing that he will otherwise not get out of here, asks to join your crew.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The disappointed researcher walks away.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The disappointed researcher walks away.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The disappointed researcher walks away.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but accidentally damage the ship's reactor. A terrible explosion occurs, scattering debris everywhere. The researcher walks away cursing you. After collecting anything and everything that survived the explosion, you leave the planet.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry and, melting the glacier, release the ship. The researcher gratefully gives you everything that was stored on his ship, except for a couple of fuel cells for the road.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The researcher, realizing that he will otherwise not get out of here, asks to join your crew.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The disappointed researcher walks away.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The disappointed researcher walks away.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but accidentally damage the ship's reactor. A terrible explosion occurs, scattering debris everywhere. The researcher walks away cursing you. After collecting anything and everything that survived the explosion, you leave the planet.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry and, melting the glacier, release the ship. The researcher gratefully gives you everything that was stored on his ship, except for a couple of fuel cells for the road.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The researcher, realizing that he will otherwise not get out of here, asks to join your crew.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but to no avail. It seems that the ship will only be freed once global warming sets in on this planet. The disappointed researcher walks away.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry, but accidentally damage the ship's reactor. A terrible explosion occurs, scattering debris everywhere. The researcher walks away cursing you. After collecting anything and everything that survived the explosion, you leave the planet.

You open fire on the glacier from your existing weaponry and, melting the glacier, release the ship. The researcher gratefully gives you everything that was stored on his ship, except for a couple of fuel cells for the road.

event.name: DONOR_PONY_6
event.text: You find a person on the planet near a damaged ship. He goes by the name Will, saying that he and his brother ran away from their home to help the Federation in this war, but his brother could not get on board with him... In orbit of this planet, he was shot down by the Rebels, but managed to survive, setting the ship down in a local swamp.

event.name: DONOR_PONY_6_NEXT
event.text: Now Will is trying to at least partially restore the ship to get out of here.

choice.text: Offer Will a place on your crew.
Give him the materials he needs to repair his ship.

event.text: Will repairs the ship pretty quickly, back into working condition, and flies away in the direction of the Rebel Fleet...
...you don't doubt for a second that he will distract them from their pursuit of you.

choice.text: Try to find the needed parts in the nearby landfill.
Kill Will and steal his ship.
Kill Will and steal his ship.

event.text: Will wishes you good luck and waves goodbye as your ship takes off... but what will become of him?
Will agrees to join your crew. After scrapping what remains of his ship, you leave the planet.

event.name: DONOR_PONY_6_M
event.text: He says that he really needs to fix his ship and go on it to fight with the Rebels.

choice.text: Give him the materials he needs to repair his ship.

event.text: Will repairs the ship pretty quickly, back into working condition, and flies away in the direction of the Rebel Fleet...
...you don't doubt for a second that he will distract them from their pursuit of you.

choice.text: Try to find the needed parts in the nearby landfill.
Kill Will and steal his ship.
Kill Will and steal his ship.

event.text: Will wishes you good luck and waves goodbye as your ship takes off... but what will become of him?
You easily get rid of Will and scrap the remains of his ship. All the same, nobody will ever find out what happened...

One of your crewmen manages to eliminate Will, but get mortally wounded by Will in the shootout. After that, you scrap the remains of his ship. All the same, nobody will ever find out what happened...

removeCrew.text: You go to the clonebay with hope, and to your relief, a clone of the lost crew member is ready.

event.text: Realizing your intentions, Will triggers a hidden self-destruct sequence on his ship before running away into the dense forestry nearby... After the monstrous explosion, you collect some debris and then fly away.
You easily get rid of Will and scrap the remains of his ship. All the same, nobody will ever find out what happened...
You manage to eliminate Will, but he manages to damage your ship during the shootout. After that, you scrap the remains of his ship. All the same, no one will ever know what happened...

Realizing your intentions, Will triggers a hidden self-destruct sequence on his ship before running away into the dense forestry nearby... After the monstrous explosion, you collect some debris and then fly away.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_NEW_DECEPTION
event.text: A nearby Slug merchant ship appears and asks for permission to dock.

choice.text: Forbid them from coming near you.

event.text: The Slugs fire a volley from afar but it does not reach you.
The Slugs fire a volley from a distance and it breaches the Weapon Control room!
The Slug captain shows you their wares: "Today we've got an ion disssruptor that doess a whopping 8 ion damage and rechargess quickly, and also an improved modification of the Pernach Beam.
The Slugs quickly make the exchange and undock.
The Slugs quickly make the exchange and undock.
Back on the ship, you notice that the Slugs have stolen some of your resources!
Back on the ship, you notice that the Slugs have stolen some of your resources!
Back on the ship, you notice that a Slug is trying to steal your resources! It's stuck trying to quietly open one of the locks.

escape.text: Now they are charging their FTL Drive!

gotaway.text: The Slugs fled in an unknown direction.

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: After killing all the Slugs, you take one of their weapons.

event.name: SLUG_ART
event.text: Before you is a Slug artillery support ship. They're not going to be willing to negotiate anything.

escape.text: The frigate is charging its FTL engines!

gotaway.text: The Slugs fled in an unknown direction.

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: After killing all the Slugs, you collect everything of value.

event.text: The Slugs are trying to escape through a nearby asteroid field.
You rush at the frigate right into the asteroid field.
You decide it would be better to leave them alone.
The Slugs are trying to hide behind the nearest star.
You rush at the frigate directly towards the red-hot star.
You decide it would be better to leave them alone.
The Slugs are trying escape behind the nearest pulsar.
You rush at the frigate directly towards the pulsar.
You decide it would be better to leave them alone.

event.name: ROCK_BOSS
event.text: Before you is the Rock Flagship — one of the strongest ships in the galaxy.
By ignoring all attempts to get in touch with them, the Rockmen are attacking your cruiser!
The captain of the flagship asks you about your arrival in their home sector.

choice.text: Share your mission and ask for help.

event.text: The Rockmen understand the situation and share with you their supplies.
The Rockmen see your aggression and respond with artillery salvo. Some missiles miss, but some reach your ship.

destroyed.text: You inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value that remains of the flagship.

deadCrew.text: After killing the crew, you collect everything of value.

event.text: In a hidden hold of the flagship you find a huge amount of ammunition and take them for yourself.

event.name: ENGI_ARTILLERY_EVENT
event.text: A nearby Engi ship gets in touch: "We Engi detect virus signatures within our artillery. Recognition system rebooting: friend/enemy. Violation of neural communications. Weapons activated! "
It seems that the virus is forcing the Engi to attack your ship. Perhaps this has come from the hands of the Rebels.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi try to remotely destroy the virus in the artillery.
(Morph Crew Member) Let your Morph try to remotely destroy the virus in the artillery.
(Defense Scrambler) Suppress the unstable structure of the viral interference.

event.text: Your interference generator drowns out the virus, and an Engi goes and removes the malicious code. In gratitude, they give you some of their supplies.

Your Engi successfully locates the infected procedure before the first shot in your direction. In acknowledgment of your deed, the crew of the artillery send over some of their supplies and a hull repair drone to your ship.

Your Engi successfully locates the infected procedure before the first shot in your direction. In acknowledgment of your deed, the crew of the artillery send over some of their supplies and a hull repair drone to your ship.

Your Engi successfully locates the infected procedure before the first shot in your direction. In acknowledgment of your deed, the crew of the artillery send over some of their supplies and a hull repair drone to your ship.
Despite all attempts, your Engi cannot deal with the problem - the virus mutates very rapidly and forces the crew of the artillery to fight you.
Despite all attempts, your Engi cannot deal with the problem - the virus mutates very rapidly and forces the crew of the artillery to fight you.
Despite all attempts, your Engi cannot deal with the problem - the virus mutates very rapidly and forces the crew of the artillery to fight you.

Your Morph successfully locates the infected procedure before the first shot in your direction. In acknowledgment of your deed, the crew of the artillery send over some of their supplies and a hull repair drone to your ship.

Your Morph successfully locates the infected procedure before the first shot in your direction. In acknowledgment of your deed, the crew of the artillery send over some of their supplies and a hull repair drone to your ship.

Your Morph successfully locates the infected procedure before the first shot in your direction. In acknowledgment of your deed, the crew of the artillery send over some of their supplies and a hull repair drone to your ship.
Despite all attempts, your Morph cannot deal with the problem - the virus mutates very rapidly and forces the crew of the artillery to fight you.
Despite all attempts, your Morph cannot deal with the problem - the virus mutates very rapidly and forces the crew of the artillery to fight you.
Despite all attempts, your Morph cannot deal with the problem - the virus mutates very rapidly and forces the crew of the artillery to fight you.

surrender.text: "A critical hit on the virus infected system. Stop! We will cease fire."

event.text: In gratitude, they give you some of their supplies.

destroyed.text: You inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value that remains of their ship.

deadCrew.text: After killing the crew, you collect everything of value.

event.name: ENGI_MINI_SENSORSHIP_EVENT
event.text: The Engi ship before you claims to have a variety of sensor equipment for sale.

choice.text: Attack them while you have the chance.

event.text: The Engi send an angry binary code to you and prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Ask if they can install a sensors system on your ship.

event.text: The Engi agree to do this for 30 scrap.
They take your scrap and install sensors on your ship.
You apologize and leave the beacon.

choice.text: Ask if they can improve your sensor system.

event.text: The Engi agree to do this for 15 scrap.
They take your scrap and improve your sensor system.
You apologize and leave the beacon.

choice.text: Ask if they can improve your sensor system.

event.text: The Engi agree to do this for 25 scrap.
They take your scrap and improve your sensor system.
You apologize and leave the beacon.

event.name: CHEPOCHEM
event.text: The Engi ask you to wait until they prepare the goods.
At last, they emerge with the following proposal.
You pay the price and the Engi transfer the goods into your hold
You pay the price and the Engi transfer the goods into your hold
You pay the price and the Engi transfer the goods into your hold
The Engi nod understandingly and you are asked to wait a little longer. After some time, they bring to you a bound Slug and ask for 35 scrap.
The Slug is grateful to you for liberating them from those terrible creatures and joins your crew.

choice.text: Uh... That's not exactly what we had in mind. Goodbye.

event.text: The Engi lose interest in you. Time to move on.
They are ready to provide a special discount for your Engi on board.
You pay the price and the Engi transfer the goods into your hold.
You pay the price and the Engi transfer the goods into your hold.
You pay the price and the Engi transfer the goods into your hold.
The Engi nod understandingly and you are asked to wait a little longer. After some time, they bring to you a bound Slug and ask for 25 scrap.
The Slug is grateful to you for liberating them from those terrible creatures and joins your crew.

choice.text: Uh... That's not exactly what we had in mind. Goodbye.

event.text: The Engi lose interest in you. Time to move on.
Among the debris you find a surviving scanner.
