destroyed.text: You inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value that remains of the ship.

deadCrew.text: After killing all the crew, you collect everything of value.

event.name: NEBULA_AI_CORE
event.text: Near the beacon through the nebula you notice an unusual Avatar station with a crystal inside. It doesn't look that dangerous, but nevertheless begins charging its only weapon.
Suddenly, the crystal begins to glow brighter, and the station slowly goes into stealth camouflage! If the core charges, combat drones and beam weapons will completely lose sight of the station.
Suddenly everything at the station turns off. It seems to you that it's better not to touch it at this time.

textList.name: AI_CORE_ENDLESSCICLE
textList.text: ...Suddenly there's an Avatar boarding party on your ship!
...It's unknown how some hostile holograms have come aboard your ship!
...The crystal lights up with a bright light, and suddenly you find Avatars on your ship!
...You register a security breach. Intruder Alert!
...Looks like the battle is not yet over! Intruders on board!
...From somewhere you hear the telltale sounds of teleportation! Avatars are attacking!

destroyed.text: You inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value that remains of the station.

event.text: One of the Avatar projection modules isn't badly damaged. After a bit of repair, the Avatar is ready to serve your crew.

deadCrew.text: The Avatar core freezes for a couple of seconds...

event.name: MANTIS_TEST_15_DEADROCK
event.text: A Mantis ship flies right past you.
You stay at their tail, and the Mantis get ready to defend themselves.
Doing a barrel roll right in front of your nose, the ship unfolds and charges up its weapons at the same time.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew Member) Greet them with a member of their own kind.

event.text: Leveling their speed with you, they hail: "We suggest that you pass the Mantis maturity test. This is a grandiose hunt for the ships of the two-eyed stones! Do you agree?"

The Mantis give you the coordinates of the first target: "We'll stay one beacon behind you, checking your performance of the test and assigning new targets. If you miss even just 1 out of the 10 ships, you'll fail the test."
The Mantis call you weaklings and go on the attack.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value remaining from the ship.

deadCrew.text: The crew is dead, so you take everything of value.

textList.name: TARGET_ROCK_TEXT
textList.text: Before you is a ship marked by the aim of the Mantis. You attack.
The target is right in front of you. Without unnecessary questions, you plot an intercept course.
You manage to find the very target of the Mantis, and attack!
The target designation panel lights up brightly — this is the ship you need to take out. The battle begins!

Coming out of the jump, a frowning Rock appears on your communicator. They beat their fist against the wall and shout something to their comrades. You notice their weapons charging — looks like this is the target ship.
The target ship sweeps right in front of you, and you sit at their tail. It's nothing personal — you're just doing a combat mission.
Looks like your appearance interrupted some ritual of fate. In anger, they attack you.
You arrive at the beacon indicated by the Mantis. The Rock ship is in place, and you set out to take them out.
Before you lies a Rock ship. Undoubtedly, this is your target, and you give the order to begin the fight.
The Rock ship is nearby and is your target. You order your crew to attack them.
The Mantis send you a message from a nearby beacon: "Look, there are the stones! Don't miss them!"
You receive a message from the Mantis following you: "The stones are right in front of you! Don't let them go!"

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the second target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the second target.

event.name: QUEST_2TARGET_ROCK
event.text: In the asteroid field, the Rock ship you seek is extracting ore. Seeing you, it immediately activates its weapons.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the third target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the third target.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the fourth target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the fourth target.

event.name: QUEST_4TARGET_ROCK
event.text: The Rock ship is scanning a hot star for some reason. The mark of the target designation unrelentlessly points to it, and so you go on the attack despite the danger.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the fifth target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the fifth target.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the sixth target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the sixth target.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the seventh target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the seventh target.

event.name: QUEST_7TARGET_ROCK
event.text: Near the pulsar, a Rock ship is salvaging the remains of a Mantis ship — your sudden appearance compels them to protect their prey. Not wasting time to unnecessarily converse, they make a volley in your direction, but miss.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the eighth target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the eighth target.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the ninth target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the ninth target.

event.name: QUEST_9TARGET_ROCK
event.text: The Rock ship, which you're instructed to take out, hails: "We know why you're here. Think, maybe you've wrongly embarked on this path? We'll pay well if you don't touch us."
As promised, the Rockmen sends over a bounty, and the Mantis which gave you the task angrily cut off communications indefinitely.
The Rockmen prepare to defend themselves.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the tenth and final target.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value. The Mantis give you the coordinates of the tenth and final target.

destroyed.text: You inspect the debris and collect everything of value from the ship's wreckage.

event.text: The Mantis contact you to give a well-deserved reward for completing the test and proving your worth.

deadCrew.text: The crew's dead, so you take everything of value.

event.text: The Mantis contact you to give a well-deserved reward for completing the test and proving your worth.

event.name: APLUS_BLACK_HOLE_START
event.text: Immediately after exiting the jump your scanners go wild. The reason is found quickly: you are next to a black hole! A backup set of sensors sees some objects right next to the event horizon. What to do?

choice.text: Fly up to have a closer look at the objects.
Don't risk it. Fly away from here. To get out of the gravitational field of a black hole, you need extra fuel!
(FTL Accelerator) Rapidly fly away using your accelerator.

event.text: The FTL Accelerator has no problem dealing with the gravity of the black hole. You're safe.

event.name: APLUS_BLACK_HOLE_FLIGHT
event.text: On approaching them, the monstrous gravity begins to snap off pieces of your ship!

choice.text: It's all the same to continue flight towards the objects.
Fly away from here. No treasures will help us if we are sucked into the hole!
(FTL Accelerator) Rapidly fly away using your accelerator.

event.text: The FTL Accelerator has no problem dealing with the gravity of the black hole. You're safe.

event.name: APLUS_BLACK_HOLE_SALVAGE
event.text: The objects were pieces of a station, which once investigated the black hole. Apparently, they are untouched: nobody searches for scrap in such a place.

choice.text: Good. Now it's time to get out of here.
(FTL Accelerator) Rapidly fly away using your accelerator.

event.text: The FTL Accelerator has no problem dealing with the gravity of the black hole. You're safe.

event.name: APLUS_BLACK_HOLE_ESCAPE
event.text: Supplying additional fuel to the engines, you fly to a safe distance.

event.name: APLUS_BLACK_HOLE_FAIL
event.text: All of a sudden a fragment crashes into your engines, exploding them. Without the engines, you cannot resist the gravity of the black hole, and soon it will squeeze you!

choice.text: Try to throw off all unnecessary weight, hoping to lighten the ship.
(Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi quickly deal with the damage.

event.text: Your Engi quickly repairs the engines.

choice.text: (FTL Accelerator) Rapidly fly away using your accelerator.

event.text: The FTL Accelerator has no problem dealing with the gravity of the black hole. You're safe.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Let your Morph quickly deal with the damage.

event.text: Your Morph quickly repairs the engines.

choice.text: (FTL Accelerator) Rapidly fly away using your accelerator.

event.text: The FTL Accelerator has no problem dealing with the gravity of the black hole. You're safe.

choice.text: (System Repair Drone) Activate your System Repair drone to quickly repair the engines.

event.text: Your repair drone quickly repairs the engines.

choice.text: (FTL Accelerator) Rapidly fly away using your accelerator.

event.text: The FTL Accelerator has no problem dealing with the gravity of the black hole. You're safe.

choice.text: (Repair Burst) Quickly fix up engines with the repair burst.

event.text: The repair burst quickly brings your engines back to working condition.

choice.text: (FTL Accelerator) Rapidly fly away using your accelerator.

event.text: The FTL Accelerator has no problem dealing with the gravity of the black hole. You're safe.

event.name: APLUS_BLACK_HOLE_DROP
event.text: You discard supplies, trying to repair engines and quickly gather speed.
You don't manage to lighten the ship fast enough. The black hole pulls you in...
The ship manages to make it easier so that the power remaining in the impulse engines was enough to fly away from the singularity. You realize in horror that in a panic you threw off all the fuel...

choice.text: Search the ship for fuel reserves.

event.name: APLUS_BLACK_HOLE_NOFUEL
event.text: Fortunately, your pilot says he hid a couple of capsules with fuel "for a rainy day." He gives them to you.

choice.text: (FTL Accelerator) Rapidly fly away using your accelerator.

event.text: The FTL Accelerator has no problem dealing with the gravity of the black hole. You're safe.

event.name: ENGI_HATER
event.text: You come out of a jump near a Mantis ship. They hail you: "The KazaaakplethKilik loyalty mission is to bring home an Engi limb. Do you have an Engi?!"

choice.text: Show that you don't have any.
(Engi Crew Member) Show them your Engi.

event.text: Upon seeing the Engi, the Mantis begin charging up their weapons!

choice.text: Disable the connection and start a fight.

event.text: We don't enter into negotiations. Our strength lies in the power of our weapons, not in the length of our language.
"You're lying! We see your Engi on our scanners!!!" — the Mantis are attacking you.

event.name: ENGI_HATER_TRST
event.text: The Mantis dissatisfyingly click: "...we need the coordinates of where they are!"
The Mantis become aggressive and break off communications, promising to break you in half before leaving.

choice.text: Try to sell them false information.
Give them a random location in the neighboring sector.

event.text: The Mantis get extremely excited and jump towards your coordinates, complacently sparing your crew.
The Mantis give you a portion of their resources and fly off according to your false coordinates.
Your deception did not succeeed. The Mantis become aggressive and break off communications, promising to break you in half before leaving.

destroyed.text: The Mantis ship falls apart, so you collect its remains.

deadCrew.text: After killing all the crew, you collect everything that looks useful..

event.name: CIVILIAN_COREWORLD_STATION
event.text: You exit the jump. On the nearby planet there's a huge civilian trading base, inhabited by tens of thousands of residents... Surely there's something to see here, but don't stay for long — the Rebels will be here soon.

choice.text: Call the locals from orbit and ask if they can give you any help.

event.text: You hear from the communicator a disgruntled rant about beggars, after which the connection breaks off.
You hear from the communicator loud laughter and ironic jokes about your ability to do business.
A small transport ship takes off from the planet and sends you some provisions.
In response, a small orbiting transport ship sends you some provisions.

event.name: CIV_CW_ST_HAIL
event.text: You land on a parking area near the base. Now you just need to decide where to go.

At the entrance, a crewman accidentally steps on some lizard, similar to a monitor, and its owner makes a big deal out of it, raising noise all throughout the platform and promising that her sister in an adjacent sector will set a curse upon you. You quickly move deeper into the stores in search of valuable equipment.

choice.text: Join a volunteer detachment to clean the orbit up of pirates.

event.text: A few minutes later you pinpoint a pirate ship. A station on the planet's surface starts opening fire on it. This'll probably be pretty easy.

choice.text: Have a few drinks at the bar.

event.text: The bar is pretty empty. Only a couple of creatures quietly have some drinks. You think about what to do here...
When you appear, they squeal, but when they find out you're not from around here, they say: "I've really got to get out of here; I'm wanted."

choice.text: Hide them in a crate of alcohol and quietly bring them to your ship.

event.text: Having received symbolic compensation from the local law enforcement, you get ready to fly away from here...
The Rockman tells you: "I won 15 missiles in the lottery. I don't need them, but you look to be someone who might find them useful. Is it a deal or what?"

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) "Convince" the Rockman to make a discount and buy the missiles.

event.text: Your Slug telepathically makes the Rock reduce the price. "Okay, okay, enough already, just take the discount."

choice.text: (Slug Crew Member) "Convince" the Rockman to make a discount and buy the missiles.

event.text: Your Slug telepathically makes the Rock reduce the price. "Okay, okay, enough already, just take the discount."
Having made a profitable deal, you return to the ship.
The bar has a large collection of different creatures. They all glare at you with a dissatisfied look in their eyes, but none of them get aggressive. You think about what to do here...
In the bar, a billiards table was recently set up, and on stage the dancers are circling. You think about what to do here...

choice.text: Entertain the crew with the dancers.
Entertain the crew with the dancers.
Let someone from the crew have a drinking contest with fat Enrique.

event.text: Someone on your crew sits at the table with Enrique with a huge crate of alcohol. "Challenge accepted!" — says Enrique and he begins to drain bottle after bottle... After a while Enrique falls to the floor. You bring him back to your ship and sober him up, after which he declares that he will live with you.

Someone on your crew sits at the table with Enrique with a huge crate of alcohol. "Challenge accepted!" — says Enrique and he begins to drain bottle after bottle... After some time, under Enrique's laughter, your friend falls to the floor. You bring them back to your ship and back to their senses.

Someone on your crew sits at the table with Enrique with a huge crate of alcohol. "Challenge accepted!" — says Enrique and he begins to drain the bottle after the bottle... Some time later, Enrique gets drunk and lets slip from his tongue details about some warehouse nearby. You write down the coordinates and return to the ship.

event.name: CIV_CW_ST_DRINKERS_QUEST
event.text: Enrique did not lie — after landing on the planet, you find the abandoned warehouse and grab everything of value.

choice.text: Your Human notices something in a far corner of the warehouse...

event.text: It turns out to be a tarp... under which you find a weapon. Not bad!
It turns out to be a tarp... under which you find a drone. Not bad!
It turns out to be a tarp... under which you find a mountain of scrap. Not bad!

Your crew is having fun with the local dancers. One of them in a private conversation reveals how you can easily steal from one of the local merchants. You successfully complete this operation and fly away...

Your crew is having fun with the local dancers. One of them in a private conversation reveals how you can easily steal one of the local arms dealers. You successfully complete this operation and fly away...
Your crew is having fun with the local dancers. After a private dance, one of them suggests taking a friend of theirs into the crew.
Your crew is having fun with the local dancers. After resting, everyone returns aboard to their rooms.

Your crew is having fun with the local dancers. However, you notice that a crew member has been gone for a long time! Searches and local inquiries don't turn up anything... you realize they must be gone for good...

removeCrew.text: You take a hopeful trip to the Clone Bay, and to your relief a clone is already prepared for the lost crew member. Upon questioning them, they say they can't remember anything.

event.text: You don't have a crew, so there is no one for the dancers to entertain, but you can sit in the bar for a while...
You place the entry bet and start the game. The locals play badly enough, and you easily win...
Taking your prize money, you return to the ship.
You place the entry bet and start the game. No matter how hard you try, all the balls miss the pockets. After your defeat, the locals treat you to beer.
You find a local Rockman, who isn't against drinking with you. Upon learning of your mission, they pat the box upon which they were sitting and give it you. In it you find a number of warheads.
You find one of the local technicians. After learning about your mission, they give you a number of drone parts.
You find one of the local repairmen. Upon learning of your mission, they get out their welding machine and fix some damage to the ship. Just a bit, but nice anyways!
You sit down to one of the bar's regulars and chat about the latest events. The half-drunk creature eventually says that they want to save the Federation, and asks to join your crew.
You have a word with the local drunks, and they tell you about the nearby beacons.
You talk to the local drunks, but they don't give you any useful information.

Someone from your crew pushes one of the bar's regulars, and provokes a fight! Having broken mountains of furniture and having received a heap of bruises, you leave the bar, imperceptibly taking a metal statue of some local prince...

Someone from your crew pushes one of the bar's regulars, and provokes a fight! Having broken mountains of furniture and having received a heap of bruises, you leave the bar, imperceptibly taking a couple of iron chairs...

Someone from your crew pushes one of the bar's regulars, and provokes a fight! Having stuffed a few alien faces, your crew relaxes at the game tables, and one of the local drunkards asks to join your crew.
Someone from your crew pushes one of the bar's regulars, and provokes a fight! Suddenly, one of the drunkards takes out a firearm and shoots a crew member in the head... You need to get out of here!

removeCrew.text: You take a hopeful trip to the Clone Bay, and to your relief a clone is already prepared for the lost crew member.

event.text: You push one of the bar's regulars, and provoke a fight! Having broken mountains of furniture and received a heap of bruises, you leave the bar, imperceptibly taking a metal statue of some local prince...
You push one of the bar's regulars, and provoke a fight! Having broken mountains of furniture and received a heap of bruises, you leave the bar, imperceptibly taking a couple of iron chairs...
You push one of the bar's regulars, and provoke a fight! Having stuffed a few alien faces, your relax at the game tables, and one of the local drunkards asks to join your crew.

You push one of the bar's regulars, and provoke a fight! Suddenly, someone picks up a stool and knocks you out with a blow to the head... When you wake up, you return to the ship, but find that you were robbed!
You brilliantly perform the operation to transport the fugitive, and having received a passionate kiss from Drebin in gratitude, prepare to jump...

You brilliantly perform the operation to transport the fugitive, and having received a passionate kiss from Drebin in gratitude, prepare to jump... Suddenly you're intercepted by a patrol ship — you'll have to return fire!
While transporting the fugitive, you are caught by a Zoltan patrol. They arrest Drebin and demand that you leave at once!

choice.text: Try to free the fugitive by force.
Bribe them to release the fugitive.

event.text: You release the fugitive, and the Zoltan patrol looks over your bribe.
You wonder what will become of Drebin...
During the shootout Drebin dies, and the patrol sits at your tail!
During the shootout Drebin dies, and the patrol sits at your tail!
You manage to free Drebin, but the patrol sits at your tail!
Pretty drunk, your crew make a drunken brawl, after which everyone's kicked out of the bar.
After drinking a lot, you doze off. When you regain consciousness, you realize that you've wasted a lot of time.
Ordering the famous Zoltan grog, you talk with one of the locals, and they divulge to you information about nearby beacons.
Regaining consciousness after falling drunk aboard the ship, you find a weapon in the hold. When you question your crew about where it came from, none of them can give you an intelligible answer...

Regaining consciousness after falling drunk aboard the ship, you find someone in the pilot's cockpit. With their charisma, they persuade you that now they've taken control of the ship for themselves, and now you are their assistant on the way to saving the Federation.

event.name: MEGADEATH
event.text: On a nearby planet you find the ruins of a huge fortress that belonged to the ancient civilization that created the HAL.
Once you land, you approach immense gates, decorated with ornaments.

choice.text: (Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . |--X--X . X--X--X

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . |--X--{ . X--X--X

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--~--X . |--X--{ . X--X--X

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--~--X . |--X--{ . X--}--X

choice.text: Don't stay here and fly away.

event.text: Once you land, you approach immense gates, decorated with ornaments.

choice.text: (Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . {--X--X . X--X--X

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . {--X--| . X--X--X

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--}--X . {--X--| . X--X--X

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--}--X . {--X--| . X--~--X

choice.text: Don't stay here and fly away.

event.text: Once you land, you approach immense gates, decorated with ornaments.

choice.text: (Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . X--X--X . X--~--X

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . X--X--{ . X--~--X

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . }--X--{ . X--~--X

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--|--X . }--X--{ . X--~--X

choice.text: Don't stay here and fly away.

event.text: Once you land, you approach immense gates, decorated with ornaments.

choice.text: (Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . X--X--X . X--|--X

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . X--X--} . X--|--X

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--X--X . ~--X--} . X--|--X

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Scan the entrance to the fortress.

event.text: A few minutes of scanning allow you to detect hidden symbols: symbols: . X--{--X . ~--X--} . X--|--X

choice.text: Don't stay here and fly away instead.

event.name: MEGADEATH_CHOICE1
event.text: It would be impossible to search everything. You'll have to choose a direction to go in.

choice.text: Search the northern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of debris of other ships and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the southern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find many boxes of ammunition and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the western part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of drone parts and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the eastern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of fuel tanks and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

event.name: MEGADEATH_CHOICE2
event.text: It would be impossible to search everything. You'll have to choose a direction to go in.

choice.text: Search the northern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find many boxes of ammunition and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the southern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of debris of other ships and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the western part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of fuel tanks and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the eastern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of drone parts and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

event.name: MEGADEATH_CHOICE3
event.text: It would be impossible to search everything. You'll have to choose a direction to go in.

choice.text: Search the northern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of drone parts and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the southern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of debris of other ships and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the western part of the ruins.

event.text: You find many boxes of ammunition and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the eastern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of fuel tanks and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

event.name: MEGADEATH_CHOICE4
event.text: It would be impossible to search everything. You'll have to choose a direction to go in.

choice.text: Search the northern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of fuel tanks and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the southern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of drone parts and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the western part of the ruins.

event.text: You find a lot of debris of other ships and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

choice.text: Search the eastern part of the ruins.

event.text: You find many boxes of ammunition and bring them to your hold. Already leaving the planet, you notice that a lone "asteroid" is unamicably targeting you with its missile barrels...

destroyed.text: The strange opponent breaks apart, and you collect a few remaining bits of debris.

event.text: You're about to fly away when a crewman draws your attention to a strange asteroid fragment. Turns out it's some unusual kind of drone! You take it before leaving.

event.name: HALCYON_EVENT
event.text: You exit the jump near a strange looking station around which a pirate ship is circling, methodically firing at it. It seems that the station possesses no weaponry with which to defend itself.
You approach the pirates, and they switch their attention to you.
You decide that this battle will probably cost you dearly, and fly far away.

destroyed.text: The pirate ship breaks apart, and you collect a few surviving fragments. The station thanks you, explaining their defenselessness by the fact that its main fleet flew away to fight some kind of Chruuls. In gratitude they completely repair your ship.

deadCrew.text: Now that all the ship's crew is dead, you gather everything of use from it. The station thanks you, explaining their defenselessness by the fact that its main fleet flew away to fight some kind of Chruuls. In gratitude they completely repair your ship.

event.name: NEBULA_BOSS_HACKER
event.text: In the nebula you catch a glimpse of a passing ship. You recognize its familiar hacker insignia, but are unable to see any more details.
You overtake the ship ahead of you. To your surprise, it turns out to be a dreadnought! Maybe it was a better idea to remain undetected?..

choice.text: Hide and wait until they fly away.

event.text: Fortunately, they don't notice you. After waiting a little longer just to be safe, you start preparing to jump.

destroyed.text: The hacker dreadnought's broken, and you collect its wreckage. In the scrap heap you manage to find a surviving weapon.

deadCrew.text: The hacker crew's dead, and you send a crew to collect its spoils. Among the heaps of scrap, a crewman finds a surviving weapon.

event.name: TRADERS_3_AUGMENTS
event.text: You exit the jump near a small Federation trading station. Docking right next to your ship's airlocks, one of the enterprising traders comes out to meet you and tries to sell you some of their goods...
They show you a few ship augmentations.
You transfer the augment to your ship and then finally go to the station's trade floor.
You transfer the augment to your ship and then finally go to the station's trade floor.
You transfer the container to the ship and then finally go to the station's trade floor.

choice.text: Decline these offers and depart for the trading platform.

event.text: The trader still bothers you for a while, and then switches to some other buyer. It's time to see how rich the station is.
They show you a few ship augmentations.
You transfer the augment to your ship and then finally go to the station's trade floor.

event.name: TRADERS_3_MERCENARY
event.text: You exit the jump near a small Federation trading station. A mercenary ship slowly flies towards you, offering you to hire one of them into your crew.

choice.text: We are not interested in these proposals.

event.text: Politely thanking the persuasive mercenaries, you depart towards the trading station.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.
While the new crew member familiarizes themselves with the ship, you go shopping.

event.name: ROCK_ESCORT
event.text: You meet a small Rock transport at this beacon. They don't appear to be armed, and can become easy prey.
As soon as you start showing signs of aggression, an escort ship appears out of camouflage next to them and starts targeting you with its weaponry!
You stay away from the Rockmen, and soon they fly away.

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Scan the space around the rock ship.

event.text: Just as you expected, the Rock ship isn't so defenseless after all. A little bit behind them awaits a heavily armed escort ship hidden by stealth camouflage.
As soon as you start becoming aggressive, the escort ship targets you with its weapon array.
You stay away from the Rockmen, and soon they fly away.

destroyed.text: While you were fighting, the Rock freighter managed to flee. You inspect the ship's wreckage, and grab all that looks useful.

deadCrew.text: While you were fighting, the Rock freighter managed to flee. You inspect the ship's holds, and grab everything of value.

event.text: You find a surviving bomb weapon! What luck!

event.name: SLUGS_IMITATOR_EVENT
event.text: You come across a Slug ship with a strange armament. Having seen you, they joyfully hiss and turn on a weapon which shuts down both ships' engines. Soon after, your crew ceases to understand which room they're in...

destroyed.text: The enemy is destroyed, and you collect the ship's wreckage. Meanwhile, your engines return back to normal.

deadCrew.text: The Slug crew's dead, and you loot their ship's holds. Meanwhile, your engines return back to normal.

event.name: SLUGS_IMITATOR_WEAPON
event.text: You hesitantly look at a Slug weapon that survived the battle. What's its use if it disrupts the operation of engines, including your own?
You find the weapon to be worthless and find it more worthwhile to dismantle it for scrap.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi see what they can do with it.

event.text: Your Engi delves into the inner workings of the weapon, and in the end they manage to modify it. Unfortunately, its system simulation modules had to be abandoned, resulting in a not bad stunner.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Let your Morphs see what they can do with it.

event.text: Your Morph delves into the inner workings of the weapon, and in the end they manage to modify it. Unfortunately, its system simulation modules had to be abandoned, resulting in a not bad stunner.

event.name: PROTOTYPE_COLLECTIONER
event.text: Near the beacon you find a small Federation orbital trade station. At the entrance you meet a strange person in a dark cloak. They open it right in front of your crew and a crewman backs away in fright. Underneath the cloak, you see some pictures of unusual and rare weaponry. The person explains to you that they've been looking for so-called "prototypes" for a long time and are ready to pay well for them.

choice.text: Tell them you don't have any such weapons, and just go to the trade platform.

event.text: The strange person nods in recognition and then disappears into the shadows.

choice.text: Rudely refuse by showering them with vulgar language.

event.text: Frowning, the strange person says something on a radio, and you are expelled from the trade station.

choice.text: (Prototype) Allow them to inspect your prototype for a price.

event.name: PROTOTYPE_COLLECTIONER_DEAL
event.text: The person offers to pay you double what the merchants at stores will give you for the weapon.

choice.text: (Prototype) Sell your damaged Zolton beam prototype.
(Prototype) Sell your damaged Zolton beam prototype ™.
(Prototype) Sell your damaged Zolton beam prototype €.
(Prototype) Sell your damaged Zolton beam prototype ‡.

(Prototype) Tell them that you don't want to sell your injected prototype, but are willing to exchange it for another one.
Tell them that you've changed your mind.

event.text: The person disappointedly moves away from you.

textList.name: WEAPONS_PROTOTYPES_SOLD
textList.text: The strange person says something on their radio, and soon their people bring a large a pile of scrap before taking your prototype. You successfully make your way to the trading floor.

choice.text: (Prototype) Exchange your damaged Zolton beam prototype.
(Prototype) Exchange your damaged Zolton missile prototype.
(Prototype) Exchange your damaged Light Crystal prototype.

textList.name: PROTOTYPE_TRADE_TEXT
textList.text: The strange person says that the exchange is possible, before showing their goods.

textList.name: WEAPONS_PROTOTYPES_TRADED
textList.text: You make a profitable exchange and, happy, go to the trading floor.

textList.name: WEAPONS_PROTOTYPES_DECLINE
textList.text: You thank the stranger, but refuse the deal. Frustrated, they step aside, letting you into the store.

event.name: ENGI_EVO
event.text: At first glance, the beacon is empty. However, soon you are contacted by a hidden Engi station, identifying you as an ally of the Federation. You get an invitation to dock.

choice.text: We don't have time for this.

event.text: The Engi station goes into stealth mode.

event.name: ENGI_EVO_ENTER
event.text: Going inside, you find yourself in a huge laboratory. Everywhere there are terrariums with strange life forms. The Engi show you a prototype of "Ever-17", which they plan on using to accelerate the creatures' development, but they don't have enough power to operate the device for a long enough time.

choice.text: You doubt you can help them. Prepare to leave!
Offer to connect it to your ship's reactor and stay here for the duration of the experiment.

event.text: The Engi estimate the capacity of your reactor and say that it is too weak. You leave the station with mixed feelings.

choice.text: Offer to connect it to your ship's reactor and stay here for the duration of the experiment.
(Zoltan Crew Member) Offer to connect the prototype to your Zoltan.

event.text: The Engi connect the Zoltan, and Zoltan illuminates fully in order to speed up the process, but can't withstand it, and at the end of the experiment they overload and explode...

removeCrew.text: The Zoltan appears reborn in your ship's clonebay.

choice.text: (Zolton Crew Member) Offer to connect the prototype to your Zolton.

event.text: The Engi connect the Zolton, and Zolton illuminates fully in order to speed up the process, but can't withstand it, and at the end of the experiment they overload and explode...

removeCrew.text: The Zolton appears reborn in your ship's clonebay.

choice.text: (Backup Battery) Offer to connect it to your backup battery.

event.text: The Engi connect it to the backup battery, but the battery runs out faster than the experiment ends.
The experiment fails. Still, you helped the Engi very much, and they thank you with some supplies.

choice.text: (Battery Charger) Immediately turn on the battery charger.

event.text: You have time to turn the battery charger back on just in time to continue, and the experiment ends with success. The Engi synthesize a young Crystal from a blue oyster and offer you to take them with you.

choice.text: (Advanced Backup Battery) Offer to connect it to your backup battery.

event.text: The Engi connect the device to your backup battery, and the experiment ends with a success. The Engi synthesize a young Crystal from a blue oyster and offer you to take them with you.
During that time, while the Engi take your help and finish the experiment, the Rebel Fleet approaches ever closer to you. The Engi don't stint on giving you a reward for your help.
Fortunately, the experiment ends sooner than you expect. The Engi don't stint on giving you a reward for your help.
Fortunately, the experiment still ends with success, and the Engi synthesize a young Crystal from a blue oyster. You take them aboard in place of the dead Zoltan.
The experiment failed. As an apology for the death of the Zoltan, the Engi give you some supplies.
Fortunately, the experiment still ends with success, and the Engi synthesize a young Crystal from a blue oyster. You take them aboard in place of the dead Zolton.
The experiment failed. As an apology for the death of the Zolton, the Engi give you some supplies.

event.name: ENGI_MONSTER
event.text: As you jump in you're hailed urgently by an Engi science vessel in the distance. "We propose that you don't see the creature." There's nothing on the scanner, which is when you realize you can't see the creature because you're inside it!

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Try to scan the monstrosity.

event.text: Right before the FTL Drive gets a chance to start charging, you detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. The signals are amplified and become sharper and sharper. It's time to get out of here!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!
You detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. Could the creature be communicating? You forward your observations to the Engi vessel and they, flying closer, thank you in turn.
You detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. The signals are amplified and become sharper and sharper. It seems that the monster is not too happy with your presence!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!
You detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. Could the creature be communicating? You forward your observations to the Engi vessel and they, flying closer, thank you in turn.
You detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. Could the creature be communicating? You forward your observations to the Engi vessel and they, flying closer, thank you in turn.
You detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. Could the creature be communicating? You forward your observations to the Engi vessel and they, flying closer, thank you in turn.
You detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. The signals are amplified and become sharper and sharper. It seems that the monster is not too happy with your presence!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!
You convince your crew that you'll manage to get out of here, the main thing is to not panic!

surrender.text: The warning system registers multiple bogeys closing in on your position, and the Engi ship quickly makes an FTL jump! It seems that this is a response from the monster's immune system!

event.text: You reconfigure the ship's engines to work in the unusual environment.
It also becomes clear that the drones aren't able to function in this environment.

surrender.text: The warning system registers multiple bogeys closing in on your position, and the Engi ship quickly makes an FTL jump! It seems that this is a response from the monster's immune system!

event.text: You reconfigure the ship's engines to work in the unusual environment.
It also becomes clear that the drones aren't able to function in this environment.

surrender.text: The warning system registers multiple bogeys closing in on your position, and the Engi ship quickly makes an FTL jump! It seems that this is a response from the monster's immune system!

event.text: You reconfigure the ship's engines to work in the unusual environment.
It also becomes clear that the drones aren't able to function in this environment.

event.name: ZOLTAN_BOSS_EVENT
event.text: You encounter a huge Zoltan dreadnought, armed to the teeth. They scan your ship and request communication. Be careful when responding to their hails if you don't want to provoke them.
It seems that they are interested in your super shield bypass technology. They ask you to let their engineers study it.
Looks like your refusal has offended their ways. How else can you explain their sudden aggression?

They take quite a long time to understand the principle behind your augmentation. Finally satisfied, they return to their ship. "Thanks to you, now we know how to protect ourselves from this super-shield bypass. Take this as a courtesy." One of the Zoltans is called to guide you through their sector and gives you a map of the terrain.

They take a long time to understand the principle behind your augmentation. Finally satisfied, they return to their ship. "Thanks to you, now we know how to protect ourselves from this super-shield bypass. Take this as a courtesy." One of the Zoltans is called to guide you through their sector and gives you a map of the terrain.

event.name: ZOLTAN_BOSS_NO_BYPASS
event.text: The Zoltans ask what you are doing in their sector. Your crew starts to get nervous...

choice.text: Do we need a reason to be here?

event.text: Evidently, they don't accept that as an answer, and start charging their weapons.

choice.text: (Human Crew Member) Let your Human tell them about your mission.
(Order Human Crew Member) Let your Order Human tell them about your mission.
(Engi Crew Member) Let your Engi tell them about your mission.
(Zoltan Crew Member) Let your Zoltan tell them about your mission.

event.text: Your human stutters and nearly faints when the Zoltans hurl an onslaught of questions at them. It seems that they don't believe them... You are finally convinced you sent the wrong person for diplomacy when you see their weapons aimed at you!

Your human stutters and nearly faints when the Zoltans hurl an onslaught of questions at them. Nevertheless, they treat you with understanding and send some supplies to help; no Rebel sympathizers here.
The Engi are allies of the Zoltans, so they treat your crew member kindly. Learning of your mission, they send you some supplies; no Rebel sympathizers here.
The Engi are allies of the Zoltans, so they treat your crew member kindly. Learning of your mission, they send you some supplies; no Rebel sympathizers here.
The Engi are allies of the Zoltans, so they treat your crew member kindly. Learning of your mission, they send you some supplies; no Rebel sympathizers here.
Your Engi tells them of the importance of your mission, but this isn't enough for the Zoltans. After some discussion, they decide that it is wiser to destroy you.
The Zoltan feel confident among one of their own. Learning of your mission, they send you some supplies; no Rebel sympathizers here.
The Zoltan feel confident among one of their own. Learning of your mission, they send you some supplies; no Rebel sympathizers here.
The Zoltan feel confident among one of their own. Learning of your mission, they send you some supplies; no Rebel sympathizers here.
The Zoltan feel confident among one of their own. Learning of your mission, they send you some supplies; no Rebel sympathizers here.
Your Zoltan speaks about the importance of your mission, but their compatriots say that isn't enough. After some discussion, they decide that it is wiser to destroy you.
"You did not pay the entrance fee to our sector." They transmit to you the required amount.
They immediately point their weapons at you.
They scan you for a while, and then lose interest in you. Looks like they've gone away.

event.name: ZOLTAN_BOSS_PAY
event.text: You pay the fee and prepare to fly away when they hail you back.
"Wait. According to our rules, you are supposed to be accompanied. " You take aboard the Zoltan.

event.name: ZOLTAN_BOSS_PASS
event.text: They brighten up, literally as well: "Then show it to us right away."

choice.text: Offer them some scrap as the permit.

event.text: They are satisfied with your "pass", and you can move on.

choice.text: Tell them you were just joking about the permit.

event.text: Unfortunately, they don't find anything funny about it at all. Prepare to fight!

destroyed.text: The dreadnought explodes into pieces, and you collect everything left of value.

event.text: Among other things, you find a shield drone schematic that survived the battle and a box with the inscription "The Great Zoltan Code of War".

deadCrew.text: With all the Zoltans dead, you scour the dreadnought.

event.text: Among other things, you find a shield drone schematic that survived the battle and a box with the inscription "The Great Zoltan Code of War".

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX
event.text: You activate the small box, and above it a holographic image of a Zoltan appears, and the speakers begin to play recorded information...

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_S
event.text: You press the box's red button and something inside burns to a crisp. All that's left is a piece of scrap.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_1
event.text: #RECORD-155. The Great Zoltan Code of War.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_2
event.text: #155.1.1. The first person is the Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Zoltan Navy. #155.1.2. Orders given by the Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Zoltan Navy must immediately be executed, and his statements to be accepted as absolute truth. #155.1.3. Any living organism that opposes the will of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief is subject to subjugation. #155.1.3a. If the opposer will not bend to the Supreme Commander-in-Chief's will, they will be subject to liquidation. #155.2.1. Slave trade in Zoltan sectors is prohibited (trading intelligent living beings against their will).

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_3
event.text: #155.2.1a. The prohibition of slave trade is temporarily rescinded if martial law is declared. #155.3.1. Colonization of any planets is strictly forbidden unless the colonization is carried out by Zoltans. #155.4.1. It is forbidden for any terraforming operations to begin prior to obtaining the consent to terraform from all of the planet's inhabitants. #155.4.2. Forced relocation is only allowed if less than 1% of the population disagrees with the terraforming. #155.5.1. Once martial law is declared, every Zoltan ship possessing weaponry must report to the Zoltan Fleet for further instructions.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_4
event.text: #155.6.1. The decision to declare martial law (in critical or ordinary times) is made at the Zoltan Council. #155.6.2. There must be at least 200 councilors. The necessary level of unity in the decision — 100%. #155.7.1. Every Zoltan citizen has the right to self-determination, productive work, support and respect for Zoltan society. #155.8.1. Every Zoltan citizen must comply with all the rules of all existing codes and regulations. #155.9.1. No creature belonging to another race can become a citizen of the Zoltan society.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_5
event.text: #155.9.1a. The Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Zoltan fleet can give the status of "citizen" to a being of another race. #155.10.1. A citizen of the Zoltan society can freely leave and return to the territories of the civilian sectors, provided that a report is made about the path taken and the events that have occurred. #155.11.1. The extraction of raw materials and other commodities in the Zoltan sectors is only permitted with a license. #155.11.2. Any materials obtained in the Zoltan sectors without the respective license shall be fined at twice the value of the materials.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_6
event.text: #155.12.1. Listening to and possessing the "Great Zoltan Code of War" is permitted only in the presence of a representative of the Zoltan race. #155.12.2. It is forbidden to copy or distort any of the information stated in this code. #155.13.1. In the event of encountering an enemy invader, a Zoltan ship is obliged to conduct a standard clean-up procedure. #155.13.2. Equipment obtained as a result of the clean-up procedure must be delivered to the head of the Zoltan Fleet.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_7
event.text: #155.13.3. If it is impossible to carry out the procedure, a tactical retreat is permitted with the subsequent transfer of pertinent information to the head of the Zoltan Fleet. #155.14.1. Any transit transport operations through the Zoltan sectors must be inspected. #155.14.2. In the event of a ship refusing an inspection, it is equated with a hostile invader. #155.14.3. As a result of inspecting a ship, it is permitted to confiscate any equipment included in the list of prohibited technologies. #155.14.4. Zoltan patrols are not obliged to explain to anyone (except the Zoltan leadership) the motivation behind their actions.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_8
event.text: #155.15.1. Any trade actions that lead to the deterioration of the Zoltan economy are forbidden. #155.15.2. It is forbidden to transport any alien equipment to the Zoltan sectors without going through customs. #155.15.3. When traveling through the Zoltan sector, a representative of the Zoltan race should be aboard. #155.15.4. In the absence of a representative of the Zoltan race, movement must be carried out at minimal engine thrust, with shields and weapons disabled. #155.15.5. If the trajectories of two ships intersect, Zoltan ships have the priority (in case of a dispute — whichever ship has the larger mass).

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_9
event.text: #155.16.1. Every living organism has the right to life. #155.16.1a. Any living organism, newly discovered by the Zoltan race, is necessarily placed in cryostasis in the general library of species conservation. #155.16.2. A living organism that violates (or tries to violate) the right of life of another living organism loses its right to life. #155.16.2a. The destruction of another living organism within the framework of this Code's provisions shall not deprive the violater the right to life.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_10
event.text: #155.16.3. Any intelligent living organism has the right to be heard by the head of the Zoltan Fleet. #155.16.4. It is forbidden to carry out experiments on intelligent living organisms within the Zoltan sectors. #155.16.5. In case of violation by a reasonable living organism of the paragraphs decreed in this Code, it is transferred to the category of unreasonable living organisms. #155.16.6. Unreasonable living organisms are to be registered to an appointed master (who is responsible for their behavior) and only have the right to life. #155.16.7. If a living organism threatens the lives of other organisms with aggression, it is permitted to liquidate it.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_11
event.text: #155.16.7a. A living organism under mind control is not considered responsible for any of their actions. #155.16.8. The murder/kidnapping of any representative of the Zoltan race is punishable by death. #155.17.1. Every ship in the Zoltan sectors that violates the rules of this Code is obliged to proceed to the sector's leadership who will decide on its future fate. #155.17.2. When crossing the border of the Zoltan sectors, each ship must go through identification procedures and obtain permission to fly.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_11_A
event.text: #155.17.3. Any ship that is in the Zoltan sector without official permission is equivalent to an enemy invader. #155.17.4. It is forbidden to analyze the performance of or disassemble any Zoltan equipment. #155.17.5. It is forbidden to scan without expressed permission any Zoltan stars, planets, asteroids, ships, stations, shells and wreckage.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_12
event.text: #155.17.6. Any ship with pirate insignia on board is considered an enemy invader. #155.17.7. In the event that the crew of a pirate ship proves their allegiance to the Zoltans, they will receive help. #155.17.8. In the event that the military situation becomes critical, the Zoltan Fleet must support any ships operating in their military interests (irrespective of the equipment being carried by the ship).

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_13
event.text: #155.17.8a. Corrective list of technologies allowed in the Zoltan sector (in the presence of all accompanying documents): ion weapons (all classes), beam weapons (all classes), bomb weapons (all classes), missiles weapons (energy consumption no more than 3 units of energy), Zoltan shielding, any Zoltan shield generators, laser weapons (only small and medium-sized). #155.17.8b. The minimum aid from the Zoltan Fleet is equal to 5 fuel cells.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_14
event.text: #155.17.8c. An attempt to doubt the competence of the Zoltan leadership is equated with profound disrespect and insult. Such behavior towards the Zoltan race must be eradicated throughout the Galaxy. #155.17.8d. In the event that the ship never agreed with the Zoltan race in any of their jumps in the Zoltan sector, the ship is equated with an enemy invader. #END OF RECORD-155.

event.name: EVENT_ZOLTAN_CODEX_END
event.text: You press the red button on the box and the device starts transmitting the sector map to your navigator. When the process is completed, you take apart the box for scrap.

You ship them some fuel, but after that the civilian ship makes a sharp maneuver and starts charging up their weapons! From the corner of your eye, you notice an unpainted part of the ship's hull with Rebel coloring! Those devious deceivers!
Looks like they didn't expect such hostility, but are nonetheless preparing to defend themselves.

choice.text: Apologize, wish them luck, and move on.

event.text: "Well, we understand everything. Hopefully, the next ship will help us..."
"If you don't want to cooperate in an amicable way, then we'll force you to do it the hard way..."

event.name: DECEPTICON_EVENT
event.text: In orbit of the planet near the beacon is an abandoned space dock with the remains of various ships. A giant drone sits at its center, constructed from several automated scouts. The drone is deactivated, but appears ready to activate at any moment.

event.name: DECEPTICON_EVENT2
event.text: You find the dock's control panel, but you need to somehow unlock the docking unit and adjust the lift module to your ship. You apply power to the panel and then try to figure out how to get it to work.
You realize too late that this was an automated drone control panel, not a dock control panel! The huge ship switches on and sends itself towards you.

You realize too late that this was an automated drone control panel, not a dock control panel! The huge ship switches on and sends itself towards you, and the sensors detect ASB guidance directed at you!

You realize too late that this was an automated drone control panel, not a dock control panel! The huge ship switches on and sends itself towards you. The next moment, a powerful burst of energy disables your shields!

choice.text: Don't take any chances and leave this place.

event.text: Now isn't the best time to experiment with unknown equipment. You prepare to leave.

choice.text: (Engi Crew Member) Try to start the console in safe mode.

event.text: Your engineer enables safe mode, and the drone immediately activates. Fortunately, in this mode, part of the drone's shields are disabled.

choice.text: (Morph Crew Member) Try to start the console in safe mode.

event.text: Your engineer enables safe mode, and the drone immediately activates. Fortunately, in this mode, part of the drone's shields are disabled.

choice.text: (Human Crew Member) Request fire support from the planet.

event.text: You're in luck, the allied ASB from the planet agreed to support you. Intercepting your communications, the drone activates and mounts an offensive.

choice.text: (Order Human Crew Member) Request fire support from the planet.

event.text: You're in luck, the allied ASB from the planet agreed to support you. Intercepting your communications, the drone activates and mounts an offensive.

destroyed.text: Destroying the drone, you go to the dock for scrap.

event.text: You put a pile of scrap in your holds. The dock still has quite enough ships to scrap to make another pass, but the Rebels will approach you during this time.
You grab another pile of scrap and place it aboard your ship. It's time to fly away now.

choice.text: (Mantis Pheromones) Your crew can pick up scrap faster under the pheromones.

event.text: Without wasting too much time, you take another pile of scrap to your ship. It's time to go.

choice.text: Fly away without wasting any time.

event.name: EVENT_FEDHELP
event.text: You meet a colorless drone. It throws a container of fuel in your direction and says: "I am programmed to help allies of the Federation. Specify the goal, and I will go on a quest, assessing the chance of success."

choice.text: Ask to find scrap. [Chance of success — 80%]

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.

choice.text: Ask to find scrap. [Chance of success — 75%]

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.

choice.text: Ask to find scrap. [Chance of success — 66%]

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.

choice.text: Ask to find scrap. [Chance of success — 50%]

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.

choice.text: Ask to find a weapon. [Chance of success — 80%]

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.

choice.text: Ask to find a drone. [Chance of success — 50%]

event.text: You enter the coordinates of the next meeting place and prepare to jump.
The drone goes into combat mode!
You decide that you can do without such support...
You wait for a while, but the allied drone does not appear at this beacon. Apparently, something went wrong...
You meet again with the allied drone. It reports: "Captain, the task was successfully completed. Here is what you requested."
The drone goes into combat mode!

choice.text: Thank the drone and move on.

choice.text: Thank the drone and move on.

escape.text: Looks like the drone is trying to escape!

gotaway.text: The drone made an FTL jump...

event.name: EVENT_PIRATE_DREDNOUT
event.text: You suddenly find yourself next to a pirate dreadnought. From their communication, you understand that they were just looking for a target to test their newly built ship on, and your ship is great for this!

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the debris, and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: With the pirates killed, you take away everything of value.

event.name: CRYSTAL_STATION_EVENT
event.text: At some distance from the beacon lies a Crystalline station.

choice.text: Ask them for help in your mission.

event.text: The station immediately reacts to your actions by activating its numerous systems. Slightly aside, you notice an established gravitational trap and try to avoid it during the fight...
The Crystal aboard your ship convincingly asks you not to show any aggression. This place is something of a shrine to them...

choice.text: Ask them for help in your mission.

event.text: Who knows what they have in mind. You decide to get out of here before they get aggressive towards outsiders.
You ignore your Crystal and attack the station.
Unfortunately, you fail to notice the gravitational trap established near the station, and fly into its field at full speed...
Who knows what they have in mind. You decide to get out of here before they get aggressive towards outsiders.
You contact the ancient race and beg them for help. The Crystals finally take pity on you and sent something of value. Not bad!
You contact the ancient race and beg them for help. The Crystals finally take pity on you and sent something of value. Not bad!

You contact the ancient race and beg them for help. The Crystals are extremely irritated by your brazen request and give only a single fuel cell, so that you can fly away from here as soon as possible.
You contact the ancient race and beg them for help. The Crystals are extremely annoyed by your brazen request and go on the attack.

You contact the ancient race and offer to make a profitable trade. After many centuries of isolation, the Crystals are very reluctant to deal with other species, but in this case they agree to your offer and open up their store.

You contact the ancient race and offer to make a profitable trade. After many centuries of isolation, the Crystals are very reluctant to deal with other species, but in this case they agree to your offer and open up their store.

You contact the ancient race and offer to make a profitable trade. The Crystals refuse to fully serve you, but one of the enterprising representatives of their race quietly tries to sell you their equipment.
You quickly sink what you just purchased into your hold and prepare to jump away.
You quickly sink what you just purchased into your hold and prepare to jump away.

You contact the ancient race and offer to make a profitable trade. The Crystals refuse to fully serve you, but one of the enterprising representatives of their race quietly tries to sell you their equipment.
You quickly sink what you just purchased into your hold and prepare to jump away.

You quickly sink what you just purchased into your hold and prepare to jump away.
You quickly sink what you just purchased into your hold and prepare to jump away.

destroyed.text: After destroying the station, you grab all that survives...

event.text: ...and you make a few passes.

deadCrew.text: After clearing out the station, you grab all that survives...

event.text: ...and you throughly search the ship, finding among the troves of scrap, a surviving weapon!

event.name: EVENT_CIV_STATION
event.text: In orbit of the planet near the beacon lies a Federation station. The station happily informs you they have several supply options for your mission...
The captain curses you for betraying your allies and gives the order to fight.
You decide to leave as soon as possible, before it's too late.
The captain of the station sends you a list of available options now, and you decide what is best for you...
They refuel your fuel tanks and patch up your hull.
They give you a drone schematic and wish you good luck on the road ahead.
The captain of the station sends you a list of available options now, and you decide what is best for you...
They give you the requested supplies and wish you good luck on the road ahead.
They give you the requested supplies and wish you good luck on the road ahead.
The captain of the station sends you a list of available options now, and you decide what is best for you...
They give you the requested supplies and wish you good luck on the road ahead.
They give you the requested supplies and wish you good luck on the road ahead.
The captain of the station sends you a list of available options now, and you decide what is best for you...
They give you the requested supplies and wish you good luck on the road ahead.
The station's engineers carry out a complete repair operation on your ship's hull.
The captain of the station sends you a list of available options now, and you decide what is best for you...

choice.text: Request scrap to upgrade the ship.

event.text: They give you the requested scrap and wish you good luck on the road ahead.

choice.text: Request a bit of each supply.

event.text: They give you the requested supplies and wish you good luck on the road ahead.

destroyed.text: After destroying the station, you grab all that survives...

deadCrew.text: After clearing out the station, you grab all that survives...

event.name: NEBULA_EVENT_ROCKSLUG_CRASH
event.text: Some ships are flitting about directly ahead of you, but you can't see them through the dense nebula gases.

event.name: EVENT_ROCKSLUG_CRASH
event.text: Near the beacon you see two ships which collided, one Slug and the other Rock. Both ships are badly damaged, but still able to function. You intercept communications of a fierce dispute about who is to blame for what happened.
You wedge yourself between the two and demand an explanation of what happened here. Each captain claims that the other captain slammed into their straight course after exiting the FTL jump.

choice.text: (Slug Captain) The Slug Captain telepathically informs you that they will give fuel if you side with them in the dispute.

event.text: FTL - not for cheaters! You lose some of your dishonestly earned supplies, and the ship next to you suddenly becomes hostile!

choice.text: Side with the Slug in the dispute.
Side with the Rockman in the dispute.
(Engi Crew Member) Send them your Engi for repairs.
(Morph Crew Member) Send them your Morph for repairs.
(System Repair Drone) Send them a repair drone [-1 |].
(Hull Repair Drone) Send them a repair drone [-1 |].
(Hull Repair Burst) Repair them with repair bursts [-4 }].

event.text: The Slugs and Rockmen, seeing your actions, stop arguing and defend themselves.
You decide to leave as quickly as possible, before something bad happens.

You explain to the Rockmen that they violated the rules of safe jumping in the sector and now have to pay the Slugs as reparations. The Rockmen reluctantly agree, and the Slugs quietly hand you fuel and scrap.

You explain to the Rockmen that they violated the rules of safe jumping in the sector and now have to pay the Slugs as reparations. The Rockmen reluctantly agree, and the Slugs quietly hand you fuel and scrap.

You explain to the Rockmen that they violated the rules of safe jumping in the sector and now have to pay the Slugs as reparations. The Rockmen reluctantly agree, and the Slugs quietly hand you fuel and scrap. Upon learning of your mission, one of the Slugs offers to join your crew.

You quite confusedly explain to the Rockmen that they are to blame for the crash. With each of your words, the Rockmen and Slug get angrier and angrier, and finally decide to dismantle your "tub" into pieces...

You explain to the Slugs that they violated the rules of safe jumping in the sector and now have to pay the Rockmen as reparations. The Slugs resist for a long while, but finally pay, afraid of you. The Rockmen send you some ammunition and scrap as thanks.

You explain to the Slugs that they violated the rules of safe jumping in the sector and now have to pay the Rockmen as reparations. The Slugs resist for a long while, but finally pay, afraid of you. The Rockmen send you some ammunition and scrap as thanks.

You explain to the Slugs that they violated the rules of safe jumping in the sector and now have to pay the Rockmen as reparations. The Slugs resist for a long while, but finally pay, afraid of you. The Rockmen send you some ammunition, scrap, and one of their soldiers as thanks.

You make an argument in favor of the veracity of the Rockmen, but the Slugs keep managing to come up with loopholes in civil laws to hide behind. Enraged by all this empty talk, the Rockmen decide to fire at your ship!
The Morph cleverly repairs the systems of both damaged ships and stiches together what breaches there are. In gratitude you are given some useful equipment.

The Morph cleverly repairs the systems of both damaged ships and stiches together what breaches there are, however, suddenly a block of metal debris between the two ships crushes your Engi... Despite the accident, you are given some useful equipment.

...you also happen to find one of the surviving weapons of this strange ship.

You decide that it makes no sense to talk with pirates, and direct your ship for an attack.
You decide to get out, before you get taken into slavery yourself.

deadCrew.text: After clearing out the ship, you grab all that survives...

event.name: EVENT_FED_DAMAGEDGOHOME
event.text: You find a Federation vessel near the beacon. An Avatar is the sole survivor aboard. They show you the logbook data. This ship's research mission fell into a temporal anomaly near a black hole. Someone programmed the Avatar to move the ship to their home Federation station, and then they closed themselves in stasis pods in order to survive the anomaly's effect. Unfortunately, the ship's inner clock shows a few centuries have passed, and all the crew died... Now the Avatar needs fuel and an escort to the Federation station, and in return you can grab all the scrap from the ship.

choice.text: Agree to escort them, and give them fuel.

event.text: You give the Avatar some fuel, and enter the Federation station's coordinates on the map.
Seeing a weak ship, you immediately dive right into battle, because a victory is guaranteed!
You decide not to interfere with this and fly away.
The Avatar is reprogrammed to render you assistance. Your communications array intercepts a message from the ship — "Long Live the Federation!"
You successfully escorted the damaged Federation research vessel to its base station. Command thanks you and says that sensor equipment survived aboard the ship and can be installed on your ship...
You install the new system on your ship and prepare for departure.
You upgrade the system and prepare for departure.
The system cannot be upgraded any further. You break the new equipment down into scrap.
You quickly scrap what was presented to you, and prepare for departure.

choice.text: Decline the offer and attack the station instead.

event.text: "Traitors!" is the last thing you hear before the connection breaks off...

event.name: NEBULA_BORDER_PDS_AFTERBATTLE
event.text: An Elite Rebel ship comes out of the nebula right in front of you. You immediately give the order to fight.

surrender.text: Suddenly, a Federation battlecruiser appears nearby. They help you by shelling the enemy with armor-piercing rounds.

destroyed.text: The battle is over, and you grab what you can find from the ship's remains.

deadCrew.text: The battle is over, and you strip the Rebel ship's holds.

event.name: EVENT_ETG_TRADER
event.text: Near the beacon you meet a merchant ship. They hail: "Welcome, Captain. I am a representative of the Elite Trade Guild. We can provide a wide range of services and products at good prices. If something interests you — please, but don't try to joke, you're within range of an ASB."

choice.text: Ask in detail about their services and products.

event.text: "Activate the Anti-Ship Battery targeting!.." — is heard from the communicator as soon as you begin your attack.
You decide that it's safer not to enter into negotiations with suspicious ships.
Here is our "menu" for today:
"Activate the Anti-Ship Battery to seize the target!.." — is what you hear from the comms as you launch your attack. At the same time, an assault squad boards your ship.
You break off communications and get ready to leave.
Here is our "menu" for today:

escape.text: You notice the enemy's FTL Drive is charging. Looks like they're not going to continue the fight.

gotaway.text: The ship made an FTL jump in an unknown direction...

surrender.text: Suddenly you receive a transmission from the trader: "Take it and we can part peacefully!"

destroyed.text: You quickly collect everything that survived the battle while simultaneously dodging the ASB.

deadCrew.text: You quickly rob the merchant ship's holds while simultaneously dodging the ASB.

event.name: EVENT_TR_FED_MISSILES
event.text: Near the beacon you encounter a Federation transport vessel. Its captain happily greets you, saying that they've heard about your mission. You're offered a free supply package, but for an additional fee they can give you a bit more. What do you think?
You start charging up your weapons, despite the fact that it's a Federation ship. Command wouldn't approve of this act...
You grab the free missiles and move on.

choice.text: Take the free package and an extra set of supplies.

event.text: You grab the free missiles and pay for extra missiles, and then move on.
You decide not to risk it and, declining to approach them, just charge up your FTL Drive.

escape.text: You notice that the ship is charging their FTL Drive. Looks like it's trying to escape!

gotaway.text: The ship made an FTL jump in an unknown direction...

destroyed.text: You quickly collect everything that survived the explosion.

event.text: You also uncover the warheads in transportable containers that survived the explosion.

deadCrew.text: With the crew of the ship eliminated, you quickly rob the ship's holds.

event.text: You also find warheads in transportable containers.
